description:
Very solid entry in the "where's real pizza lottery" that is San Francisco.

Crust is fairly thin and very good. Toppings are fresh and tasty. The oven is clearly cranked up to 11 and the crew means business. 

Someone told me the crew came from Blue Plate, which is a smart bistro where I've never had any pizza, so know that pivots aren't just for startups.

One important thing to note is that this is in the outer sunset near the coast and that means that if you're not near the 10 usual suspect neighborhoods that reliably have good food options and instead you are in the vast landscape of residential row houses (pacific style) that undulates across the dunes that swallowed Carville, then you're in luck! You have found a superb dinner option of kick-A pizza. 

If you're looking online you might see a menu that references pizza sizes of 14 inch and 20 inch. Be aware that in the case of 20 inch, that is a measure of the ultimately boxed pie's radius, not its diameter as you might assume.
author: Craig S.

description:
Nowhere in the 4 corners of SF will you find a pizza place that can do a cheese pizza justice like here.  Reminds me of a NY slice and for $4 it's worth it!  The crust, let me tell you, thin like it should be, ask for well baked and it's pretty great!

Will continue my pizza adventures here indefinitely.
author: Byung K.

description:
Its not the most amazing but I do keep coming back! I normally come here after long walks around the richmond and sunset side of town and end up grabbing way too much food for my own good and treat myself to a whole spaghetti and meatballs, a slice of pizza and diet coke. 

The margherita pizza is decent and they put tons of basil which I like. I love a good pizza, but the crust is whats most important to me and this pizza doesn't have quite a crust that I look forward to eating but I still eat it. Its on the thinner more dense side. 

I love the pasta though...it reminds me of elementary school pasta. Probably not a good compliment but nostalgic food is always a winner. Literally just noodles with three meatballs and two slices of garlic bread. I have an affinity for noodles and this hits the spot. Plain cooked noodles with red sauce just poured on top as if your grandma spiced up a jar of Preggo. 

I know i'll be back!
author: Nats S.

description:
Worst take out service ever. Was told it would be an hour. They dragged out to an hour and a half with some story about a flood of orders coming in after mine that pushed back my order. Woman in front of me was also told an hour and ended up waiting at least an hour and a half. Never eating here again. FAIL!!! 
Oh, after the hour and a half, I told them to give it to me however it was and the pizza was only half baked at that point.
author: Kevane W.

description: Worst pizza place ever.  Called in order.. was took it would be an hour, no problem.  When arrived they said another 15 minutes.  So we waited, 20 mins later still no pizza.. they said it will be soon, so we paid. 10 minutes later still no pizza.  No pizza is worth 2 hours... NEVER AGAIN!
author: Janice w.

description: What a terrific find! Large slice of pizza by the slice at great prices with excellent choice toppings. Crust reminded my husband and I of pizza in Italy...light, fresh, warm and tasty. Order the Santa Cruz Tempranillo wine too. We sat at the bar and had friendly service.
author: Laura P.

description: Dank.  This is what a California pizza joint near the beach should look, feel, and taste like.  It's not the best pizza of all time, nor is it the best value.  But the food is really, really good.  Great variety.  Good beers.  TVs with sports.  Good music.  Super chill vibe.  Go here.  Often.
author: Michael S.

description:
I was craving pizza. When it came time to pick a spot for dinner, I decided to try The Pizza Place. I placed our delivery order on Sunday, December 17th at 5:46pm through DoorDash. It arrived at 6:51pm. We live in Outer Richmond.

*Buffalo Wings: Gluten free, Spicy, chicken wings tossed in buffalo sauce, served with celery stalks, baby carrots and blue cheese dressing or ranch ($9), Large (+ $6)
*The Dimitri: Sausage, zoe's pepperoni, garlic, mushroom, tomato sauce, and cheese ($22.50 for 14" Pizza)
*Cheese: Pizza by The Slice ($4) - Fresh Basil (+$0.50), Mushrooms (+$0.50), Roasted Garlic (+$0.50), Vegan Pesto (+$0.50)

I really love places that deliver pizza by the slice, so that's the main reason I chose this spot. I'm a lover of variety, so any time I want pizza, I always want a meaty one and another one with pesto. The slice I ordered was a good size. I actually cut it in half and it fed me twice. The roasted garlic was amazing, but it did make the slice super oily. I didn't mind since I love fatty food, but it might be too much for some people. It's good to note that they cannot do slices without red sauce as the pizzas are the pre-made cheese ones and they just add toppings. The dmitri was yummy as well. I adore a good meat and mushroom pizza, so this hit the spot. And it was a good size as the roommate and I made about three meals out of the pizza. The buffalo wings were standard. Though they gave me one blue cheese and one ranch when I indicated ranch. Oh well, we had ranch at home so it wasn't a big deal.

This spot definitely fulfilled my pizza craving. It looks like their pizza by the slice has gone up a dollar, but I would still consider ordering from them again. Especially if I'm by myself. That way, I can get a couple different slices. Yum!
author: Elena N.

description: Love tho Pizza Place! So delicious I'm very impressed with the pizza here delicious yummy food. The place is always busy so that tells you slot I also love the wings and the  kale salad. Can't wait to go back !
author: Rosemarie D.

description:
First of all, this restaurant advertises a "traditional brick oven" which is completely false. What they're using is a stainless steel gas igloo/dome type furnace. 

Moving along, I ordered the garlic cheese bread, medium margarita pizza and a large half besto and half sunset aloha.  Why those two sizes? Those are your only options per my phone order. 

Garlic cheese bread was ok. No garlic taste and no cheesy taste but the bread was decent and portions were fine for the price.

The margarita pizza was a joke. When they handed me the box, I looked at it and had to ask if this was just a cheese pizza. They don't use fresh sliced tomatoes ... their alternative was tomato sauce.

The besto and sunset aloha were good but the slices were a bit too big to hold. The toppings would slide off. I'd ask them to double the the pizza to more manageable slices.

This pizza joint is so-so at best... 

Bonus review: their website claims authentic New York style pizza. False too.
author: Ian C.

description: Good pizza, terrible service.  Wait is always long.  Servers have no sense of hospitality, tables remain unclean for many minutes after patrons leave, the waitlist/host situation is a consistent mess.  Not worth showing up, unfortunately take out us also disorganized.
author: Frank P.

description: Tried to eat here with my family just now, but it was too crowded to get a table so we opted for take out. We were looking over the menu waiting to place our order when the female Asian server rudely told us to move away from the counter. We were just waiting to order pizza, but I didn't appreciate her attitude so we left. Shame...I was looking forward to trying their pizza.
author: Rosa T.

description: This is my favorite place for pizza in San Francisco. Great New York-style pizza, amazing wings, and friendly service.
author: Heather O.

description:
The pizza place is pretty good. I've been here a good amount of times and I'm surprised the ratings aren't as good. I usually just make my own slice of pizza and pick a few toppings, one slice is enough for me -my boyfriend gets 2. 

It can get busy on the weekends and there is a wait sometimes but never too bad. Last time we went on a weekday we got seated right away. 

Good pizza! Cool atmosphere with all the Santa Cruz boardroom skateboards. Excited to go back again :)
author: Hayley D.

description:
I really wish I could give zero stars for the lack of service I received from this place.
I came in on a Monday night (around 7pm) looking to buy two slices of cheese pizza and they told me that I would have to wait because they have to serve the people dining in first. I'm a really patient and understanding person but in all honesty, I have NEVER waited 25-30 mins ANYWHERE just for TWO SLICES OF CHEESE PIZZA. To make things worse, one of the workers here was extremely rude when I was standing near one of the tables, he literally snapped at me and was like "can you get out of the dining area?" lol someone clearlyyyy doesn't know what customer service is...my pizza was also pretty disappointing too, it was stale and hard to eat. I think I'll stick to my other frequent pizza shops because this place clearly has no idea how to be attentive towards customers.
author: Cee H.

description:
Awesome staff, awesome food. If you don't like this place, go to the Marina. They have overpriced, not as well prepared food, there for you. 

Love the Iceberg, the Joe's, and the Andy. Best Wednesday's ever. I would eat here everyday if I could.
author: Colin M.

description:
Ordered the 1/2 Rotten Robby and Dimitri. Tasty and flavorful but super greasy. The pizza would have easily gotten a 5 Star if it wasn't so greasy. The paper lining was drenched with oil and that was a turn-off. 

Not sure if it's a repeater for us.
author: Nance L.

description:
Some of the best wings
Ever; Slamming grinders too
Star in the Sunset
author: Brian J.

description:
Huge slices!  Nice choices and worthy to share a full pie if you are inclined. 
Yummy salads and warm olives. Wine good and staff fantastic. Can get busy so come and chill.
author: K H.

description: Good pizza. TERRIBLE SERVICE. Waited over an hour for 2 pizzas. The waitress felt bad and gave us drinks on the house. There's no organization in the kitchen. It appears that they play to-sham-bo on the next order. Management needs to wake up.
author: Brenda W.

description:
I remember this spot when it was "Dean's Deli" back in the day. However, I'm glad whomever took over the spot turned it into a hot spot and brought some good buzz to this quiet neighborhood.

I've had pizzas mainly to go a few times and wasn't disappointed. Service can smile in my opinion but nonetheless attentive. The crusts of these pizzas are on point and overall quite good. Go for the margarita pizza on thin crust, if they still have it, it's superb!

Parking can be annoying as it is a residential area, but the 7 and 18 stop right there and of course it's walking distance for nearby residences like myself.
author: Hala A.

description: I just had my last irritating experience here. They are sooo rude here. I'm on hold for 16 mins to order food togo and I get hung up on. I call back I get put on hold immediately without being able to say a thing and I wait another 10 mins and get hung up on again. Every time I order It takes twice as long and they screw up the order. Why!!!
author: Keli D.

description: I took my mom here last week but my fiancé and I have been here before. Same experience. We like that it's near our house - walking distance so if we're too lazy to cook, we head here. There aren't many options to eat on this block but the Korean which is meh and the burger joint - their mushroom burger and lamb burgers are good! We try to switch things up so we come here and support the Pizza Place sometimes. The service was fast since we came at 5:30pm on a Monday. The place is kid - friendly so that part is nice. The staff service is decent - most of the people working here are typically young but they pay attention. We ordered the Large Make your Own Pizza without realizing it will cost us $36! Whoa! The crust wasn't as crispy as I was hoping for. The ingredients (toppings) were also not as tasty. A bit disappointing. The French fries though - surprisingly delicious! Or maybe because I haven't had French fries in a while. I'll definitely order it again. Overall, I'll give it a solid 3. I'd still come back here if I want something quick. It's close by and decent.
author: Anna Y.

description:
It is my second time visit. First visit was bad, well maybe it was a bad day for them. Decided to try again, and experience was even worth.

Waited for 45 min to get our order, then had to ask where is it. Answer "we are sorry , it seems like your order was lost, it will be another 45min".


Kids were really impatient and hungry....  no one had even offered anything for kids.... 

Never ever again.
author: Ahmed R.

description:
I've been to The Pizza Place a couple of times now and overall, I'd say it's MEH. 

There are some qualities about this place that I really dig (i.e. the amount of creative pizza combinations and choices, especially for vegetarians!), but the pizza overall isn't too extraordinary. Slices are thin-crusted, portions are large. I usually get a medium pizza to split between two and that's worked out pretty well. I really like the Besto pizza -- pesto and potatoes. The veggie pizza was ok, I wasn't too into the bell peppers on it. Prices are decent; ~$20 for a medium pizza. 

This place is actually really large also. It's got tons of table and ample seating. There's also a bar right in the front. The staff is really friendly and overall the restaurant has pretty chill vibes. It's within walking distance of Ocean Beach so ya know surfer vibes! LOL. Also the restaurant is decorated with a ton of Simpsons themed decor. It's interesting. LOL. Overall solid place for pizza, but nothing too extraordinary.
author: Amy T.

description: I came here and ordered two slices of pizza and I'd have to say hands down the best slices I've had in the entire Bay Area. Highly recommended!!
author: Bryan D.

description: This place is trash! Mad long wait and the staff is super rude! This is the worst pizza I've ever had
author: Brandon B.

description: This is my local Pizza spot that I frequent regularly. I can't remember the last time I had to walk out of a place after being ignored for 20 min at the bar and watching other groups that arrived later have their orders taken.
author: Mike G.

description: Whoever gave this place a poor rating is probably a San Franciscan and therefore has poor taste in pizza. This place makes an excellent, unpretentious classic New York slice.
author: Bitzy F.

description:
This is our go to pizza place for both pick up and sit down. At first I thought that crispy potatoes/potato chips on pizza was crazy, but now I'm super hooked. All time favorite pizza from them is their Aloha one- pineapple is the greatest topping in the world and pairing it with coppacola and feta is brilliant. When we're super hungry we'll get a pizza AND their spaghetti and meatballs (homemade meatballs yummmmm).

They also have a great beer selection on tap and an awesome community vibe. We love bringing friends and family here to chill over beers and watch sports. 

I do wish they were a little less expensive, but I wish that about pretty much everywhere in San Francisco...
author: Kalina K.

description:
This review is purely about Cindy, the Cruise Director/GM for the Pizza Place. 

It's very unfortunate to have such a person as a head of this place. I wanted to book a party on Sunday in June for early, early afternoon for 30-40 people, and I know for sure this place can accommodate parties of such size as I have been at a few. I have submitted a request on line, Cindy sent an email to me asking if I wanted a sitting party. I did tell her I'd prefer a sitting one to which she replied she couldn't accommodate my party. I sent two emails back to her asking to call me back as I'd be fine with a standing party as well as it's pizza after all. She has never responded. I stopped by the place, but she wasn't there; thus, I left a note for her to call me back. She never did. Well, someone else will have my business as it wasn't good for her. Where is a good customer se vice these days? Cindy, as I said, it's unfortunate you are holding this position at The Pizza Place; I wish it was a better one as the pizza and staff are nice. I hope you have someone over you who can t a huge and guide you how to treat customers. It's unprofessional not to respond to emails and messages. Regardless what an outcome would have been, the least you should do is to respond vs silencing customers out. It's a shame!
author: V G.

description:
I live close by here and always see people coming in and out of this pizza place. I called & ordered the demitri in 14 inches. The worker said the pizza would be ready in 30 mins. The total came out to be 22.29$ with tax.

-When I picked up the pizza, I expected it to be warm but I guess they're not the type of restaurant to heat your pizza while you come pick it up.

-The pizza is really oily. Like other yelpers, my mother found their sausage to be salty.

-I saw a guy making salad, and maybe the workers should try wearing gloves or having a sense of cleanliness. It's not sanitary if they deal with money with their bare hands and cook with their bare hands too.
author: Erica K.

description:
*** NOTICE ***

I love this place, but be aware that they recently changed their hours. They're no longer open for lunch on Monday-Thursday. I wish they had updated the hours on their website before we took an Uber all the way out to Ocean Beach yesterday.

*****************
author: Geoff S.

description: This place is really good! They offer a vegan pizza which has a pesto sauce, fresh baby tomatoes, caramelized onions and potato chips! Along with a few other veggie toppings. The crust is always good too! On the expensive side though
author: Brittany M.

description:
Pizza was pretty good; we ordered a medium half besto & veggie. The veggies side got pretty soggy which made it even harder to eat with the mass of toppings. The besto was pretty delicious, but maybe it's because it's hard to go wrong with pesto. The bottom didn't exactly go soggy, it was just really oily. Overall the pizza was like a 3-3.5 because the cruzt was super on point and the flavors were alright. I was also slightly stoned still so it could've been why it tasted so good. 

Also, there's this super cute guy that works there and he gets five stars from me (hence the 4 star overall) Pizza waiter, I hope you see this, I'll be coming back for you! And the pizza, too.
author: Holly P.

description:
It seems like just the other day I would come here for the pizza and stay for the Eddie Money. But now ...it's all just a bittersweet memory. 

After one of those topsy turvy humdrum days, I was looking forward to Wine Wednesday. Alas, it was not meant to be. They were still advertising Wine Wednesday today on Instagram, but when I went in, it was canceled with no explanation. 

First, they came for the Chile Pork Verde. Then they came for the Antipasta plate. Then the PBR drafts went from 3.00 to 4.50. And now Wine Wednesday--oh, Wine Wednesday, we hardly knew yee--was unceremoniously canceled without a care or concern for the customer. It was a lapse of pizza etiquette that went too far. 

We had some good times, Pizza Place aka Pizza Palace aka I Love PIzza aka I Love Spaghetti aka Ye Old Spaghetti Factory aka My Living Room. But ... the dream is over ...  

Now all I have left are the memories. "I've got two tickets to paradise, pack your bags, we leave tonight ..."

All we are saying is give pizza (and Wine Wednesdays) a chance!

Update: It looks like they brought Wine Wednesday Back!!!

Update: 12/23/2017. This is an update written at the urging of Yelp HQ. the Star rating has been reduced from 4 to 1. 

After writing the above humorous review, I did not go back to the Pizza Place for approximately two months. At the urging of employees, who missed my presence, and my friends who go there, I returned to the Pizza Place to celebrate my birthday on October 20th. As soon as I sat down, one of the owners came up to me and verbally assaulted me, basically unloading a stream of anger in front of everyone. It was completely abusive, and entirely retaliatory for the positive Yelp review (which was, at that time, 4- stars). Among much else, he shouted "no more yelp reviews" over and over again. Then he said: "you can sit there, but you are no longer welcome in this establishment." And then walked away. I said nothing (there was no room to get a word in edgewise, even if I had wanted to). I just sat there, dumbfounded at how I was treated. I got up and left. Who wants to patronize an establishment whose owners don't want you there?

I was (and still am) in shock and disbelief that any owner of any restaurant would behave this way. It is important to say that my friend, who was there to help celebrate my birthday, was a witness to the verbal assault and abuse that I was forced to endure (on my birthday).

I have lived in this neighborhood for 20 years. After this incident, I consulted with local business owners and managers who I have known a long time (and who know the kind of person I am). They confirmed with me that this particular owner has a history of doing the same thing (verbally haranguing others) in other local establishments. It is so severe, he may not even know what he is saying or doing. This reminded me of a prior incident with this particular owner in which a rep for a local brewery was sitting at the bar and told me how much he loved this place and had always wanted to meet one of the owners. He asked me if I knew any of them. I called this same owner over by name and introduced him as my friend and ... a stream of obscenities came out of the owners mouth: at me and at the beer rep. The beer rep gulped his beer down and left. I was embarrassed for him. I blew it off because I knew this owner as someone else. Someone who would never behave this way towards anyone. I had no idea he had changed.

I left any negative details out of my initial review. I don't like to focus on the negative, I like to create, so I wrote a humorous, quirky review full of inside jokes (the kind we all knew from the initial days of Yelp when it was about meeting up with people in bars and restaurants in real life). One thing I left off the review was that when Wine Wednesday was canceled, I asked the server tending the bar why that was done: he had no idea. The same owner who verbally harassed me on my birthday was standing right there. He had adopted a totally agro stance (the same he used in his verbal assault) and was looking at me like: "go ahead, say something." I remembered what had happened with the beer rep just a few weeks earlier and just drank my beer (instead of ordering food, which is why I was there) and left. It was later that night that I wrote my humorous, faux melodramatic review. I never, in a million years, expected it to turn into a real melodrama (like from high school or middle school).

I guess I should add, I have been giving this establishment 1/3 of my paycheck for years.

Speaking solely for myself, I will never set foot inside this establishment again.
author: Rob T.

description: They get pretty busy and sometimes it's a longer wait than we have patience for, but besides their pizza I really LOVE their meatballs.  For $2.50 a piece (each meatball) it is pretty pricey for the size, but I really LOVE their meatballs.  Did I mention that I LOVE their meatballs?  Yup.
author: Emy B.

description: I live in outer sunset and I love it. The Dimitri is my favorite for approx. $6 a slice. Overall, chill and laid back atmosphere and staff are attentive and friendly. It's a homie neighborhood pizza joint. There's also an outdoor area in the back that is nice on warmer days. Recommend checking it out if you're in the area.
author: Joyce P.

description:
This pizza place right here is without question my pizza spot.

Why?

Can I simply say, "Because I said so,"

or

"How dare you question my ability to determine what is and what is not my pizza spot"

and be done with this review?

If so, I'm super glad some of you readers are so easily satisfied with the "Because I said so" kind of reasoning.

But if not and you really want some particulars, I'll go ahead and list some of the whys below.

First of all, the pizzas are super sized awesome, and there's always something more intrinsically delicious when bigger pizza is involved: more toppings, more cheese, more grease which means more flavor . . . all good.

Second, it completely embodies what a neighborhood pizzeria should be (with an SF twist (did you say local organic?  okay maybe not totally local organic but the creative combos are for sure SF)).  To paraphrase a line from Inside Out, thank you SF for your tasty take on pizza.

Lastly, whether you're just wanting to grab a brew and catch the game or really in the mood to gorge on an extra spicy Rotten Robbie, The Pizza Place is where to go.
author: Dan B.

description: I am surprised by some of these low ratings. Great pizza, friendly staff, casual...can't ask for more!
author: Bogee B.

description:
Not sure why they insist on calling it the Pizza Place. Everyone I know calls it I Heart Pizza. Anyone else?  

Anyway, it's good. Nuff said. Buy your pizza pies here.
author: Derrxck L.

description: Best pizza on planet Earth!!! From gluten free to the best damn pizza pie you'll ever eat. If you want bomb pizza go here, it'll be crowded but relax it's worth it.
author: Shelby S.

description:
i've walked by here a lot and have seen it consistently crowded, so i finally wandered in one day. do note that it gets crowded very quickly, especially if there are big groups. there were 2 massive families there when i went, and my party was lucky to score a table.

the fries were pretty darn crispy, and they go down easy. i know, i know, it's a pizza place, but if you're craving fries, they aren't bad.

we got some sort of meat pie, and the rocha (kale, roasted garlic, potato chips, bacon). i was kind of disappointed by the rocha. i liked the kale (if you don't like kale... don't order this pizza), the roasted garlic was melting and sweet, the bacon was crispy and porky. but the potato chips were too much. i found them to be too salty since there was already bacon, and i felt a little deceived anyways since the menu says "crispy potatoes," which i incorrectly interpreted as sliced roasted potatoes (pizza antica in san jose has a potato pizza, and i was thinking the rocha would similarly have potatoes on top). the crust was okay, but nothing to write home about.

tl;dr: get here early bc it fills up fast, the pizza is fine but not my favorite.
author: Heather F.

description: This is one of the most authentic pizzas in the city. It's not pretentious and wears its heart on its sleeve. Order a slice of the Dimitri and try to disagree.  Sit back have some beers after paddling for hours at ocean beach or just come here when you are hiding from the lines and droves of tech robots in the city proper.
author: Max G.

description: I've ordered several times from this place before and liked it, but tonight I ordered delivery through Grubhub and it came one hour late (after I called to check on the order), lukewarm, and was literally shoved into my hands at the door by a hasty driver without apology. Will think twice before ordering again. Will update if restaurant offers a refund/discount or if I order again.
author: Michelle F.

description: This is an awesome neighborhood spot! Big old school style pies. They have gluten free and dairy free options. Good beer on tap (and pitchers). Super family friendly. Very casual. A favorite stop in the Sunset.
author: Urban S.

description:
This has to be my absolute favorite new spot in my new neighborhood! I adore the dressed down decor(read: tons of skateboard, surf & surf memorabilia). The staff is welcoming and down to earth too. It can get a little busy/wait on nice beach days and weekends so be prepared. They go to go orders too, so keep that in mind and don't show up ready to eat at the busiest times!

The pizza is great! Fresh ingredients, perfect crust, amazing custom pies.(some of the names are funny, our waiter said they were named after people in the neighborhood) I have thoroughly enjoyed every type I have tasted so far. They do slices as well if you are wanting to see how one of the custom pizzas(Pizzi??)is before you buy a whole one. Great selection of salads and appetizers/snacks to boot. Beers on draft and great wines too. 

SO YUMMY, SO HAPPY
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Great local pizza place! 

Large pie is generous in size. Local hang out feel. 

The Dimitri is my fav
author: TC C.

description:
Great pizza! Super crowded so we opted for take out. 

Enjoyed a couple of beers and the sweet potato fries while waiting. The sweet potato fries were awesome! Baked not greasy and still had a light crisp on the exterior.

Will definitely be back!
author: Liz N.

description:
Seriously great pizza. Crust is perfect and thin and not soggy or greasy. The demitri is awesome. Nice crumbly sausage not the chunky frozen kind. 
Only negative was the service. There basically was none. We had to ask for everything. 
Place had a good neighborhood vibe to it so if you have the time or want to catch a game it's perfect. Otherwise get it to go.
author: Danielle H.

description:
When I'm craving delicious, no frills pizza, this is the place I go to! The pizza is always great!We get a large pizza, and it just never disappoints! Its perfect for a night in with a movie. 

Normally I order takeout, but the atmosphere seems like your typical casual sports bar kind of place.
author: Larissa S.

description: Love this pizza place. They sell whole pies or by the slice. Came here on a Saturday afternoon and grabbed a slice and a beer. Relaxed atmosphere, feels like a family business. Haven't had a bad slice yet.
author: Jackie J.

description:
been going here w/ family for ~10 years now. 
tonight was the first time they screwed up (half) an order, so me and the kid got to eat our preferred half, with the Mrs. having to wait for her half.
They were apologetic, made it right. The pizza was excellent as usual. The staff ruled AS USUAL...this place is STILL the best! Love this place.
...and we have a 9-slice pizza in our fridge, cuz of all the leftovers.
author: Jubilee D.

description: Sorry to leave this review but feel like I have to - friend and I went there for lunch on 4/7/17. Had the spinach salad and slices of meat pizza. Around 1am I was throwing up cause of food poisoning. I called my friend the next day and he was also sick from what we ate. Its the first time I've been to this spot, my friends been there a bunch. I dont think they will get repeat business from me. I get that mistakes happen but I was out of commission all weekend.
author: Jason B.

description: Favorite place on the whole block. I've gone there for 2 birthdays and a graduation party. Staff is always willing to accommodate large parties if possible. Family friendly, causal, nice staff, AMAZING wings, and huge pizza slices. I love the homemade ranch and blue cheese wing dipping sauce.
author: Jenae M.

description: This was possibly the worst service i've ever experienced! i went to use the restroom before purchasing a beverage. A man aggressively knocked on the door after being told by my friend waiting outside the door that there was someone in there, as he was continuously knocking i opened the door. he said he had to use the restroom badly and then asked if we were even costumers, i ignored him due to how disrespectful he was and approached the front of the restaurant where i could purchase. I came to the realization that the man happened to work there and was talking to the other coworkers. A coworker forced a menu into my hands and the other man, who was knocking, was viciously staring at me while i was examining the menu, making me uncomfortable. I then put the menu down and left, and once I did, the man who knocked decided to yell "beat" multiple times as I walked out. moral of the story is this place is extremely unprofessional and i didn't get the chance to try the food due to their severe disrespect, but the food is probably as terrible as their service. fuck this place lol:-)
author: Lily H.

description: This has been our go-to pizza in SF.  We're from NJ so the bar is set high.  Hadn't been there for several months.  They've raised their prices to a ridiculous level.  We had a medium pizza with 3 toppings, one pitcher of beer, and two meatballs a la cart.  SEVENTY DOLLARS WITH TIP.  Ridiculous.  Footnote: watched pizza maker cut up basil without WASHING it.  Oh, they also made a mistake on the toppings we ordered.
author: Lawrence R.

description:
Pizza - Meh not the greatest and not the worst. 

Ambiance - Old school cafiteria, with TV's. 

Customer service - fu&& I try to avoid the Asian guy behind the bar. He seems to hate his job and it resonates. Walked in 25 minutes before they closed, 8 people at the bar with half to full drinks with a few in dining area. I asked if there was time to order a pizza to go? He just answers " we only have 3 slices of pizza left." A simple sorry dude, we can't make it, but we have 3 slices left if you want those?" Nope, just a smart ass look and response. 

If you stumble across this place and happen to get great customer service and food, your lucky. Other than that good luck.
author: Alec D.

description: Very relaxed casual place to grab a slice and some beer. Love coming here. Easy walking distance from our house and always has room to sit down. They don't rush you and I've never had a problem with an order. Excellent choice after a day at the beach.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
MY FAVE PIZZA IN SF!   I'm obsessed with their gluten free Sunset Aloha pizza - it is sooooo tasty!  The texture and flavor make for a delicious pizza (the non-gluten free crust is tasty too).  We get it once a week!  Also love that they have great wines and beer reasonably priced.  We p
air with their Sweet Potato Steak Fries (with spicy buffalo sauce - a veggie version of hotwings) & don't miss the kale or spinach salad (I alternate).  It's a fun place to meet friends after a surf or for a casual night out.  Also, now that we have a baby it's a perfect place to take him where the buzz of the lively restaurant keeps him happy.
author: Robyn T.

description:
If you're out in the area this place is worth a try.  Long wait for a table because there is not much else out there.  Lots of families w/kids so tables clear slower.

The meatballs are great.  Pizza ok/good - thin crust isn't my fav.  The red sauce is tasty - both of the pizza & meatballs.
author: Kim S.

description: Great pizza, mostly great service. Always easy and good, would recommend to anyone. The large pizza is too big for 3 people lol JS
author: Aaron R.

description:
Me: Wanna just pick up a pizza for dinner?
Bf: Okay. Where should we order from?
Me: (searching on yelp) Hmmm, there's a pizza place on Noriega.
Bf: What's the place called?
Me: The Pizza Place on Noriega.
Bf: Yah, but what's the name?
Me: The Pizza Place on Noriega (didn't I say that already?). Ohhh haha, it's actually called The Pizza Place on Noriega.

I can't complain about how straight forward the name of the pizza joint is, and after my bf and I took a look at the menu, we liked what we saw. We ordered around 7pm and service on the phone was casual but a bit sloppy since it seemed busy in house and the person on the phone was semi-frazzled. We were told that our order would be ready in 45 minutes. Their website notes that it takes about 25-30 minutes to make a pizza so it seemed that this Friday night was extra busy. We picked up our pizza as scheduled and indeed, a good amount of folks were waiting outside to dine in the bustling restaurant. 

We got a 14in pizza, half Rotten Bobby, half The Dimitri and an order of buffalo wings (comes with a dozen). The pizza was delicious and the ingredients were very flavorful. I'm not a fan of thick pizza crust so I was in love with the super thin crust of this pizza. If you want something spicy, go with Rotten Bobby. The Dimitri will fit the bill if you want something garlicky and meaty. The buffalo sauce for the chicken wings was packed in a separate container so that we could toss the wings with the sauce before consumption which was a good idea to prevent soggy wings. The wings still had crispy skin and were also delicious but the blue cheese dressing was very watered down so we ended up tossing it. 

On a less busy day, I'd like to eat in at the actual Pizza Place. Yes, The Pizza Place on Noriega.
author: Maya S.

description:
Pizza can be good, and at an acceptable price. AVOID THE WINGS (super dry and hard).

But they have good beer selections, especially the Magnolia IPA
author: Nathan S.

description: Pizza is good, staff not so much. Too pretentious and entitled for my taste. Non-local for sure. Rather get my pizza at Pasquale's on Sloat.
author: A B.

description: I've been searching for a place that offers a vegan option and this place totally satisfies my pizza cravings! Seriously the best vegan pizza
author: Hyejin N.

description:
We arrived right about 12:30PM and just missed the lunch rush! The place filled up with families and groups of friends within ten minutes of our arrival. Crisp crunchy perfect pizza crust, robust sauce, delicious cheese, and fresh ingredients. What a great pizza place so I wasn't surprised!

We has the Veggie which included red sauce, artichoke hearts, spinach, bursting cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, cheese and peppers. We also split a spinach salad with goat cheese, bacon, cranberries, and almonds that was delicious and full of flavor and even my toddler chowed down on it (that's a good spinach salad!). My favorite part of the salad was the dressing that was full of caramelized onions and a slight bite of mustard. 

The service was A+, it was extremely family friendly, and parking seemed easy and within walking distance of GG park and the beach. Love it! Thanks for a great lunch.
author: Heather L.

description:
Before heading to Noriega Produce, husband and I decided to grab lunch here.  It wasn't busy on a Sunday.  
Sweet potato for appetizer... huge slices and it actually goes really well with buffalo sauce and ranch sauce.  That ranch sauce was realllly yummy!  I want the recipe!  

Pizza... thin crust with right amount of toppings.  Not the best but good.  I don't remember what toppings we got but it was good.  

Service was good.
author: Claire J.

description:
Terrible customer service. I ordered a large pizza on a Sunday night.
It was not busy in there. I waited 35 minutes as expected.  I asked four times was it ready after the wait time, they asked me twice while I was seated if I had ordered already?!
Then at 60 minutes the same guy that asked me my name at 45 minutes came to me and said they are making it again as they mixed up the tickets.
No apologies or offer of a credit.
I asked to be credited my money back.
There were about 6 staff. 4 different workers said the order was next. 

If I was offered a free pizza for the trouble I'd return but they didn't even offer a sorry.
author: A G.

description:
3-1/2 stars?! Are you people on glue?!!!
This place rules! We fall back to eating out usually once every two weeks. We pick up our kid from school, and on the way home come here for a pizza and a beer. We've been doing this for about 5 years now and have never...NEVER been disappointed. 
Not once!
Our favorite is the broccoli and tomato pizza, which is perfect. Some of the others are the Aloha (a Hawaiian- style pizza with some changes), Dimitri (sausage and Pepperoni), and the Rocha (too many ingredients to mention). All are excellent. Great beer selection as well. 
Five stars across the board. Kick out the jams.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Ordered a medium rotten robby and half a dozen wings to go. Too bad we didn't call in beforehand.. it took about 40 mins for the pizza to be ready. At least the game was on and they had a bar , which we took advantage of.
Was not a fan of the wings. They were just OK. Loved the pizza though!
author: Leslie C.

description:
Excellent place to get a beer and a slice. This is my neighborhood watering hole when I get hungry and discover upon fridge inspection that I am completely out of food. From a project management stand point this is a terrible confession but let's review: is it? Having a solid plan B that works every time IS the key skill of project management LOL

Great place, I'm there once a week or some times more often
author: boyan b.

description:
I love how family friendly this place is. Lots of room for groups and maneuvering a stroller. The staff was friendly and helpful; offering a new spoon every time our two year old drink dropped hers :) 

I love love love the kale salad. The pizza is good, but a little greasy for my taste. I appreciate the $10 pitcher of Pabst and the 2 big TVs to watch sports. Overall a nice casual place.
author: Brandi D.

description: Update... The pizza gods shined down light upon me.  They sent me this giant slice.  I love this place.  And Danny.  She is awesome.  And magnolia ipa.  Yes.
author: Choladeva C.

description: While visiting SF on two different occasions we have visited both times and it was great. Great service and amazing pizza. Really cool atmosphere. I would recommend this place to anyone they have more them just pizza!
author: Jessica G.

description: Excellent pizza! Thin crust and not swimming in sauce.  We really enjoyed it!!  Massive pizza sizes!  Delicious and will be back!
author: Sheena D.

description:
*Long wait, cool atmosphere, decent pizza, excellent service*

Service got this place an extra star.  The pizza is pretty good, especially when hot.  

Lots of seating space, plentiful street parking that gets filled up pretty quickly.  

ORDERED:
Medium Cheese Pizza for a little under $20

Walking distance from the beach.  

Recommend.
author: Rimi K.

description:
He's gotten a slice to go a couple times from The Pizza Place.  I finally got to try it as well.  He and I are both not in to the whole thin crust NYC pizza thing but the pizza here is pretty good.  For me the pizza slice is big, for him, he could probably do another half slice, but refrains. 

$4 for a slice of pepperoni is a little pricey though in my opinion.  The slice was a little soggy towards the tip, but overall was fine.  As others mentioned, it was a little on the greasy side, but it's pepperoni, and most pizzas are a little greasy due to the cheese and meat.  Wait can be a little long, especially when they have to fresh make a slice for you.  We do spend money on pizza at places like Piccino, but I feel like that's more justified, since it's a nice sit down restaurant and it's Italian style.  The Pizza Place is a typical small business neighborhood pizza joint though.  Will definitely come back when I wanted to "splurge" on some American style pizza.  Perhaps next time we can try one of their special pizzas.  3ish for now.
author: Cat C.

description:
I really, really want to love this place, but I can't anymore. The food is plentiful, but pretty average. It's comfy and casual, but I wish the service was less so. The last 4 times I've been there at night, the service has been very, very unprofessional. 

I've waited at least 15 mins to place my order after being seated. Then, I've waited at least 20- 30 mins for meal to arrive at the table. Forget about trying to time when the check is going to arrive, or not. 

The servers range from friendly and neglectful to spaced-out and neglectful--common denominator? Right. 
I want you guys to stay in business. I don't want another craptastic hipster hub. 

Please get it together, and btw, turn up the sound for the games. Everyone wants that even if you don't. Pay attention to your customers.
author: Tough C.

description:
awful spinich salad with bacon fat 2 small chunks of feta chesse and a small handful of spinich that is drenched with a watery dressing! $10.00 
pizza that was so disapointing- magarrita pizza was not traditional or even remotly good, other pizza was a simple sausage and cheese pizza and we would have enjoyed pizza from domino's much more. do not waste your money!
author: Harry G.

description:
The pizza here is one of the best slices in sf. 
There specially made ranch is a must try, although the waiters can be a little bit quicker
author: Adam B.

description:
my favorite pizza in sf! and believe me I'm a pizza brat! Boston and NYC eat your heart out. we got a winner ova here. come for the pizza but fall in love with the salads the special kale items and the beers! not to mention the chicken wings! did I say chicken wings OHH yes I did. and for you sports lovers there's usually a game of some kind on the flat screen. 

enjoy it I know I always do
author: Nena L.

description: We waited so long but no one came to check up on us waiting. And when someone did, he skipped us and checked in with next set of dudes. They don't like taking to Asian or something?
author: A O.

description: Love the wings. Best wings in sf. Pizza is mostly awesome. Had the meatball sub today and it was a falling apart mess. Good food but, the cheese was stuck to the wrapping paper so it came off when we unwrapped. Also the sauce gave the bun a very soggy bottom. Sad cuz the sauce and meatballs are very good. Maybe the meatball sub is better eaten there, and i'd ask for the bread extra toasted.
author: Graham W.

description: What we order every time: Rocha! Buffalo wings! Sweet potatoes steak! Every time! Yup!
author: J W.

description: None of their ingredients are fresh or organic. They use canned toppings. Most of their condiments from this place expired a month before they use it. All employees don't wash their hands. They all smoke pot & then make people's food. Plus they put their cheese & incoming produce on the floor. Also their dishwasher lays their silver ware & plates on the floor. Plus the dish washer washes the dishes in a unsanitary manner using cold water. There's a high chance of finding hair in your food too. Plus there are a lot of fruit flies it's like there's an infestation in the business. They get in your drinks, food, & face. Plus they have a rodent infestation where they keep their produce, & food. Their metal trays in which they cook the majority of their food they let them degrease in the compost bins with the trash. Also they leave their cutting boards on the floor.
author: Cesar G.

description: Pizza by the slice with whatever you want on it - nuff said. Open late (for the outer sunset that is), good selection for those who are both carnivorous and not, and there's usually not a wait. Family friendly, and everyone working there has always been chill. Bonus points for a doggy waiting spot right outside the front door.
author: Lauren M.

description:
I was at my friend's place in the Sunset over the weekend and they felt like pizza, so we decided to Yelp a place. We settled on The Pizza Place on Noriega since they offer a vegan option, and one of our friends is vegan. It definitely takes a while for them to prepare your pizza, so make sure you order well in advance. We came 30-40 minutes after ordering, and our pizzas were ready. We tried:  

-The Dimitri (Sausage, Zoe's Pepperoni, Garlic, Mushroom, Tomato Sauce, Cheese, 14" $18.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-pizza-place-on-noriega-san-francisco?select=nfqIvgkkuKjx_h2drV3R6Q#lxu-z1bhljUxUUwYhJQkWA): Eh, I didn't like this combination much, and everything was really salty. The thin crust was nice, but I wouldn't order this pizza again.
-Timmy's Pie (Vegan- Vegan Pesto, Roasted Potatoes, Roasted Red Peppers, Mushrooms, Mini Tomatoes, Caramelized Onions, 14" $16.50, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-pizza-place-on-noriega-san-francisco?select=nfqIvgkkuKjx_h2drV3R6Q#nfqIvgkkuKjx_h2drV3R6Q): Surprisingly good! The crust wasn't as soft/pliable as the non-vegan one, but the toppings were delicious and flavorful so you didn't miss out on the lack of dairy or meat. Recommended, but mostly for more omnivorous people. 

Overall, I doubt I'll be back to The Pizza Place unless I suddenly convert to veganism and was craving pizza. I liked their thin crust, but just didn't think it was as good as some of the other fancier pizza places in the city (Ragazza, A16, Delfina), and their pizza isn't cheap. However, take my review with a grain of salt since we took the pizza to-go, and didn't eat it fresh out of the oven. The staff was friendly but the parking around this area is a nightmare, and I would recommend coming with a friend if you're picking up so that you can double park while the other person runs in to grab the pizza.
author: Amy D.

description:
I like that you can order slices any time. It's convenient. I tried Timmy's (vegan) but not vegan since it was a slice. They have pre-made cheese pizzas and add the toppings for slice orders. Interesting. 

The pizza was delicious! One of the best pizzas I've ever had - I don't eat that much pizza but still! The caramelized onions were yummy. They have a lot of interesting combinations too choose from or build your own. I want to come back and try them all.
author: Cindy K.

description: This place rules.  My kids love it.  Very accommodating to my kids and I.  Great food.
author: Joe M.

description:
This place seems like it would be great for people who can eat regular pizza but I came specifically for the Gluten Free Pizza since I have Celiac Disease and can no longer eat wheat...for anyone that wants to hate on me for this kiss my ass....I would be sucking down all the gluten in the world like i used to, were it not for doctors orders. I have an actual DISEASE. not a fad. 

Anyways...I was sad to find the GF pizza was really hard and lacking in flavor. I applaud them for trying to do something so difficult. Making GF foods taste good is REALLY HARD. I just wanted to let the other Celiacs know there are better GF pizzas to be had. The other people seemed happy who ate the regular pizza.
author: Little B.

description:
Hands down horrible experience. I ordered for pick up and when I got there I saw my pizza there with my name on it. I waited 20 minutes (I was timing) at the counter for someone to give me my pizza and ring me up. I repeatedly asked can I pick up my pizza and I kept getting "a someone will get to you" response. Worse was the workers rudely told me to get out of the way when there was no where else for me to stand inside. Like I'm going to stand outside and leave the counter area so you can forget about my pizza and talk to your buddies drinking at the bar (really I saw all this).

It's also expensive albeit a large pizza and it's not that great tasting. All the positive reviews are probably because of the lack of choices in the area. Unfortunately, this is an example of a business run by the mean hipster types not the nice ones.
author: Stephen W.

description:
This pizza reminds me of the pizza of my childhood. Like, the really exceptional pizza of my childhood, not the pizza hut or the little caesar's. It's probably not going to end up with any michelin stars, but that's more due to a weakness on the part of the michelin committtee than anything else. 

Great pizza, lovely seasonal salads, relaxed place by the beach to drink a beer and watch the game. While nomming on pizza.
author: Tasha D.

description: I don't give five stars often, but when I do, it's usually for BOMB ASS PIZZA! This place is big, friendly, authentic and awesome. Good for parties or a date night. I had a slice from Brothers Pizza around the corner and it was good, but this was better. If you're second guessing this spot and are a vacationer relying on yelp for good food spots, CHOOSE THIS ONE! No questions.
author: Tiff H.

description:
Ok pizza. INCREDIBLY slow service. Painful.  Especially with kids.   Don't come here if you have kids and want to be in and out in less than an hour and a half.  On a weekday!

Looks like an ok place to come with friends if time is of no moment.  But with kids? What a disaster.
author: A. M.

description: Great laid back feel with super pizza.  I love the Buffalo sauce on everything.   Great beer selection and best to get in early or call ahead of you have a big party.  It's the perfect spot for a slice and a beer and the patio is great on most days.  There are a few off the menu slices like the Big Wave Dave, the Taco slice and the Danny...;)
author: Mike k.

description: Best Pizza I've ever had!!! Went there on Valentine's Day night but we still got a table fast and got our food in a decent time despite it being busy. The wait staff was friendly and efficient and the ambience was very relaxed. We had the Dimitri and it was AMAZING!! The cheese was creamy and savory the pepperoni is crispy the crust was fluffy with the right amount crunch and the sausage was well seasoned. Needless to say I would travel all the way down to San Francisco for the pizza alone!!!
author: Ana B.

description: I thought this place would be fun to try down Noriega. I live about 25 blocks away on 20th near Noriega. I got a 14" Rotten Robby pizza which had jalapenos, pesto, sausage, and mushrooms. I have eaten a lot of pizza in San Francisco and did not think this was my favorite. The crust was soggy and floppy. It was really greasy on top. I got an Italian pomegranate soda and something about it didn't taste right. It didn't seem mixed right.
author: Denise C.

description:
A friend and checked this place out yesterday for lunch. Been here a few times and I think this place is best for lunch, but not for dinner. Grinders are kinda meh to me. Stick to the pizzas fellas.

FOOD:

14" Dimitri pizza - very filling for 2 people, delicious, crispy hand tossed thin crusted dough.

SERVICE:

Not complaining but we felt a bit rushed at the end.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Great pizza/beer spot on Noriega, a couple of blocks from the beach.  Casual, chill vibe.  Family friendly, too.  We're lucky to have this in the Sunset.
author: Vinayak J.

description:
I've been here twice now...and for some reason, I keep wanting to come back.  

Ok ok...the pizza isn't the greatest I've ever had...too many ingredients make the pizza soggy...and well, the combinations are just alright...BUT I can't help but want it.  Weird eh?  It's unexplainable...I'm speechless.  Wow.  Maybe it's the huge size?  Maybe it's the freshness or the thin crust?  

Maybe it's the ridiculous homemade ranch and blue cheese sauces they have?  Man...those are the best 2 sauces I have ever had...anywhere!  I appreciate that they pay attention to the little things.  they're a perfect complement to the buffalo wings.  

They have a wide variety of beer...a huge tv...and attentive servers.  

Best pizza ever?  Probably not.  Wow factor?  Yes.  Love it.
author: Jen W.

description: Great slices and whole pies, think crust. Good selection of beers on tap. Wonderful staff!
author: diewney n.

description: We love stopping here after going to the Beach.  It has a super relaxed and fun vibe which we love. The service was good and the food came out fast.  The parking wasnt too bad and the prices are very reasonable.  The dough and toppings are very fresh which we love. Highly recommend
author: Lydia H.

description: I just needed to add that the wings here are horrendous. Picture the scrawniest, meekest, thinly sauced-over wings you've ever seen, and now pay $9 for six of them! Preposterous, and beneath the dignity of this fine local institution.
author: Adam Z.

description:
I love this place. It's definitely a locals hang out. Always good tunes playing and a staff that recognizes you and greets you with a warm smile :-) The pizza is tasty but definitely better to order a whole pie instead of a slice. The slices tend to be a little overcooked for my liking cuz they reheat which is standard. The ingredients are always fresh and the quality is amazing. I have literally tried everything on the menu and would highly recommend everything. 
Must try: wings, fries, antipasto plate, rotten Robbie pizza, and beers (lots of them)
author: Kayleen R.

description:
They offer gluten free crust, but it costs an arm and a leg (add $6), so that you're shelling out $20 or more for a tiny (13") GF pizza. 

My husband ordered a slice on regular crust with sausage, pineapple, and jalapeños, and he got a slice of sausage pizza that had been cooked earlier with nearly-raw canned pineapple and jalapeños thrown on top, not cooked into the pizza. 

This place has really high prices for not very high quality.
author: Rebecca E.

description: Comfortable neighborhood pizza place. I like it. Friendly staff. Tasty pizza. Usually get half Dimitri/Pepperoni.
author: Nuey T.

description: I've been waiting 20 minutes for my order to be taken, before that we waited to be seated for what they said would be 15 minutes and they forgot about us. When they finally take my order they tell us the pizza is taking 45 minutes! 45 minutes for dining in...umm unheard of. I get it, it is busy, but I will probably never come back. Not once did they apologize. We ordered slices since an entire pizza would take 45 minutes at the minimum.
author: Deanna L.

description: Service is bad. A few weeks ago my daughter and I were seated at a table with menus, waited for about 25 minutes (mind you, the place wasn't even half full). Finally we got up and left after I saw the waitress walk over to another table with people that had arrived after us. I don't think I have EVER left a restaurant like that before. She never ever took our order! And tonight my husband buys a pizza pie and wings and the bottom of pizza is burnt black. Also while he waited, he ran into a friend who had also walked out because of their bad service. I'm done with this place!
author: Joanna B.

description: Had dinner here on a Wednesday night pizza was good and didn't have to wait long. Only negative thing I would say is the pizza is very greasy. Might try again but will try veggie pizza and see if that's less greasy.
author: Teresa A.

description:
This is so important that I am going to keep this short so you'll read it.

Go to the Outer Sunset and eat things here. Do it twice as quickly if you are an east-coast expat. They actually serve grinders here. You will understand how serious this is (GRINDERS SRSLY) if you come from somewhere that pizza is served on red-and-white oilcloth tablecloths and the Big Green Monster features subtly in the decor. 

The pizza is lovely. The grinders are lovely. They take credit cards, there's a bar, I felt like I was back in Boston, this review is now over, go eat there.
author: Austin J. A.

description: The pizza is solid. Sometimes I switch it up and order their competition winning chile verde.  Probably the best buffalo chicken wings in the area.  The only downfall is that the owners are Celtics fans; but they make up for it with their fondness of Homer and Marge.
author: Jenn J.

description:
Could I order some pizza with my grease, please? AMIRITE?!

Anyways, dropped in here to grab a slice before picking up a friends kid at school. Dude took my order then asked me to provide ID for my order of $3.50. I know he is just doing his job, but, like, COME ON.

Anyways, I got the slice to go and the bag was already greasy and it got worse when I opened it.

THE GREASE IS EVERYWHERE.
author: Tara H.

description:
Good simple selection of draft beers.

Tv to catch the Giants game.

Veggie pizza was flavors from the garden.  The olive and mushrooms were plentiful and provided the strong aroma.

Dimtri pizza was perfect with the hint of garlic.

I would say its not as thin as a NY slice and far from the super thin "00" flour Napoletana style that I favor the most.  But this Boston style?  It's good but you will be easily stuffed with a couple of slices.

One star off for the buffalo wings.  Super overdone and dry.  Good spiciness on the sauce though.
author: Kevin L.

description: Good pizza!! Good spicy wings!! Love the sauce on wings.  And good ambiance for kids! Love going here but the wait can sometimes be long.
author: Fabbie B.

description: We came to this neighborhood place in the Sunset in San Francisco for some pizza and beer. We started out with some beer, had some Buffalo Wings with sauce on the side, and had The Spicoli pizza, "Who ordered the double cheese and sausage?" It was all very good. Good service, and nice neighborhood vibe in the bar. Only one big screen television at the bar, and one in the banquet/groups table area. Could use a few more televisions for big sporting events. All in all, pleasant experience and I would come back!
author: Norm D.

description:
I came here to celebrate Sigourney W.'s birthday a month ago and had a very excellent pizza at a very excellent price.  We got the margarita pizza (large) which was ample enough to feed 3 people to a fed, satiated state.

We went to The Pizza Place at around 7pm, and it was really popping.  This area of Sunset is normally quiet at night, but this joint was really something special.  Lots of people were out-- families, couples, friends, and of course...me and my friends, celebrating my homegirl's 25th.  Even though it was really busy, we quickly got a table and were served by a very nice and attentive waiter.

The margarita pizza was perfect, with the perfect amount of sauce, cheese, and basil.  The crust was perfect, and was reminiscent of New York Style pizza -- similar to what I've had at Bleeker St. Pizza in NYC.  It came out pretty fast, piping hot, just the way pizza should be made.  Similarly, the pizza was served with a smile.  You rock, Pizza Place on Noriega!

Come try this hidden pizza gem in Outer Sunset.  You won't be disappointed!
author: Matthew L.

description:
This is one of my favorite places in the city. They have it all- kale salad, French fries, gluten free crust, keg wine, great service, and my all time favorite pizza- the ROCHA (garlic, bacon, potatoes, kale). 

In accordance with the Beyoncé approved pizza and wine once a week diet, I make the trek  out to Noriega for what I would definitely call the city's best neighborhood pizza place.
author: Kira M.

description: Got the 20" pizza which fed 5 adults with a few slices leftover. Got 1/2 Dimitri and 1/2 veggie. Both were tasty, good crust, thin crust style. Next time I'm dining in so I can enjoy a pitcher of beer.
author: Barnaby W.

description: We had cheese pizza and Greek pizza, and both were great -- big flavor, thin crust. Great quality and price meant great value.
author: Rian T.

description:
We ordered the 20 inch dimitri pizza on a Saturday night for pick up prior to the Warriors playoff game. They gave a estimated 45 min wait time for the pizza.

The pizza slices are HUGE. It's like double the size of a Costco slice pizza. I had two slices and wanted to knock out. The 20 inch pizza can probably fill up 4 people easily. 

Our dimitri pizza had a good amount of pepperoni and ground sausage on it. The downside of it was that it was way too salty and very oily. I think the ground sausage was the culprit making the pizza too salty. 

I would probably come back and order again, but definitely would choose a different pizza.
author: Allen C.

description: Great pizza, great people, prices are very fair for how large the slices are. Love this place!
author: Christian A.

description: Great customer service! Our waiter was super nice, helpful, and very welcoming. We even came 20 mins before closing and was still greeted with a smile, rather than being looked at as a hassle. He didn't rush us at all either. Wish I got his name so I could applaud him on his wonderful service. Anyways, this place has an interesting, unique vibe and awesome pizza. Definitely worth the price!
author: Lauryn S.

description:
Didn't know what to cook on Friday night, so I decided to get a pizza for us. I ordered half the jalapeno and half of the meaty one (forgot the names). It was greasy, which was expected because it's pizza.

The jalapeno one was so delicious! The pizza slice size was huge; I ate two and was way too stuffed.

The place was packed on a Friday evening at 6pm when I went to pick it up. The workers could be a little more attentive to their patrons as I had called 3-4 times to place my order but no one ever answered. Even when I went in, I had to wait a couple minutes despite one dude walking back and forth serving people their food and looking at me waiting there at the register.
author: V M.

description:
I think the employees here loathe me. I've been there twice, and perhaps they are super stoned, since it HAS been later in the evening. 

They just make everything look inedible. It's peeeet-za. Not that hard, 'kay?

So, two stars because somehow it ends up miraculously tasting somewhat edible (citing kale salad, albeit overdressed, and pepperoni pizza experiences). 

Yet the chicken wings? PLEASE never order the chicken wings...I don't think the cooks are clean enough to toss and dress raw chicken. Just sayin'. Ugh. 

On a separate note--I don't think I've had good ones since I left Virginia ten years ago. SERIOUSLY.

Help on that one??
author: Elle N M.

description: This place never disappoints. Very friendly, good prices, fun atmosphere. The folks who are posting bad reviews should really put there phones away. Tripping! Just because you are having a s***ty day doesn't mean you have the right to be an anonymous internet tough guy or c***.
author: Kev Daniel W.

description:
We ordered pickup on a Saturday night. The place was PACKED.
They said it would be 40 minutes, and we got there just after that time. Not sure how long it had been ready, but the center of the pizza, and the wings, got a little steamy/soggy from the wait. The wings crisped up nicely in the toaster oven - 10 minutes at 400* was about perfect. We may only get them as an eat-in item in the future, when it is not so busy, or just be prepared to reheat them. Extra sauces were only 50 cents each.
The 20" pizzas are too wide for our side-by-side fridge, but larger pizzas are always a better value, so we went for it. Worth the few cents of plastic wrap it took to put the [many] extra slices in the fridge.
The Sunset Aloha and Rotten Robby are both pretty great. Will likely order again, when we don't mind driving, and/or drop in sometime - maybe plan a walk to the beach around this.
author: Ali W.

description: The pizza is pretty good. Got the medium Dimitri, but omitted the garlic and added basil instead. Because of that small change, they made a mistake on the original order they took over the phone and it took over 30 mins to wait for the original pizza to realize they made a mistake and had to make a new one, another 20 mins. Didn't ask for comp or discount, but should have. It's a nice friendly, local pizza joint and within walking distance of my parents' house. Would order again.
author: Leslie W.

description: The hipster attitude that has no place anywhere near Ocean Beach makes the food taste meh. It would be a decent dollar slice though.
author: Michele D.

description: We live a block away, think its one of (if not) the best pizza in the city, yet we only go once every 3-4 months because the staff are self hating, rude, inconsiderate, people .  I actually thought the first time we were being trolled, like this is part of their schtick or something. Nope, they just hate themselves and clearly their jobs, and take it out on the people who decide their pizza is good enough to be treated like they are causing a problem just be showing up.  The incredible part is the consistency and commitment to providing such a unappealing service.  For those who think that I must be the problem, maybe, or maybe they are just a miserable group of people.  Like I said I love the pizza, I may even get it tonight, but I know that I will walk out of that place feeling like I did something wrong, and I deserved to wait an hour, and pay 50.00 for a meal for 2ppl.  All the while being talked to like I kicked their dog and called them losers (I didn't).  Free tip to the staff: if you hate your job, find another.   1 star for the pizza, negative stars for every other single thing about the experience. Don't say no one warned you.
author: Joseph N.

description: Good local flavor- this place has some interesting pie combinations and they allow you to order half a pie of one type and half of another so that you can try more of them! We have had a few different pies like the aloha and Dimitri. We've also add our own pizza pies just piling on different toppings. They have a huge selection with quality ingredients. The place itself has a very chill environment that is both fun for groups or for a low key date.
author: Gaby E.

description: Solid pizza and great service can't complain. Pizza won't blow you out of the water but it's pretty good! Good beer selection too, really like the environment and the people that work there looks like a fun place to chill
author: Sal R.

description:
Pizza and salads, fresh! Super taste. The french fries were just perfect, and such a big portion! We ordered pizza by the slice, it was served promptly and they were big slices for a nice price! 

The waiter was very nice. 

Super place. We will return! Good quality, big portions, nice prices.
author: Birgit E.

description:
Excellent thin crust. The Dimitri is awesome. I will give them another star if they would deliver. Parking kinda sucks.

We haven't eatin' at the establishment yet, so I cannot comment on the service. I'd just go pick it up and not worry about the service cause the pizza is that good.
author: Craig I.

description:
Ordered for pick up...

The Rude servers is what I'm writing about 

I showed up stood patently 
In front of the pick up counter ... Just to be ignored...

Then another customer walks in and the server walked up to her immediately and asked for her name for the pick up took her money and she was on her way ... 

While I continued to be ignored ... Well finally... Eventually I was helped ... Wtf?

That's it!

I'm Fucken done with this place ... 
Never again will I waste my time or money on this place!
author: Tommy G.

description:
Perhaps the most well known post-surfing grub spot in this area, it serves up a decent version of that calorically dense 1-2 punch that is pizza and beer. The salads are also pretty good here. They also do pizza by the slice, but only around lunchtime as far as I know. 

Service can be a bit slow at the tables, and there are not a lot of TV's other than at the bar, but I would say the ambiance is comfortable. A great place to spend time with friends.
author: Griffith P.

description:
Neighborhood pizza joint.  Mostly locals who know the staff so if you don't know your server you might need to be a bit more assertive to get their attention.  I go Dimitri or Sunset Hawaiian.  Side salads are solid with dressing on the side.  

Good spot to get a game and a brew.  Nothing fancy but it will satisfy you if you need a slice in the sunset.
author: Zack H.

description: *must read* Boyfriend went to the bathroom and the worker forgot to lock it. My boyfriend shuts the door right away and then a mili second later the worker opens it "toilet still flushing" wipes his hand on pants and then goes immediately back to chopping the bell peppers and mushrooms........
author: Monica L.

description:
I used to think this place is great especially because they have a great Gluten Free crust to offer. The vibe is actually pretty cool - a friendly pizza/beer/sports place with a neighborhood feel to it. 

Last night, however, we had a pretty bad experience. In summary, the waitress was rude. The way she reacted when I asked whether they have white sauce and chicken was uncalled for. She was basically reminding me that they carry items ONLY listed on the menu. I was with a two year old and didn't get a chance to review the menu when she came up. The pizza came with the wrong toppings which she blamed me for instead of at least apologizing and replacing the pizza. 

In summary, I think they need to revisit their staff to make sure they're all friendly enough to provide what a typical customer would expect.
author: M Z.

description: The pizza is amazing, you must try it!  I'm from Chicago and I know pizza.... this is GOOD pizza.....and they have good beer too!
author: Sarah S.

description: Surprisingly, we got found a place to park around the corner and only waited about a 1/2 an hour on a Friday night of Hardly, Strictly Bluegrass at dinner time. Miracles do happen. And once we got in and had our wedge salad with bacon and a medium Demitri, we realized it would have been worth it to wait an hour. We took home half the pizza and it was just as good the next day. We were regretting not ordering the large.
author: Tess S.

description: Could be the best pizza in the Bay Area. Plus they have a great gluten free pizza.  Good beer selection and great salads.. Staff is pleasant and the bar has a cool funky vibe. Check it out.
author: Al J.

description: Party of 6 and not a thing left on anyone's plate. Pizza is delicious and wings are a must! Friendly staff with superb food ! What else is there left to say except, stop in if your in the area!
author: I. G.

description: Second favorite NY style slice in SF. Only place to enjoy a dank beer with a bomb slice imo. The rest of the menu is also very tasty. Fries and wings, yum.
author: Cole G.

description: We frequented take out from here ever since it opened.  Was pretty amazing first couple years, but began to fall off, sauce still good but skimpy on toppings, crust a bit over cooked, as were the chicken wings, and always quoted a long cook time, so when we arrived food was lukewarm.  Took a break and ordered from North Beach, surprisingly good, fast and  less expensive.  Gave it another try the other night.  Lukewarm, again..arrived 10 minutes before the quoted time and it was sitting there, crust Super Stale and overlooked,  chicken wings dry! Guess it's back to NB again for awhile!
author: C W.

description:
I haven't written review yet? How very laid back beach bum of me. I've been coming here for the better part of 18 months of living out on the coast, and what better staple to a neighborhood is there than a family friendly pizza parlor? Replete with red checkered table cloths, a long set off room for pizza parties of 30 plus kids or your company's softball league, a separate bar with strong local California craft brews, and a most excellent, positive beach vibe, proud to call this place home. 

Then, your wings. Would you look at that... Franks + Butter = That's it. That's all Buffalo sauce should be. And here they nail it. You should pair it with a kale salad because that's a funny thing to do and because their kale salad is strong. I've had a good two dozen pizzas from this place and so far the one that takes it is pepperoni, that's it. 

If you can find a happier place, let me know. As of now, this place exudes all the good bits of San Francisco. And did I notice they're doing burger nights? Wha!
author: Jon A.

description:
I was determined to buy my sister and brother in law dinner (he doesn't make it easy) for letting me crash on the couch so we decided to go to one of their favorite pizza joints, The Pizza Place on Noriega.  Themed after some of history's hippest stoners, this was definitely one of those awesome neighborhood dives.

We started with an order of their spaghetti and meatballs in their homemade pesto.  You could definitely smell the fresh basil as it permeated the large meatballs and the angel hair pasta.  This was some excellent stuff to be sure.  We followed that up with a slice of their meat pie, which was layered high with just about every fresh meat you could imagine.  Another excellent choice.  Then came our gnarly large 20" Margherita and Spicoli pizza. Both sides were loaded with cheese and toppings and my favorite was definite the Spicoli with its awesome sausage.  This is definitely not a place to come if you're on a diet, but awesome if you're stoned out of your mind.

The pizza here is absolutely awesome, but the pesto was what stuck out to me.  It's not cheap, but also not way overpriced either, and definitely fits almost any budget.  While my favorite pie is still the one found at Basic in SD, this is a close second and I can't wait to come back to try some of their other creations.  Ultimately, I failed in my attempt at buying dinner but luckily he let me make it up with ice cream at Polly Ann's.

Food: 8/10

Service: 9/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 8/10
author: Joe M.

description: Pizzas aren't cheap here, and you'll certainly have to wait, but out of all of the pizza places here in SF where you don't really sit down for your slice, this place isn't bad at all. The slice reminds me of New York, though it isn't the classic Brooklyn thin slice, but the dough is flavored (unlike several other places that are highly ranked in SF), and you can actually taste the tomatoes in the sauce. The slices are huge, but it's because you're paying over $25 for a large pizza. I recommend the Veggie (made with real vegetables), Rotten Robby, or Dimitri. All of them will fill you up without making you feel like a heavy, carb and salt-filled sack. Solid pizza.
author: Danny C.

description:
WARNING: NOT FOR THE CLOGGED OF ARTERIES.

One random day, my boss bought a box of pepperoni pizza for the office. I was warned from everyone that the pizza from The Pizza Place on Noriega was absurdly oily.

I took a slice from the box and blotted it a bit with some napkins, then I folded the slice like I was from New York. After folding the pizza and taking a small bite, a bright orange oil was already oozing down my arm.

Ahh, delicious but extremely oily.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I'm not too impressed with this place.  We came on a Friday night and it was full.  We ordered the sweet potato fries and the Rotten Robby pizza.  The fries were ok, kinda unique since you don't find this at many places.  it took 30 minutesf for our pizza to arrive and that's with a couple of inquiries.  I think they simply forgot our order.  

The pizza was hot, but soggy in the middle. I think that's pretty consistent with other yelpers' comments.  The pizza is also pretty salty for my taste.  It's pricey $18.50 for a 14" and the quality.

It's a nice local hangout if you live in the area. Otherwise don't need to make a trip out here.

Review # 137
author: Jannie Q.

description:
My review is for the pizza only since I've never actually eaten inside the restaurant. I live so close that we always just pick it up and bring the food home. Anyway, the DIMITRI is hands down my favorite pizza to order. If you're not a fan of garlic, then do not order this because its garlicky and delicious.

The 20" size is huge! It definitely serves 4 people easily. Next to Seniore's, this is my favorite and go-to pizza to order that is close to home. I wish they had delivery for those days I don't want to leave my house...
author: Leah F.

description:
Wow, awful, awful service!!
Waited 20 minutes for someone to take my order. Had to order at the bar. Asked to close the door and told to wait, which the door stay open. Will not come back.
author: Syl O.

description:
Becoming one of my favorite hang outs in the outer sunset.
