Their pizza is decent, although I like Irving Street Pizza better.  It's their atmosphere and beer selection that really makes them shine.

Also, they create a really comfortable environment for watching sports on tv.  

A good place to bring your friends for a slice of life in the outerlands, whether you get  the pizza or not.
author: Gopal R.

description: Still the best pizza, still the worst service. I've learned if you sit at the bar service is better. I talked to an employee and he apologized and literally said straight up "Ya my coworkers are just here and really not that into their jobs I'm sorry." He was a good server and the best server we had there so we left him a fat tip. While there with my sister our server sat at a table next to us and just got lost in her phone. Are you freaking kidding me. I know we live in a surfing community but come on.
author: Reasonably H.

description:
This is just not good pizza. 

Some will give them props for their creativity, but whatever cheese blend this joint is using to set themselves apart from the competition is pretty disgusting. In six words, it's hard and smells like farts. 

The kale salad was good, but under-dressed. 

It's too bad, because Pizza Place has a really charming feel to it, but I'd stick with Arizmendi or Seniore's if you're in the Sunset.
author: Karin H.

description: It wasn't to my satisfaction. The flavor was off. The aftertaste wasn't great. The crust was like fried bread. Our to-go pizza was not the 1hr wait.
author: Hgf J.

description:
The Pizza Place would always catch my eye as I would walk out of Devil's Teeth and the fact that they offer a gluten-free crust made this restaurant an instant candidate for my Bucket List.

We finally stopped in and noticed a rather large "Please wait to be seated" sign, so naturally, we waited. Three people were behind the bar talking and prepping pizzas and would glance over at us but continue chatting amongst themselves. We finally decided to take the initiative and seat ourselves. 

We ordered a Gluten-free 13" Cheese Pizza ($21.50) and was disappointed. There was very little cheese, it was obvious that the tomato sauce was not fresh but from a can, and the crust itself was inedible; it was extremely hard to bite through and tasted like cardboard. I forced myself to finish my first slice but could not bear another. When our server came around we informed her of our disappointment and she was nice enough to take care of the bill. 

I'm happy that I've finally had a chance to give The Pizza Place a try, but that will be my first and last visit (unless they upgrade their GF dough).
author: Juliette R.

description:
Solid 4 stars for this local pizza joint!

I placed a an order to-go and waited 35 minutes before picking it up. I could definitely hear from the background noise that it was pretty busy.

I ordered The Dimitri and it came with sausage, Zoe's pepperoni, garlic, mushroom, tomato sauce, and cheese.

I love how the sausage is cut into smaller pieces - you get sausage on a larger surface area per bite! LOVE the garlic!

I love the thin crust - wasn't soggy and the crust was perfectly crunchy. Perfect amount of cheese for me. I love pizzas that are made with balance so it doesn't get overwhelming or sloppy. The Pizza Place on Noriega understands that perfectly!

Overall, the pizza was very flavorful and delicious - not soggy, not greasy and the extra side of arugula I added gave it a hint of texture and flavor.
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Had an enormous sausage, shroom 20" pie and was extemely happy with the New York style thin crust and good cheese. The sausage was very good but pretty skimpy. I ordered extra cheese and was glad I did. Very tasty pie...not cheap but pretty big.
Place looked pretty shabby from the outside but had a nice, hectic New York feel on the inside. Took it down to the beach to watch the surfers and sun go down...excellent!
author: scott s.

description:
Fills the void for pizza on this street, for sure. The space is huge and welcoming, with hipsters manning the counters and delicious toppings to boot.

I got a slice of veggie (with artichoke hearts, tomatoes, green bell peppers, spinach, olives, mushrooms and cheese) which was filling and healthy(ish). Even though they sell pizza by the slice here, though, expect a wait if you're ordering take-out. Pizza Place is more of a sit-down establishment rather than a grab & go spot.

I personally prefer the pizza at Irving Pizza, but Pizza Place's ambiance wins by far.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Do you love being ignored? Do you like waiting an hour or more for food? Do you hate eye contact, or any contact really, with your server? Can some members of your party do without water, plates, or silverware? Do you hate water and refills of water? Then this is the place for you!

It all made sense when our server circled the 18% automatic gratuity on our bill. Yeah, she actually did that. I'm sorry, but automatic gratuity does not mean "I can ignore you for an hour and still get my tip."

Awful, awful experience.
author: Alan G.

description:
Interesting place.  Kid friendly, which dings them a star because those spoiled brats need their parents to shut them the hell up.

Also, they don't give out their wifi code.  Ding them another star.

The staff is very friendly.  The pizza is a step above mediocre.  They have beers that people seem to enjoy (I am not a beer drinker).  It was freezing outside, and yet the staff kept the door open, making us customers very uncomfortable.
author: Sam A.

description: I have come to love the pizza place as a great spot for a beer and a slice in the neighborhood. It's friendly, low key, great for kids, and the food is very good. My only demerit is for the lack of delivery and occasional soggy crust.
author: Allison B.

description: Being from the Northeast and having traveled quite a bit around the country, I've accepted that one can not get good pizza outside of the Philly/NYC region. On a recent SF trip, I was proven wrong. This pizza tastes like I could've gotten it in South Philly or in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge. It's thin, crispy, and delicious, the way pizza is meant to be.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Don't miss the sweet potato steak fries. 
I combined sliced meatloaf, mushroom and feta cheese. It came on a thin crust and ohhh so yummy. 
Very casual, cozy friendly place. This could be my fave pizza go to place.
author: Vicky D.

description:
Me: "Hi, can i order to pick up?"
Pizza man: "Yes, what would you like?"
Me: "A large Dimitri Pizza"
Pizza man: "It'll be ready in 30 minutes"
Me: "Thanks!"

30 minutes later my dad comes home with what has to be the LARGEST PIZZA ON EARTH. It took up the whole island table in my kitchen. Their pizza has such intense flavor despite that the crust becomes thin and slightly too moist. I like my crust thin and crunchy and not soggy. The combination of sausage, pepperoni, mushroom, garlic, and mozzarella is always a safe palate pleaser. The pizza feels heavy despite that it's not very dense at all. Oh and an extra star for the titles they give to their pizzas that put a smile on my face. $26 plus tax for a large pizza here!
author: Samantha L.

description: My husband and I order takeout from here all the time. It's the best pizza in the outer sunset. I am also a big fan of their salads and meatballs. Never disappointed!
author: Debbie L.

description:
A little overpriced, but the pizza is fantastic.  We often grab it to go and head to the beach, but there are also great tables to eat onsite. 

I am a picky pizza person but this is just the sort of pizza I like, thinnish crust with great fresh ingredients and interesting combinations (my favorite has been a kale/potato/chicken special .. mmmm).
author: K C.

description: Great place for a midweek treat pizza. Staff were friendly & pizza was tasty. We moved to SF/the area relatively recently & I can see us coming here regularly. They also have hard cider on draft which is good for us!
author: Fi M.

description:
I want to like this place. It is close to my house, ok-ish atmosphere but maybe because I am actually from NY...the pizza is kinda bad :(

But, for the most part, everyone is nice. 

It's meh.
author: Em O.

description: We came here to watch the World Cup Semi Finals because they were streaming the game on two tv's. Overall it was a good choice because we were able to share some tasty margheritza pizza and a glass of pinot grigio. The only downside was that there was no sound streaming from the TV's, but it was a nice relaxing Saturday afternoon.
author: Alice H.

description:
I haven't had service this bad since Paris. Apparently they think that by adding a mandatory 18% gratuity fee (for groups) they can ignore the customers.
We were sat promptly but unfortunately that's the last we saw of timely service. We waited 20 minutes to talk to a server another 15 for water and it wasn't until an hour and a half after we sat down that we had food on the table. They didn't bring out enough plates and silverware... Ay yai yai I could go on but its exhausting.
author: Leticia B.

description:
Great Outer Sunset pizza! My favorite is the Besto (but i get it without roasted potatoes...double starch doesn't make sense), but honestly I have been here quite a bit and love the besto so much that I don't really order anything else only have tried what other people have got.

The reason this doesn't get 5 stars from me is; 
1: Everything besides the pizza is way too pricey in my opinion 
2: They really need different and or more beers on tap
3: They don't have a happy hour!
4: The guys all seem super cool, but I have seen people and I myself have been ignored a little bit, plus I never see a single girl that works there...maybe once... what is up with that?

Still love you Pizza Place. \nm/
author: Skye J.

description:
I suppose this is a good place for pizza if you pick up since they do not deliver and their dine-in service is just plain awful. 

The people who work here do not understand basic food-service customer service.  They have unwritten policies which only serve them and not the customers. 

This place is just another example of outer sunset new-age-y worker-reign-supreme places like Outerlands.
author: William L.

description:
I think I got the wrong pizza. A girl like myself shouldn't have went with two guys. While they were all about meat meat meat, I was more on the lighter palette side. However, being their manly man men, I still managed them to convinced them to try the sweet potato steak fries (maybe the word 'steak' did half the battle for me). It was delicious but way too much, it was literally big stripes of sweet potato, def a plate to share. Their thin cut fried was delicious. We ordered their spaghetti and meat ball. I can't say it's the best that I've had, but it has some home made quality to it that's quite charming.

I think we ordered the Rotten Robbie pizza, it had some sausages on it and I thought it was a little bit too heavy for me. A tad too much pail, but the crust was nicely done, crispy and thin. I wish i had tried the Besto, but i can't feed my boys no meat.I wouldn't say this will be my go to pizza place but I wouldn't mind returning with my friends for future visits. Maybe with a couple of girls next time...
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This pizza spot is large, friendly, and crawling with local families. It is a great place to get a real decent slice of pizza and maybe some wine in a cup. 

They have a back area which seems to be good for large groups or parties. There are always a lot of kids running around & people watching sports at the bar. 

Tip: I wouldn't recommend getting a slice to go. We got ours in a paper bag (no tin foil) and it was already cold by the time we completed the short trip home. If you're gonna stop by, sit, eat and be merry.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
Update: My new pizza loves: The Rocha and the Hawaiian. Yum! 

-------------- 
I used to LOVE this place, especially Timmy's Pie. Went last night, looked at the menu, & ordered a Timmy's Pie. Total bummer. The thinly sliced roasted potatoes were replaced with potato chips! Gone were the mushrooms too. And the caramelized onions were actually pickled. Sooooooooooo NOT what I had ordered or wanted. Please change the printed menu to reflect the changes. Never would have ordered the "new" version. Total waste of money.
author: M F.

description: Hot spot in the outer sunset with delicious pizza. Service can occasionally get compromised when they get busy, hard to place phone orders to pick up pizza.
author: Sophia N.

description: I think the pizza is great and they have a very solid beer selection. Good bar to hang at. One of the better pizza places in the city with a great local vibe.
author: Ben H.

description: Ugh. I wanted to like this place because there is crap all for pizza places in the inner / outer sunset. I was encouraged with the overall 4 star review for this place and some of the pics so we decided to order one and go pick it up. We ordered the dimitri, which sounded good but unfortunately the only flavor profiles I could ascertain was garlic, salt and grease. Yuck!
author: Just A.

description: Write your name down and party size on the clipboard located on the wall at the main entrance.
author: Roger E.

description:
Yummy sweet potato steak fries (not your typical orange skinny fries) and HUGE pizzas!! So good!

Pizza was great! We ordered a large and it was LARGE!!! took the rest home with us and it was delicious!! And a great price. The staff was nice and attentive. Made some chit chat with the waiter about SF. it was rather noisy as there were families with small children, but can't really complain. I'm from Boston and I was rather excited when I saw a Celtics Championship thing on the wall! out of all of the places, in a pizza place in SF! :) def recommend this!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Surprisingly cute and nice! i walked by this place several times before deciding to stop in one night. it reminds me of a sweet little movie and has an old feeling inside. it's just warm and toasty.

the pizza tastes okay. i love that i can drink some wine with my pizza. my friend ordered a salad and it was pretty good.
great service (like all the others said)!
author: Carleen W.

description:
Some nights we're lazy so we wander a few blocks to enjoy a few slices, a couple beers, and split an order of wings.  We always sit at the bar instead of in the dining area, bc, well, we like to sit at bars.

And the slices are huge, generously topped.
author: Meg W.

description:
Pretty great pizza joint.  I am thrilled to have them in the Sunset.  I never go after 6pm or it's a zoo!  Seems packed every night.  I like the fact that if you get a slice, they will heat it up with the toppings of your choice.  I love the crust and often eat the whole slice (with most pizza, the top gets tossed because it's way too thick and dry, like a dog bone).  They have a nice, big selection of toppings including goat cheese, mmmm.  Salads are fresh, organic, and very tasty.  They have unfiltered apple juice if you don't want booze, and I really appreciate that.  I'm not a boozer.

I have had the gluten-free crust, and it's probably the best GF crust you can possibly find.  It was not dry at all, and I ate my pizza about 25 minutes after I picked it up, so it had time to turn dry and crappy.  

My BIG gripe--a measly gluten-free 13-inch pizza + large salad + 1 apple juice cost me $50!!!!  WTF?!!  The gluten-free pizza is WAY, WAY, WAY overpriced.  Can't give them 5 stars because of that, it's just too outrageous that I paid $50 to feed pizza and salad to two people.

Service has been pretty good each time.  I find the staff to be extremely friendly, courteous, and accommodating.
author: Kandi K.

description: Really like this place! We had a pizza with potato and kale and it was delicious, you can even do half and half which I love. There are plenty of beers and tv at the bar along with spacious tables for bigger groups or families and it seems quite popular with kids. Very nice service!
author: B S.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night with friends and it wasn't crowded at all. The wait staff was very friendly and offered up suggestions. The margarita pizza was really good. I will definitely be going back!
author: Katie P.

description: We used to go because it is a couple blocks from the house. Convenient and the food was fast.  In the past 2 months, we have gone twice, we were seated right away and then the wait came.....5 minutes, both times, no one greeted us.  One waiter walked by, hesitated at our table like he was going to welcome us, then just kept walking.  He had just delivered food to the table next to us and couldn't say "hi" and to top it off, his jeans were below his butt and they were wet. Did he just come from the beach? Gross. We walked out both times and have stopped trying....too bad - they used to be better..
author: Cynthia H.

description: Decent pizza, got the margherita pizza. Like the thin crust but I feel like it could have a bit more basil. I mostly only eat costco pizza so its hard to compare (because this is definitely better). Overall it was good but I will still continue to try more pizza places before coming back.
author: Mandy Y.

description:
I L O V E  pizza and was really looking forward to trying this place - it came highly recommended from our concrete contractor who lives up the street. 

But was I at the same place with all the 5-star reviews?? I don't think so. 

Had to blot the grease off the Margherita. Veggie combo with sausage really unremarkable. Dough needs salt and something - like a new recipe. I thought it was the equivalent of cardboard. My daughter said that maybe I had too high of expectations because we live in a cit y with ah-mazing pizza  - Gialina, Little Star, Goat Hill. This place is not worth the calories.
author: Andi S.

description: So I have a sweetheart in the city, and he definitely stole my heart when he started taking me here. I love to eat pizza and I haven't been eating it in a while, but when he took me here I was hooked. We sit and drink an anchorsteam and then dig in to a yummy pizzeria style pizza. He always gets half greek and half Dmitri? for me. The wait is pretty long because they are busy af, but it's so worth it and hardly noticeable because everyone is so nice. I don't mind making the drive from the south bay to visit this guy because I know we will come here and munch once I get there =)
author: Angelynn L.

description: Service is horrible and their food is alright. I rather go and order from seniores than to come here. Which sucks because this restaurant is closer to my house than seniores. But whatever i'll sacrfice it.
author: Tina F.

description: The pizza is absolutely amazing here. Just tried it this past weekend and it quickly became my favorite pizza joint. The service is pretty good too. Try the besto pizza, you will not regret it.
author: Emily G.

description:
Spaghetti and Meatballs are my fav. I usually order an extra meatball for a total of 4, and get this to take home. Then I share with a special friend or my kid for a great dinner. Plenty for 2 and great with red wine and Game of Thrones.  I crave this 1-2 times per month. 

Best Spaghetti & Meatballs in town.
author: M F.

description: I tried this restaurant's delivery again. After checking the status several times in the 1st 30 minutes several times, the delivery time kept getting pushed back.  Once it was pushed back by 20 minutes, I contacted Grubhub to cancel.  I have since contacted them again, but the still show a delivery status, but no response either time.  The status is now 2 and a half hours after originally promised and no pizza. Looking at Grubhub, I see they use their own drivers.  I'm tired of companies that deal with other companies and allow them to give per service so that they can make a couple of extra dollars.  Essentially, this is like hiring a poor employee and doing nothing about them.  Pizza Place is trying to make a couple of extra dollars off of us at the expense of hiring a company that provides poor service. I'm sure my, now Grubhub's, pizza is sitting somewhere near the kitchen and it will be given to a driver old and cold.
author: Dan D.

description:
Neighborhood restaurant with decent pizza and friendly service.

The pizza slices are huge. I ordered the Italian sausage and mushroom.  It had a nice crisp crust but it was rather bland.  The Italian sausage was flavorful and the mushrooms fresh. They also serve a good kale salad with a tangy dressing that was more than two adults could eat.  

This isn't my favorite pizza in town but it was good and I'll return.
author: Donna P.

description: The Dimitri pizza is delicious - but if you order it without mushrooms the pizza is crisper. Something about the mushrooms on the pizza makes it kind of soggy and not that great.
author: Summer L.

description: Decent food. Apparently you can't get their Vegan pizza without the cheese as a slice. This doesn't make sense at all. Not vegetarian friendly. The spinach is decent. Price is not cheap either.
author: Yilun K.

description: We ordered half a Sunset Aloha and half a Margherita, and it was delicious! Crispy crust, juicy tomato sauce and delicious cheese. The food also came very fast and the prices is not bad at all. I just think the interiour needs a little upgrade, it looks like it's been that way since the early 90s era. All in all, a cool place to grab a beer and some delicious slices of pizza!
author: Ellen M.

description:
Vary bad service.  I ordered Pizza with mushrooms and black olives. When I picked up the pizza and I come back at home I saw there were different kind of olives ( Italian style: very salty). I called and the girl told me it were my mistake because they doesn't have black olives. So if i wanted a new pizza I had to wait next day and to talk with the manager. I told to her the black olives  were marked on website..... but she told me to call next day. They lost 4 guest customers

You do attention don't do wrongs when you make a reservation !!
author: Gabri G.

description: Their grinders are really good, but their service is terrible.... we've ordered grinders for lunch for pick up several times, and every time I go in no one says hello or acknowledges that I'm there. Have to wait 10 minutes to get and pay for pre-ordered sandwiches that are literally sitting a few feet away, because the kitchen staff can't be bothered to do something that isn't in their job description. I want to support local businesses, but not when they have such incredibly low regard for their customers.
author: Allison L.

description:
Best east coast pie in town and the wings are delicious as well!

If u like the thin crust type of pizza you will love it. Real cool neighborhood and easy parking. Stop by devils tooth or the produce store as well!
author: Suzanne Y.

description:
I was dropping off something for the other half's cousin & his family was kind enough to take me out to lunch.  We went over to Outerlands first but found a 1.5 hour wait.  When we got there, I didn't expect much because - from the outside - this place just looked like an unsuspecting, casual diner with a small cooking area.  I am very happy to say that my first impressions were wrong.

The 4 of us shared - & finished - 2 whole pizzas.  While i loved the super-finely minced garlic of the Dimitri, it was a little too oily for me.  The Sunset Aloha was like the traditional Hawaiian pizza but with a twist.  It was slightly spicy & the feta made it extra cheese'y.  Unfortunately, the feta flavor got lost in the rest of the ingredients.

We really wanted to try the California Butter Beets but it was the only appetizer on the menu that was not available.  This slight glitch made our otherwise perfect meal a little less perfect.
author: Karen S.

description: Thank you for existing. We have a 15 month old and are mindful of potential dining disasters. The Pizza Place on Noriega has great pizza and salads, a laid back bar area with a good selection, and really, really nice servers. We always feel welcomed and comfortable there. I was able to have a great meal, enjoy 2 glasses of wine, watch Serena Williams win her Open match, and feel like a normal, socializing adult as my daughter noshed on a meatball, some salad and pizza and was delighted to stare at the staff making pizza as well as the other kids. Please never close.
author: christine l.

description:
What a great place to go. From the outside it doesn't look like much but you will enjoy it.
The prices are reasonable too.
Very good service along with excellent food.
 Atmosphere is good and a little noisy so it's easy to have fun.

They have a Wilted spinach salad that's to die for. I had it three times along with wings.

We were in S/Francisco for 7 days and this place got three dinners from us.
author: Rick M.

description:
For a slow Friday afternoon, I felt like we were a bit overlooked. Besides a party of 3 and one guy at the bar, I don't think waiting for our server for 15 min is ok.  When we were seated and served drinks by the hostess or bartender...there were like 4 people behind the bar, 2 of the 4 helped us throughout our 45-60 min dining experience, yet we only saw our server once.  Anyhow, at least who did serve us, they were polite and gracious. 

The pizza was soggy, soggy, soggy. I couldn't even pick it up.  That sucked. The toppings were good, but if you can't even pick it up....then what dood? Well...I don't feel the pizza was salty, but it was very greasy. I don't think this is a place we will be re-visiting. Supporting that statement, the people behind the bar were temporarily distracted by a guy walking in with posters...I get it. He was a homie or vendor or someone...but so are your customers. I was bummed out on this place, we really wanted to like this spot.
author: elizabeth c.

description:
We love this place, it is definitely our go to spot in the neighborhood for pizza.
Great place to take kids for dinner early.
BTW- Buffalo wings are delicious and the olives are a great snack while you wait for the pizza also a good lil selection of beers.
author: Danielle D.

description: I ridiculously love going here. When my SO and I are sitting around during lunch time and we're out of ideas, we definitely go here. At this point I've tried quite a few of their pizza combinations but my favourite is the Rotten Robby because that pesto is just amazing. I recently tried their Save a Chicken Grinder and it was so tasty. Get a side of fries and a bit of wine (or whatever drink you choose) and it makes for a great meal.
author: Shauna S.

description: Great atmosphere great food and great service. The homemade wing sauce is delicious on everything.
author: Anthony M.

description: So sick of the bad customer service--unbelievable when you think about how many great places there are out there.  Pizza is decent but not worth the abuse of the awful attitude of the servers.
author: Jaz S.

description: We love The Pizza Place!  Great slices and salads.  Meathead is a personal favorite!
author: Heather M.

description: Went here on a Sunday with my friend. We immediately loved the vibe. Good food, good service. They definetly got their own style and I like that. Original. The stickers on the napkin holders were cool. So is the car on pizza wheels. Either way I had a pleasant experience here. Coming back whenever I'm in the city again. The wings were yummy and their pizza slices are huge.
author: Desi B.

description:
I loved the thin crust pizza here.  If I knew it was going to be so good I would have ordered and XL and take the rest home. 
The only cons is it is pricy but you get what you pay for.
author: hannah t.

description:
The pizza is some of the best in SF - the toppings are all fresh. The 14" pizza offers a more consistent crust.
ALL of the salads and appetizers are delicious. 
For entrées, the meatballs stand out in the spaghetti dinner, and the chili verde is amazing. 
Large amount of seating, great bar to grab a beer and watch the Giants, and attentive waitstaff. 
You can also catch Red Sox and Celtics games as the owners are from Boston!
author: Jonathan B.

description: I've eaten here dozens of times, take out a dozen times. The only "wrong" is they closed for lunch! The pizzas, salads, vibe are Boston strong. The Pabst Blue Ribbon keeps me coming back for more ... phone orders are easy 75% of the time. It's best to walk-in and order, takes about 30-40 minutes ... time for a PBR! :)
author: Mike S.

description:
While staying at a house a few blocks away from here, my friends decided their first stop in SF would be this place. It was late dinner and everyone was starving for food and beer. Yelp once again did not disappoint. Between 8 of us, we split 2 pizzas, 3 pitchers of beer and sweet potato fries, and it didn't break the bank. Their thin-crust pizza was huge in size and flavor. Our margharita pizza with added garlic was perfectly cooked, and the meat pizza was covered in delicious oily goodness. Beer selection was decent and everyone raved about the sweet potato fries. Thick steak cut, they were moist and delicious when covered with both ranch and hot sauce.

The group loved the food so much that we came back right before heading to the airport! 4 of us split the fries, a side salad and a veggie calzone, which was basically a medium pizza bent in half. Again everything was delicious and we didn't feel broke after buying our meal. If I find myself in the Outer Sunset again, I'll definitely be checking this place out!
author: Catherine E.

description:
Screw the pizza, go for the salad!  I had a Kale salad with pecorino croutons, red onion, white beans lightly tossed in fantastic vinaigrette. Spectacular.

Throw in a nice Amber with pleasant service and you've got a winner.  

However, as a former East Coaster I can attest the pizza is like a cousin twice removed. Yes, it's a thin crust, but the sauce is lacking flavor and the cheese is oily. My kid thought it was fine.
author: J. M.

description:
The pizza is definitely on point here, no doubt about it. Current favorite =  sliced meatballs,  caramelized onions and arugula. And their gluten-free crust is perfect. 

HOWEVER the dish that practically makes me salivate just thinking about it is their Pork Chile Verde. Large chunks of slow-cooked pork that falls apart at the touch of a fork, green chiles and white beans...Topped off with some crispy tortillas and a bit of sour cream...sigh...so.so.so.good. It's easily split between two if you order a salad on the side. 

It's only available after 5:30 (I imagine it's awesomeness takes some time to recreate each day) so make sure you are there for dinner if you want to get your verde on. 

Thank you Pizza Place...my taste buds have been dying for Mexican comfort food and you nailed it. 

(Our service has been a little hit or miss when we've dined in and we usually order take out. Food is typically ready in 15-20 minutes.)
author: Erin K.

description:
i made this account because it was easier than walking my hungry, lazy butt back to get them to fix my order. 

i've been here a few times and don't really care for their timmy's pie, it's bland and the potatoes are too thin. so i decided to try making my own vegan pizza.

the menu in the window said $14.50 for a 14" and i was going to get the tomatoes, onions and garlic which were all listed for $1.00 and the artichokes for $3.00.

i went to order and told the guy i wanted the vegan pesto. he asked if it was the base or a topping i told him the base. he wrote this all down on some piece of receipt paper. i figured my pizza would be $22 max with tax and what not.

forty minutes go by i leave the beach to go get my pizza, the guy shows me the pizza and i quickly glanced to make sure there was no cheese. and then he gives me the bill. $29.91, which is insanely overpriced for a 14" with four toppings. i just wanted to eat so i was going to cut my losses and just never come here again.

i get back to the beach and my partner opens the box and notices there's no artichoke hearts. at that point i'm super frustrated because they didn't even make the pizza right. this bland, mediocre, oily pizza cost me thirty bucks. 

i got charged the prices that are on their website even though their menu says otherwise. that also means that my pesto which was a base cost me three dollars and i got charged for artichoke hearts that weren't even on my pizza.

if i was going to eat something that unsatisfying from this place i should have just got the timmy's pie, it would have saved me ten bucks.
author: Dana F.

description:
In my opinion, the meat pizza didn't have enough cheese. It did have enough meat. I suspect the sausage was made in house.
For sure though, one of the waitstaff is cute!
author: Fhinz B.

description: Love this place. The Rotten Robbie, Caesar salad, gigantic pizzas, beer. Best pizza on this side of the city.
author: Amy M.

description: This place gave me exactly what I was looking for. They have whole pizzas, or pizza by the slice. Fresh toppings. Slices are big. There's also a great selection of appetizers and other entrees. For dinner until close, they offer pasta dishes - classics like cheese ravioli, spaghetti and meatballs, etc. Sit in the dining area or at the bar. Oh there's also a great selection of beer and a few wines behind the bar. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, no complaints!
author: Ben S.

description:
You came here for pizza?  Let me recommend the fries instead!

Unusually cooked with a soft inside and super crispy outer layer.  The Fries are tasty and offer  enjoyment all by themselves.  But even better when dipped into the chocolate milk ( or a thick chocolate shake you snuck in the door!)   

Seriously, these fries are good enough to make a meal out of.  Ordered  with a side of wings, or along with the Antipasti plate and you will never miss the pizza!  Not even one bit.
author: Chris R.

description: Great pizza place with a very local feel, bright and airy. Surfers welcome. We got those crazy steak-cut sweet potato fries, which is like 3 sweet potatoes, so filling. The pizza was pretty good too, with a thin crust and basically whatever toppings you want. Looks like they have some great salads, too.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Called three times tonight to order pizza. One time I was placed on hold for over 12 minutes before I finally hung up. 

I know Saturday nights are slammed but a hold that long is really poor form, poor service.
author: Shestin S.

description: The pizza is awesome. The service is quick and friendly and they didn't shut down my weird requests. Seriously though, this pizza is better than some that I had in Italy.
author: Kim H.

description:
The Pizza Place on Noriega has great pizza... and I am picky about pizza.

They have many interesting, different pizza combinations, and usually a special. All of the specialty pizzas are available by the slice, which is nice, since many places only offer the basics by the slice.

You also have to try the fries.. They are steak cut and full of salty goodness.

I would try to check in 20 ish minutes before you'd like to sit down. More if you have a larger party. I went on a Saturday night and there was a little bit of a wait.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
Food court pizza without the people watching and Macy's "ONE DAY ONLY" Sale.

Greasy, sloppy and nasty with terribly cheap ingredients. Cheese resembles the digornio container in the super market cheese aisle that's a day from spoiled. Did I mention it's oil slick greasy and disgusting????
author: Hector G.

description:
Not too bad.  The place is busy, so we had to wait for a table to open up.  Took about 5-10mins.  Staff were really nice.  Really liked the atmosphere, it was relaxing, after hanging out at the beach.  

For two people we split a medium pizza and it was more than enough for us to munch on.  Boyfriend got the organic beer.  He said it was amazing and almost had a vanilla hint to it.  For thin crust pizza it was not bad, but I do love deep dish more.  Best deal is to get the specials, you save more money rather than adding $1 per topping.
author: Michelle M.

description: The service was terrific!  My family is gluten intolerant so had the gluten free pizza. It was one of the better gluten free pizzas we've eaten.  The chic wings were crispy and juicy and the Mexican pork dish was really good too.  Will definitely go again.
author: M S.

description: Great family-friendly neighborhood pizza place. Casual atmosphere with great food and beer.
author: Matt B.

description:
I didnt know this exist until i drove by. So i decided to try here for the next time whenever i want pizza.
Well I did. Here goes.
Pizza cooked in a real oven. Soft crust. Pretty big pizza.
Ordered the Meat Head special. Everything was good but it was a bit too salty and was pretty expensive.
Unfortunately, I cant rate on their service since I only ordered to go. But workers there seems nice. Nothing too bad. More people there than I expected. Will try again next time.

If you like beer n pizza and want to watch a game, check this place out. Can be good or bad. Try before you judge right?
author: Albert W.

description:
I feel the need to express my newfound displeasure - hate is such a harsh word - for this place. As I once worked nearby, supporting local businesses was the proper thing to do, especially if they're just getting started. So of course as soon as TPPON opened, my coworkers and I ordered pizzas from this location specifically on a consistent basis. Fresh, good, clean, oily pesto pizzas with a fantastic thin crust. Everything was well-sliced (no need for tearing) and steaming hot, as it was right out of the oven.

Those were the good days, a couple of years ago.

In more recent times, when I've been back home and tried to order here, I've been ignored, served the wrong order, deafened, and plain forgotten by my waitress. Worst wait staff in San Francisco, I dare say. The pizzas (slices, anyway) are lackluster, taste cheap (for high prices!), and are not worth your time. Toppings fall off, more grease than usual (think PUDDLES), crust is way too hard to be a good NY-style pizza, and really... I'm never returning. I'd much rather trek up to Pizza Orgasmica!
author: Colleen M.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place due to the great reviews I have read.
But sadly, I was disappointed with my experience there. 

I ordered a medium size pizza  that was half of the Dimitri and half of the Rotten Robby.  It was a to-go order so I waited while watching the giants game with my boyfriend. 

After waiting and waiting, it took an hour to receive our order which I thought was weird since generally to-go orders have a higher priority than the customers sitting down in the restaurant. But it depends.

For the pizza, it was super greasy which I was not expecting from the previous reviews I read, and the crust was super thin and hard to chew. Even after using a napkin to remove some oil, was the pizza still really greasy. Since the pizza had thin crust, it flopped over while I ate it, and my toppings would slide right off. 

Overall, there's a slight chance I may come back again to try something besides pizza, but other than that, there are other pizza places I would rather go to instead.
author: Stephanie A.

description: This place is below average.  Pizza crust is like cardboard.   Not very flavorful at all.
author: Graham T.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a Tuesday night. It was pretty busy, especially at the bar and with the people coming in for takeout. The dining area was about half full. It took about 20 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us, which in my opinion is pretty unreasonable. But whatever, we were hungry and too lazy to go anywhere else.

Their sweet potato fries were my favorite part of the meal. Huge, thick slices of sweet potatoes with crispy, lightly salted skin that I dipped in buffalo (with cream?) sauce. Yum!

The pizza was....okay. I think it really depends on what your mood is. If you want something greasy and salty, this pizza is for you. We ordered a medium pizza. Half Rotten Robbi and half Dmitri. The pizza was overflowing with tasty toppings. The  main problem we had was that the crust was so thin and the toppings were so oily and plentiful, that the crust was a soggy mess. It was definitely a knife and fork pizza. Also, I have a pretty high tolerance for grease, and I love salty food but this was borderline too much for me. 

I think I may come back for the fries, and skip the pizza.

Price for sweet potato fries, medium pizza with tons of toppings, and a Coke came out to about $30. Pretty reasonable.
author: Stella L.

description: Love this place! Whenever I visit my friend in SF we eat here. They have probably the best blue cheese salad I've ever had! You can taste the quality! Their pizza is hella good too! No complaints here. Try them out!
author: Evangelina B.

description:
Had some time to kill in between jobs. Stopped by for a bite to eat. Very cool place. Good pizza, fun atmosphere. Reasonable prices. 

I will definitely come back to this place if I'm in the area.
author: Rick J.

description: Such an underrated sunset pizza joint! The staff is really friendly, there's a bar and plenty of seating, and has a great pizza and beer menu. There's a lot of different types of pizza and toppings and there's vegan options as well. The pizza is pretty tasty but is a little underwhelming. I still recommend coming here though since it's one of the more decent pizza places in the sunset.
author: Anastasia P.

description: Topnotch, delicious pizza. I've been eating pizza here ever since they first opened. And it has always been excellent, the staff is mostly always friendly, even under pressure on busier nights (like with Warriors games). For those GF foodies out there, their GF pie is pretty tasty.
author: Kathryn S.

description:
$11.00 for a plate of spaghetti? Plain spaghetti with some store bought sauce sitting on top of it? Oh, and not to mention when the plate is delivered the server asks if you want a fork? 

What can a person say after that?

Never going back.
author: Wayne B.

description:
I ordered a slice of caramelized onions, goat cheese, arugula, and roasted red peppers, split french fries with three of my friends, and ordered the sundae to top it off. The food was great but the service was ________ (insert profanity here). I asked for water and she told me to pour it myself pointing to a water dispenser in the corner. I decided to order a soda because I didn't trust the containers in the corner but our waitress forgot and I had to ask the dude that brought our food. My friend ordered garlic bread with her slice, our waitress forgot, she asked for the beer menu and the waitress disappeared, we got our food, the waitress didn't come back, it was too late for her to order a beer because our sundae was coming out. Then another waitress actually poured us water!!!! I asked for her to split the checks initially and she said she'd just remember what we ordered and split it in the end. She didn't remember and all of our checks were mismatched. We paid them anyways to get the hell out of there.

I really want to like this place but the service makes it too damn hard.
author: Alexis A.

description:
In this downtrodden economy, the devaluing of cash in your pocket and corporate cost cutting is painfully apparent - despite a recent abatement, gas prices have generally skyrocketed; Disneyland no longer offers free admission on birthdays; college educations have debatable worth; and dependable dollar menu residents like Jack in the Box tacos and McDonalds soft serve have unfortunately graduated.  At the same time, heroes for the populace have begun to emerge, and The Pizza Place on Noriega stands firmly among them, offering massive pies at affordable prices to young and old, peasant and royalty, and gamers and businessmen indiscriminately.

The Pizza Place's Dimitri and Besto provide vastly differing experiences.  Although their gargantuan sizes are never called into question, the Besto's pesto and potato intriguing combination struggle to offset the brick-like crust that is an inevitable precursor to TMJ.  On the other hand, luscious grease flowing freely from the copious meaty toppings thoroughly soak the supple foundation of the Dimitri, causing satisfied tastebuds to easily overwhelm any pangs of guilt emanating from a burdened heart due to decreased health.

Will return for affordable pizzas!
author: Andrew M.

description:
I wanted to like this neighborhood pizza place.  It's got character and a charmingly casual vibe: a painting of an old car with pizza wheels, beer on tap, wine, open kitchen, 3 guys/employees who seem to love what they're doing (or maybe they just love the loud music), whether it's  making the hand tossed pizza or making the salads. The pizza is baked in a brick oven and they have some interesting toppings, like roasted garlic, feta, potato, capers, artichoke hearts, Zoe's Meats of Petaluma, etc.  They also have dinner specials like beef brisket with greens and white beans.  Their grinders are made with famous Amoroso rolls from Philly and Zoe's Meats.

If you want a slice of pizza, you can get a base of cheese, pepperoni or mushroom pizza ($3.50) and then add on the toppings you want (50 cents for the first topping, 25 cents each for additional toppings).  They heat the slice up in the oven.  I added potato, fresh garlic and caramelized onions to a slice of mushroom pizza.  It's a BIG slice topped with tons of the toppings.  I loved my choice of toppings.  The potato slices were paper thin.  The thin crust was a bit crispy on the edges.  I liked the crust but the slice was extremely GREASY and the sauce was too salty.  

Such a shame, the pizza had promise but I'll never like super greasy pizza.  And this was the veggie pizza that was super greasy, imagine what a slice of pepperoni would be like.  I might come back for the dinner specials or grinders though.
author: Lolia S.

description: The food is good quality, especially the pizza. They have gluten free pizza (always a plus for my family) and offer their regular pizza by the slice (perfect for eating at the beach a couple blocks away.) We had french fries (awesome), green salad (very good) and ravioli (just so so). Fun decor and decent service. We will be back!
author: Erika B.

description:
The pizza here is simply splendid.

However, every time I come here I feel less and less welcome, despite the fact that I tip at least 20% every time.

It's too bad, because the pizza is really damn good.
author: Farrell W.

description:
Very good pizza. I've been living a few blocks away for a while and hadn't had the chance to visit until this weekend. We were seated right away, but ended up being basically at the same table as another 2 person group, which was kind of weird since there were plenty of tables open. Seemed like they wanted everyone crammed into the same section to make it easier. The waiter was great and let us know exactly how long we could expect the pizza to take (30 minutes) and it ended up being a little faster than that. 

We ordered the Besto - pesto, feta, garlic, not sure what else, but it was amazing. Thin crust but they still have enough toppings so that it doesn't just taste like you're eating a cracker. It seemed pretty pricey when we looked at the menu, but the media pizza actually turned out to be the perfect size for three people. Didn't order any of the appetizers, but the guys next to us did and they looked delicious. If only I hadn't stopped eating meat - the wings looked phenom.
author: Lauren D.

description: Great neighborhood bar: pizza by the slice, cheap beer, and a big TV. Everyone is super friendly too!
author: Emily H.

description:
I've been to this place a few times.  The pizza isn't the greatest, but the spaghetti is great.  It's loud.  It's not very warm inside, meaning it doesn't seem all that welcoming.  It's more of something some frat-boys might have thrown together quickly to start selling pizzas.  It could do with a woman's touch and bring some ambiance into the place.  
Now, if you want GREAT pizza that delivers to the Noriega beach area, I recommend Donairo's Pizza at 33rd & Geary.
author: Lori B.

description: The pizza here is freaking amazing. Yeah, deep dish and pan-fried or Arizmendi slices are awesome, but sometimes you just need a solid pie that's well-made and hits the spot. Well, this place delivers (figuratively but NOT literally)! Unfortunately it's also a bit pricey, but its a local and delicious pizza shack that I happily support.
author: Andrew T.

description:
The pizza here was a 3...but salad was a 5!

I ordered a half aloha and half rotten bobby. Both pizzas had really fresh toppings and the large was HUGEE!!!! It was the size of a normal extra large at other places.  The only gripe I have and it IS a big gripe is that the middle of the pizza gets soggy very very quickly. It took me half an hour to drive from the restaurant to my house and the middle was like a wet sponge. I popped it back in the oven for about 10 min and that did help the soggyness go away a lot (although you got to eat it quick before it comes back!).  Definitely gotta figure out some way to make the crust stay crisp.

I ordered the warm spinach salad and it was DEEEELICIOUS!! the bacon adds a very nice extra oomph to the flavor! and the cranberries were a nice touch too.

I am definitely coming back here to try to pork chile verde and the baked sweet potato fries next time...
author: Em F.

description: They're pretty good, I'm always under the impression that the pizza is going to be better than it is though. Extra star for the killer nice servers.
author: Crystal F.

description:
Yummy! The first visit ordered a few pizzas and apps. All were good, but Timmy's pie-vegan style is ridiculous! The veggies and the spices are delicious, even the vegan crust is good. 

That night I had a serious craving for cheese pizza and root beer. Their margherita pizza satisfied the ache and there was no judgement for ordering a carafe of red wine to wash down the pizza and root beer!

Have since ordered take out and the staff are great. This place gets extremely busy, yet their prediction times for our order were accurate, the food awesome and the people just pleasant to deal with. Thank you!
author: Erin G.

description:
I had such high hopes for my pizza craving but this place failed on two pizzas. 

We had the sweet potato fries (with the ranch dressing and the Buffalo wings dressings) and they were very good; looking like they were more oven baked than fried. They were not greasy, but moist and tender inside, skins and all. Very nice.

Then the vaunted wilted spinach salad was indeed excellent and plenty enough to share a an appetizer.

Good thing too because the pizza took it's sweet time walking over from Naples italy to get to us. It took an easy1/2 hour to get a medium (14") pie served to us and yet we saw plenty of large (20") pies getting put in take-out boxes at a much higher speed. This tells me that they prioritize their take out orders over their internal patrons.

We ordered a 14" medium pie 1/2 & 1/2 Dimitri and Greek. Both failed to impress. The Dimitri for its sausage, mushroom, cheese and musty old-tasting garlic, and lack of seasonings (tasted much better with the oregano and parmesan cheese at the table). The Greek, for all it's fresh toppings, was again under flavored, but at least it's crust stayed crisper than the other 1/2.

The atmosphere was really nice the waiter was pleasant but the water served was plain tap water at room temperature (no ice) and the cost per person with the two appy's (with tip) came to about $15. 

I would be interested to see how their spaghetti and meatballs are or their pork-loin dinners are for $13 each so I am withholding further judgement until we return.   

But to serve old garlic on pizza? Meh!
author: Glenn H.

description: Super friendly staff (at least at 2pm on a Sunday). Pizza is decent but not spectacular. Really like that they do pizza by the slice, though!
author: Greg S.

description: Definitely one of the more authentic NY style I've had here, with just the right cheese and crust consistency and a very respectable tangy sauce.  Worth the trip to the Outer Sunset. And a friendly staff and handful of craft beers on tap, to boot! I'll be back.
author: A.J. F.

description: Three words. Damn good beer. Okay, more words to say. Pizza is affordable and delicious. Sweet potato steak fries equal comfort food, though it was a little bland. But the beer hits the spot so well.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Ordered a mix green salad with a Margherita pizza. 

The salad was served on a plate with a crack on its rounded edge. A little prodding and it appeared that I could have chipped away a nice chunk of fine china. The salad itself was good, served in a balsamic dressing, and I was relieved not to have chewed upon any parts of the plate.

The pizza wasn't bad, either, but the sauce wasn't flavorful enough for me. Really, there was nothing about the pizza that stood out, flavor wise. It definitely wasn't soggy, though. 

The staff was friendly enough & I didn't have to wait long for the food. They played the Misfits on the stereo, and it seems this pizzeria has a real punk rock attitude/edge going for it. As they closed, they played some Black Sabbath, too. Ozzy & Glen Danzig aren't two vocalists you associate with Italian food, but I've heard enough Sinatra & Dean Martin, so the punk rock/metal music didn't bother me at all.
author: Lew A.

description: My husband & I had dinner here tonight. We ordered a medium pizza, which was perfect for 2! We only waited 15 minutes to be seated. We had 3 different people serving us which is something you don't normally get at those chain restaurants, so we were very impressed! We'll be coming back here!
author: Kimberly A.

description: I love the pizza place, and it would get 5 stars, EXCEPT for the fact that they charge 50 cents if you need extra dressing or ketchup, and in my opinion they totally don't give enough dressing or ketchup in the first place!  They have huge salads, and huge french fries, with a little tiny ramican of condiment.  In fact, my hubby went there recently and didn't want the spicy sauce that comes w the sweet potato fries, asked for ketchup instead, and got charged 50 cents.  Ridiculous.  We are huge supporters, and frequent this restaurant often, so, Noriega Pizza place, please give more condiment (without charge, we are not fans of this, and I'm certain we are not the only ones) and we will continue coming often.
author: Bridget J.

description:
This place is straight to the point, "the pizza place". lol My first impression was, "oh great another casual pizza place that will be pricy and serve small servings", boy I was wrong. 

My classmates and I came here for a celebration after finals. We ordered the Rotten Robby (recommended) and the really meaty one. We ordered medium sized and it was really big... I was only able to eat 2 slices and I was done but I am the dude who can eat an entire pizza hut large box alone (if I tried). It's quite high in price but the portions and occasion is worth it! 

I recommend this place if you love pizza or you're celebrating with your buddies. I will be back one day.
author: Victor Q.

description: Went here with my girlfriend on a Sunday night recently and had a good time. Yes, it does matter what you order and you HAVE to get the Dimitri. We got a large and had to substitute the mushrooms with green peppers, but the Zoe's Pepperoni, crumbled sausage, garlic, cheese and red sauce are blended perfectly together for the tastiest pizza they offer. The crust is thin, but not too thin and this is one of the more solid East Coast style pizza places in the city. Combined with a carafe of a nice red wine and it was $60 out the door (including a $12 tip for excellent service). I will definitely be back.
author: Jared C.

description:
This is my favorite place to get pizza by the slice and a beer in all of SF.  It's close to the beach, they have a patio for sunny days, and their food is YUMMMMY!

Me and my boyfriend usually grab a couple slices, a couple pints, and share the wings (w/blue cheese), and sweet potato fries (huge wedges from heaven).

LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE the food and the space.

PS- the car on the wall with rotating pizza wheels is a hilarious touch!
author: Kristina F.

description:
I really really reaaaallly wanted to like this place. I'm gluten, egg, and dairy intolerant, so when I saw all the little "GF" symbols on their menu I was stoked! A gluten free friendly pizza place! I was so wrong though. I've read some of the reviews about their gluten free pizza on here, and I don't understand how people enjoy it. Maybe the kitchen was having a bad day when I went? But that's no excuse for the tiny overpriced rock hard "pizza" I received. It's +$6 to make any 14" pizza gluten free, which I was okay with, because I was stoked to eat pizza. My friend ordered a regular 14" and I got the gluten free 14". When our food arrived, his pizza was going over the edge of the tray, I would say he received a 15" pizza, and my gluten free pizza was a good 2 inches smaller, nestled well within the border of the tray. So, when I pay an extra $6, I expect to at least get the same amount of food as the non-gluten free. 

Okay, so past the size rip off, the pizza was rock hard, a little burnt and extremely dense. My friend could hear me crunching away at it from across the table, trying to break off pieces with my back teeth. And when I hit it on my plate it made a solid "tink." Also, I ordered the vegan pizza, because I'm lactose intolerant, and I thought it had vegan cheese on it, which it didn't, but that was me being assumptive, and that's not the restaurant's problem. (But how great would it be it they had vegan cheese?!) Anyway, so I got a rock hard pizza with pesto, roasted potatoes, roasted red peppers, mushrooms, mini tomatoes, and caramelized onions on top. The potatoes were burnt, some black, and extremely crunchy, I ended up picking most of them off. 

Overall, it was a terrible experience. I'm a college student, and was excited to splurge on a delicious gluten free pizza, and ended up paying $22 for the worst pizza I've ever had.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Great pizza in SF! Huge slices and their crust is pretty damn close to NYC style. If you like Hawaiian try their take on it, "Aloha" style. Make sure to call ahead since waiting for a pie takes up to 30 minutes.
author: Christian E.

description:
I am originally from Boston and the only thing I miss from there besides my family is the pizza. This is probably the closest thing to Regina's in Boston (which is the BEST pizza in the world), though Gaspare's on Geary is right up there too. I love this place and the pizza is huge!

To the folks who are giving it one star - you clearly are tainted by doughy, thick west coast crappy pizza and don't know what good pizza is supposed to taste like!

TPPON should offer olive oil bottles on the table just like Regina's does. That would make me extra happy.
author: Liz C.

description:
Finally found my favorite thin crusted pizza place! 

Service: Very friendly and nice people working here, got seated within seconds. Ordered 2 slices of pizza and it came out in about 7-10 mins. 

Atmosphere: Very clean and tidy for a pizza place. There is a back patio but unfortunately I haven't had a chance to check that out yet. There is a bar in the front and a dining area in the other room. 

Pizza: $3.00 for a very big slice of thin crusted pizza and $.50 per topping. I love the way they put a generous amount of toppings on top and layered nicely right before the pizza is baked in the brick oven pizza. 

mmMmm approved!!
author: Ubb S.

description: The wait staff were friendly but the pizza was was so thin, soggy and greasy that my wife had to ask for a fork. The crust had no flavor at all. The place smelled really nice but I was disappointed with the pizza. My wife's salad tasted great and they had a good draft beer selection.
author: Ryan N.

description:
This place is both a surprise and a relief. Noriega can seem like one of those "wasteland" avenues, but you'll need to get yourself out to the region past 45th Ave to really find the good stuff. The Pizza Place offers great, interesting food that offers a lot of bang for your buck. 

If you're on the hungrier side, I suggest getting a side of sweet potato steak fries. It comes with a side of buffalo sauce, celery, carrots, and ranch--like a guiltless buffalo wing platter. The fries are done perfectly, and the buffalo flavor makes a surprisingly awesome complement.

I was here with my mom, who is restricted to a gluten-free diet. Luckily, they can make any of their pizzas using gluten-free crust! It didn't taste any different than a regular one would. We got our pizza with roasted garlic and mushrooms...always a good decision. I've also tried Timmy's Pie, which was a little weird, but a nice option if you have a vegan friend. They should really put some Daiya on that thing. 

Good news! If you're hankering for pizza but don't feel like committing to an entire pie, they offer single slices starting from $3! They're HUGE slices, too. 

They also have a great beer/wine selection. Service depends completely on the time of day, but during the few times I've been there, it's been great.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Got pizza from here today, and when I got home, the oil was literally seeping through the box. I was disgusted. It was very good, but the pizza was practically falling apart as I was eating because it was so oily!!!

The french fries were very good, as usual. I think I need to find a new place for pizza though.

Oh, I recently tried the sandwiches ..errr, "grinders". Noooot bad, guys!
author: Erica A.

description:
Great staff and great food. Recently(ish) expanded to have a back room which is great for large parties (best to reserve in advance) and a back door patio (but you can't smoke out there). Yummy beers on tap and the bar is a perfect place to he a drink and a slice after work or a day at the beach. Big plus is you know they will always have the Giants game on! 
Thin crust pizza. Gluten free options! Yummy salads and calzones and buffalo wings! Pitchers of beer as well!
author: Arika E.

description:
Ordered three sandwiches over the phone and was told it would be 15 minutes. Over 40 minutes later my order was ready. No "sorry about the wait" or even a "thank you". Worst damn service I've experienced from any local business in the sunset. There were at least 10 open tables and I wasn't even offered a seat while I waited the extra half hour for my food. 
There's too many excellent pizza joints in the city to waste your money on an average pie here. They make really good sandwiches, but not nearly worth waiting 40 plus minutes or the crappy service. Go to Java Beach or gene's liquor on taraval for an awesome sandwich without the horrible attitude.
author: Troy N.

description:
Well, color me re-born.  I really love The Pizza Place.  The Spicoli (double cheese/sausage) is amazing.   Yeah, so I said it was greasy in2008.  Still is kinda - but...c'mon : it's double cheese and sausage !  What was I expecting ?  The only pizza I blot - and blot proudly.  The folks are nice, the setting is nice (usually packed!)  They have a great salad w/Bleu Cheese and Bacon which is other-worldly.
   Go Pizza Place !
author: Mary N.

description: Holiday Munchies Attack...half Sunset Aloha half tomato and broccolini....do me. do me so hard.  You are the pizza of my dreams. dream lover pizza.
author: Chelsey G.

description: This place has gluten free pizza! It's a little greasy, but it's the greasy that I crave. Really convenient if you want to run and pick up pizza, or you can eat in. Awesome little oasis by the sea.
author: Turi F.

description:
Hmmmm I thought I reviewed this place before....

always heard good things. but im indifferent sometimes. the first time, the pizza really just hit me as super oily and thin. and salty. it was good, but just soooo...oily and heavy....the sweet potato fries were okay but bf loves them. sauces that came with them were weird, but yay for the few pieces of veggie sticks they include.

the last time we went we got the rottin robbie....still a bit oily but it tasted good and i was happy. but kind of expensive...i wouldnt prefer this one to other pizza places. I prefer the thick crust kind...

we always order on the phone, never ate in.
author: Christine M.

description:
A jewel next to the beach, weather you live in the neighborhood or not, you need to make this spot your next destination!! Great selection of beer and wine, an eclectic menu with some traditional offerings, place has a great "DIY" non corporate attitude!

Grab a made to order slice and a beer for lunch, or come in for dinner: My all time favorite is a warm wilted spinach salad and a gluten free Sunset Aloha( spicy cappicola and pineapple, unnh!) thats right, GLUTEN FREE !! Nice option for persons with special dietary needs.
author: Scott B.

description:
Come here and get the Dimitri!  Every time my bf and I eat here, that's what were having.  It has sausage, pepperoni, garlic and mushrooms, simple but soooo delicious, especially with the thin and crispy crust.  This last time we ordered the blue cheese wedge salad which was surprisingly good.  The blue cheese dressing was loaded with blue cheese chunks.

A little out of the way from our house, but we make the trek for some tasty pizza!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
The olive plate had an assortment of mêlée/mushy olives that were a little on the funny side. The sweet potatoe steak fries were excellent - made from white Japanese sweet potatoes which are more like a white potato.

Our pizza -- 1st time -- was bad. It was the pesto/cheese free one. The crust was dry and tasted like cheap white bread. The pizza very oily (from the pesto) with the caramelized onions as wet mushy globs.   The thin sliced roasted potatoes could have been good, but tasted like they had been roasted a few days ago and left unsealed in the fridge. They were dry and chewy.  It was if all the ingredients had been cooked separately and then tossed on to some dough leaving the crust perfectly cooked, but all the ingredients over done.  some fresh basil on top would have at least added a nice color to the near black pesto.

I had the waiter try the potato on the pizza and he agreed it wasn't right. I thought he'd comp my beer and everyone would be happy, but he just looked kinda sad. So I left him a sad tip.  I always over tip, but I felt like everyone in the place smoked a bowl right before work and forgot about why they were there.

i was so emotionally unsatisfied, that the first thing i did when i came home was start my own pizza.  its cooking now while i write this.
author: caleb G.

description:
Awesome. Love what these guys are doing, and even better that they are doing it in the Sunset!

If you have had Amici's and liked it, prepare to be impressed. Fantastic ingredient quality, friendly staff, and in what is now a multitude of visits they have gotten my order right every single time. The pizza of course is amazing (east coast style thin crust cooked in a proper pizza oven), but the spaghetti and meatballs are not to be missed!
author: Jon J.

description:
A decent pizza place out in the sunset. Lots of choices, and you can create your own pizzas. I like the thin crusts. Ingredients are included generously and flavors aren't too heavy for even the meatier pizzas. 

Nice spot that's spacious and clean. Good ambience and decent service. Overall good experience!
author: Antoinette S.

description: Super friendly staff and I loved the gluten free veggie pizza so much, I had to go back!  Chicken wings and sweet potato fries as well as the kale salad were tasty side dishes I tried.  YUM!
author: Jenn C.

description:
Pizza for breakfast was a little bit weird, but my boyfriend and I were running on a time schedule and had to grab something to eat before practice. There were people already sitting at the restaurant at 11 (ok, I guess it was lunch but breakfast for the two of us) watching the Giants game at the bar or dining-in for pizza. 

We ordered a slice of the Meat Head and a slice of the pepperoni. There was nothing good about our pizza when we got it. The Meat head literally had a slice of ham on top along with slices of salami, cooked. Cooked salami is almost always a no-no! It gets extremely gamey to the point where it has a sewage taste... BLECH!!! My pepperoni was the safe choice, but it was far from satisfying... It's a cute hangout place in outer sunset, but I can't seem to say anything good about their food.
author: Rosanne L.

description: Pizza, spaghetti with meatballs, salad and chili verde! Odd combination of foods but definitely worth it!
author: Ian M.

description:
This pizza is gooooooooood.  Sexy good.  

At first I was thinking "ew, way too expensive", but when you get the pizza and it takes up almost all the space on the table, you realize it's worth the price.  Literally the biggest pizza I've ever been served.  

The sauce and crust and cheese are the stuff of dreams.

Our service was totally fine!  He was attentive, friendly, and normal.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I discovered a pretty good dea here: a slice of pizza with 3 toppings for $4 and a pint of beer for $5.  The bill came out to be $9, meaning they don't charge tax on top of the price on the menu.  I guess I'll reward them an extra star for that, along with their nice staff here.

One thing of note is that the pizza pies come in only two sizes: medium and large.  Therefore, make sure you and your party have an appetite for at least a medium.
author: H K.

description:
pizza way too oily (dripping) and salty even it's an Aloha (pineapple) pizza. Was suggested to get a large size pizza for 2 adults and 2 four-year-olds, but ended up bringing half back home. 

We  need to stick to Irving Pizza!!
author: Paulette T.

description: As a nj transplant, I've gotta give this place lots of credit for making a delicious thin and perfectly balanced cheese-sauce pizza. I love that they sell it by the slice even if you order-in. The pasta and meatballs are amazing too! The marinara sauce is finger-licking good! I don't like cheese bread but I tried theirs and wow. It's all delicious!!
author: Tamz O.

description:
A quite good east coast pizzeria just three blocks from the beach. Thin crust with not too much cheese. Also, the only place I've ever seen which has fresh jalapeño as a topping (by fresh, I mean not pickled).

They make a gluten-free crust (whole pies only) that is the first I've ever liked.

Very friendly staff. Does grinders in the afternoons and spaghetti in the evenings, and a monthly pop-up "farmers' market" restaurant once a month.
author: Doc Splendid E.

description:
A slice of heaven!

I've eaten pizza all over Italy, and in Europe where Italian cuisine reigns. I've had the best New York & New Jersey slices, the famed Chicago deep dish, and at some of the best gourmet places in San Francisco. My own family ran a traditional Italian pizzeria, for years, and I'd sworn there was none better.

Today, I had an experience in pizza. 

I was in the neighborhood saw "The Pizza Place on Noriega" and wondered if they were any good. 

On a recommendation from the guy behind the counter, I ordered two slices of Sunset Aloha. The flavors were individually powerful, jumping off of the slice. Slightly smokey coppacola, thinly sliced, a little crispy and just the right amount of red sauce with a hint of spiciness, bits of pineapple and feta ducking between the airy layers of meat, and sweet Jesus, the crust. Perfection.

Maybe it was the right cook on the right day, and the ingredients were especially fresh. Suffice to say, this is the best slice of pizza I have ever had. 

Thank you so much guys; you MADE my day.

P.S. I've ordered the whole Sunset Aloha and although pretty amazing, it's not the same as the slice - not as crispy. Slices are much better.
author: S S.

description:
Pizza Pizza Pizza.  Came here today and tried the Rotten Robbie Pizza.  
Heard decent things bout this place and had pretty high expectations but when the pizza came out, it just looked like a pile of grease on crust  I think you can get a heart attack eating here everyday for a week.  The pizza tasted alright but it was soggy.  I looked at other people's pizza that they ordered and the pepperoni looked appetizing but not sure if i will give them another chance because there are good options in this area such as irving pizza and senoires.
author: Hugh L.

description: Best East Coast style pizza in the city. Can't believe we got so lucky in the Outer Sunset to have such an authentic pizza place. If you miss your East Coast pizza after having moved out west, go to The Pizza Place on Noriega. It is the best!
author: Kim B.

description:
1.  According to my boyfriend this place is dominated by surfer dudes.  Asian people (non surfer, I guess) feel uncomfortable in here.

2. The pizza was WAY. TOO. THIN and floppy.

3. The pizza was WAY TOO GREASY.

4. The crust was too crispy.  It was hard.

5. For takeout, they stack the slices on top of each other without a box.  Who does that?
author: Vivian H.

description:
More than three years later, and I finally made a second trip back.  

I'm docking a star, because it wasn't as good as I remembered.  This time, we had a pesto pasta that was very average...as was the vegan pie.  

And casual restaurant or not, ordering a bottle of wine and not opening it table side makes me feel uneasy.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Last weekend a few of us headed over here for a political event - a casual meet and greet with a mayoral candidate.  They did a good job of providing a dedicated space for the event (the side/back room area), and I heard positive things from those who were drinking that night (I had to spare my liver, unfortunately).

As I'm about to review a pizza, please keep in mind that I grew up in New York and lived in Chicago for a decade - I know good pizza when it hits my mouth (and I'm not afraid to scream it from the rooftops and direct people to the places that make my metaphorical tail wag, like Patxi's).

We ordered the Rotten Robby, which really sounded good at the time, but I think we've been spoiled by Eagle's similar specialty.  This was one of those "almost" moments, where just a little more attention to detail could have made for a really decent pizza.

The problem, you ask?  Well, it was twofold.  The pizza's style was sort of a cross between New York hand-tossed and Chicago thin crust, but was a flawed execution of either.

If the slices had been broader (8 slices on the large instead of 16) and the edge of the crust thicker, this would have been a really good facsimile of a nice, folding New York slice.  If, instead, the pizza had a slightly thicker crust and toppings and cheese out to the edge, with a layer of cheese over the toppings, and had been cut into handy squares, it would have been a stable platform for eating, like a Chicago thin crust.

Sadly, what happened was a skinny, floppy wedge without a good handle to control it.  Add that to a really noisy environment (due to the really high ceilings and nothing to absorb noise, we had to yell to carry on a conversation), and I really have trouble giving this more than 2 stars.  Perhaps a future experience (with a taste of something else off the menu) will make me feel more confident of a 3 star rating, but for now, you get 2.5 (3 because yelp won't do half stars and the pizza tasted okay) and I'll stick to the places that have wowed us with their pizza instead.

SUMMARY:  Local hangout with decent, but messy and floppy pizza and an excessively loud environment.  Go for the local hangout factor, but don't expect to follow the conversation.
author: Jon M.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan! 

But we definitely traveled far for this place. 
I heard so much about their pizza, I had to come and try it for myself.  
We ordered the medium size Rotton Boy $17 with a pitcher of beer $16. The Autum Salad special $7. Pizza and Salad were delicious! Crust was thin and crispy, flavor was all there. Salad was a perfect starter to help prepare your palate for the pizza. 

It was PERFECT for the 2 of us. The bill came out to be $44, which isn't bad. 

For the area, I can see the attraction this pizza spot has. They are hopping with business. There's a great Patio area too if you have a nice big party on a really nice night like this weekend. 

Great spot for watching Sports too. 

I would go back, and when I do, I'll try their spaghetti and meatballs and order a pizza to go. 

Warning: Service is a little slow because it's busy here!! But they are friendly and it's worth the wait.
author: Judi K.

description: Really decent pizza and they sell it by the slice.  It is definitely cheezy greasy American style pizza and when you are in the mood for that kind it's great.  Good atmosphere.  I like to sit at the bar and have a beer as well.  Also - the calzone is pretty good.  located on Noriega not far from the beach.  Definitely a good lunch spot.
author: Dave T.

description:
Nice place.  Heard about it from a few friends who live in the Sunset and finally tried it.

Plenty of seating at the bar.  Think it's just beer and wine, but a pitcher sure does go good with the fare.
Ample table seating as well.

Yes, it's a pizzeria, but I'm going to start with the wings, because they were just really great.  Nice and crispy.  Reasonably hot, probably French's or Frank's Red Hot, but that's fine by me.  

Pizza dough is not too thick, not too thin, just right.  The crust is more chewy than crunchy:  again, the way I like it.

Oh, and you don't have to be ashamed to wear Boston sports team garb in there!
author: Ken B.

description:
So delicious! After the first offshore surf session of the season at Ocean Beach I headed here with some buddies.

We ordered a large pizza half --The Spicoli and half margherita with mushroom and arugla on both and split it between the four of us. YUM! Nice big fat slices and the spicoli--double the cheese double the meat--is SUPER GOOD.  You can also order beer here if you want.  We also got the sweet potato fries which is super good.

I ran up the street and grabbed an iced coffee at Sea Biscuit and it was super good! They grind the coffee right there, drip pour it and then have honey and half and half you can put it and to top it off, they gave me a free refill when I returned. 

I give this 'noriega experience' a 10.  

I went for another surf session, but everyone else was pizza'd out.  Haha I guess its that good.
author: Matt And Becki J.

description:
a pitcher of sierra, a delicious pie called dimitri, on the pacific rim with a very handsome husband and lovely emo surfer style music.

EPIC.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Awesome wait staff and great pizza by the slice.  Lots of room if you have a big party and TVs so you can watch the game.
author: Laurie L.
