description: 6 dollars for a Sierra Nevada IPA I felt violated will never give these rip off artists another cent fu I would put an 1/8 of a star if I could
author: Nick A.

description:
It was hard to get someone's attention when we walked in on a Saturday afternoon.  After waiting for a good 5 minutes, we finally just sat ourselves down.  Even so, it took effort to wave someone down to take our orders.  Our wait time for the food was probably about 25 minutes which was longer than expected as well..

I was disappointed when we first got our pizza slices.  I ordered the vegetarian pizza, but what I got resembled a slice of plain cheese pizza with some salad thrown on top.  The veggies (spinach, tomatoes, artichokes) were uncooked/un-baked.  That was weird.  However, I'm really impressed by their thin, crunchy crust.  It was so darn crispy and addictive.  

I noticed that their appetizers are pretty expensive ($13 for buffalo wings) so I think this place is more meant for large groups.
author: Connie P.

description: This is my favorite NY style pizza in SF. The ingedients are fresh and the crust is incredible.  You could tell the veggies were just cut that day and everything was made fresh when you called. Delicious
author: Petey F.

description:
What a random place to have a Pizza Shop way out in the Sunset boonies!  I only found out about this place when we randomly drove by it one day on our way to Irving.  The bright paintings all over the outer walls caught our attention and I made note to check this place out.

We order two pizzas to go to eat at home while watching game 5 of the Lakers - Orlando championship series.  We ordered 1 Mushroom and Sausage and 1 "Timmy's Pie" (Vegan pesto, roasted potatoes, roasted red bell peppers, mushrooms, mini tomatoes, and caramelized onions).  Before we were even able to eat I had kind of a sour impression of the place.  They were pretty rude to me on the phone, and when my GF went to pick the pizza up, she reiterated the same treatment.  She said the guy wouldn't even look at her, handed her the check without saying anything and then shoved the boxes at her.  Well that sucks!

Apart from the unfortunate service, the pizza tasted pretty good.  I always appreciate really thin crusts and The Pizza Place was no exception.  In fact, the crust was delightfully crisp and crunchy.  They don't skimp on ingredients either; they'll load your pie up for you.  Out of the two, I enjoyed the Sausage and Mushroom one a little better because it had tomato sauce.  The vegan Timmy's Pie was more for the GF, although it didn't taste too bad.  I suggest eating as much as you can the first night, because their pizza's aren't very good as leftovers.  After one day, the crust was already overly soggy (probably because of the ingredient abundance) and it was molding after 2 days (I even kept it in the refridgerator!)

I'll most likely check out The Pizza Place again but only because it is conveniently close to my house and a better option than dominos or pizza hut.   A couple of their other menu pizzas looked enticing.  However, if I'm not feeling lazy, I'll make the trip to Georgio's or Little Star instead.
author: Timothy C.

description:
I gave the Pizza Place another chance - this time for grinders and beer at lunch with my well behaved kids and a  friend.  We went after the lunch rush and the place was empty.  Unfortunately, the service was so rude that I will never return.   Even the owner was rude ( for the third time in two years).  I guess the attitude trickles down from the top.

Lunch: Meatball grinder with provolone.  It was pretty good.  Bun was crisped well, meatballs were tender.  Could have used more sauce.  The grinder came alone on a bare plate - no pickle, no garnish, no nuthin'.   Pitcher of PBR was cold.

Service:   We couldn't get the stroller friendly, convenient table that we wanted because it was "reserved".  No welcoming greetings.  Simple inquires were met with quick one word answers.   No "how is everything" or thank yous.  I was made to feel like I was imposing upon the staff.  We did not tip well and felt weird about it, so decided to say something to the owner so our message was understood.  He could have cared less and left us with a limp/flippant, "sorry".   Oh yeah, the reserved table was for that night - a good four+ hours away.  

We weren't looking for trouble, just good times.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I grew up on the east coast, I love it out here but most people have no idea of how to make good hot wings. These guys do!!! best wings in the city. Pizza is awsome , service is great.
author: Keyser S.

description: Kale Salad, Kale Salad, Kale Salad! Awesome. Totally relaxed lunch vibe.  While it is true that gondoliers could cruise on the oil on the pizza it was quite good, thin East Coasty crust.
author: K C.

description:
Went out with the roommates and wanted to try a new place. This was just what we were looking for. Nice environment with friendly and attentive staff. 

The pizza was really good, we had the Greek. The wings were good, and they offer baker dozens and half dozens so it felt like we were getting a little extra. 

Would definitely go back. Nice place to take some friends and have a good time.
author: Brett S.

description: Attitude when their food is not up to par is disappointing.
author: Roberta B.

description:
This place has some pretty amazing pizza.  I came here one afternoon hunting for some good slice of pizza.  I got two slices of pep to go thinking that they were going to be some small slices.  They were HUGE!  The pizza was tasty with thin crust and good pepperonis.  The only thing that i did not like was the amount of grease on the pizza.  Other than that, it was perfect.  Next time, i need to only get one slice and i should be good.

The service was quick and i ve seen the 20" pizza.  That is a huge wow on the size alone.  You can feed a village with that pie.
author: Curtis C.

description:
i-i-i... am soooo in lu-uv with your perfect slice of regular to go. cheese to sauce to crust. 

I'm so happy. in fact after a decade in NYC, I can honestly say you are as good and much much better oftentimes. 

maybe you make your slices differently because the crust that I was bummed about before hasn't failed me the last dozen times. 

thank yooooou.
author: Nik D.

description:
Love this place.  The interior is very laid-back and casual.  The employees care about what they are doing.  Several very tasty beer choices.  Pizza is thin crust and top notch.  Sure... it is a tad bit soggy in the middle of a large pie 10 minutes after it comes out of the oven.  Such is the nature of a tasty and delicate food like thin crust pizza.  

PS:  The large pizza is HUGE!  Even if I stuff my face (and I'm 6'4", 300+ lbs), my wife and I can only finish half of a large pie.  It easily serves 4.

We had the chance to sample the regular fries and garlic bread (both simple and very well done).  I also saw some sort of white bean w/ Pesto appetizer that looked tasty and some sweet potato fries (huge wedges that were fried until they were crispy and blistered... gorgeous).

EDIT:  Oh yeah... if it is busy and you see folks waiting for a seat, there is a sign-in list behind the door as you walk in.  Just sign your name and hang out until they call you.  Perhaps grab a pint of the good German pilsner they have on tap (can't remember the name, but it was delicious)
author: Aaron G.

description:
After hearing so much about this place, I finally got out there last week.  Passing by, you would never think that it's a pizza joint.  Inside you will see surfer dudes and dudettes, families, and servers that look like they can tell you when to use a long or short board.  I liked the decor of the place, as it can only fit for a place by the beach.  But it was so loud that I couldn't hear much of what my friend was saying, even when I had to turn my good ear trying to hear what she had to say.  For those that don't know, I blew my right ear out at a shooting range years ago.

I must confess that I am not a big fan of sweet potato, as a potato to me, shouldn't be "sweet", but salty.  But these sweet potato fries are the best I've ever had!  Served with buffalo sauce, ranch maybe, and carrot and onion sticks.  I thought I was going to get all the celery, since my friend doesn't care for that vegetable.  But there she was, chomping on the green stick comprised mostly of water.  I much preferred the buffalo sauce, as that's how I roll.

I know that Iceberg Lettuce is an abomination, but it was a HOT day, even at the coast, and it just seemed like the thing to do.  I am sure the lettuce was packaged, as it had all the necessary stuff ... shredded carrots and sliced radish.  The blue cheese dressing and walnuts made the salad come together.  Suck up your hatred and order it.

We had the Besto Pizza which had Pesto, Feta and Potato slices.  Maybe it had garlic, but I couldn't taste it.  It was very good, but VERY greasy.  I'm not sure where it came from, but I assume it was the pesto.  In looking around, I didn't see that much oil on other pizzas, like cheese, or other combinations.  I'd like to go back and try others.  The Spicoli "with double cheese and sausage" sounds too good to pass up.

Seeing some children brought back memories.  Several of them were very blond, as I was when I was very young.  Many people passing by were just coming from the beach, or heading out to hit the last waves for the day.

For once, we didn't have to satisfy our craving by hitting Little Star, even though it's all the way across town.
author: Michael M.

description: Pretty good pizza. We ordered a Medium pizza with mushrooms, sausage, pepperoni. It takes about 25-30 mins for it to come out so be patient or show up knowing that's the deal when you order pizza. The taste and ingredients aren't an issue, it's tasty stuff and ingredients are fresh. The issue is that on our pizza they put all the toppings right in the middle and barely distributed it to the outer portions of the pie before the crust. I realize it's not going to be completely covered but come on it was pretty much half a cheese pizza. They probably skimped us on toppings and tried to play it off but I see through your smoke and mirrors. The crust was thin, as in paper thin to the point where the toppins which were grouped in the middle of the pie which equals more at the tips of the slices made it impossible to eat with your hands. The crust is a handy holder but you couldn't even fold it in half it was so flimsy. So I had to take a fork and knife to it, this isn't deep dish guys let's get it together. So maybe it's different for the most part but we felt skimped on toppings and maybe even dough for the pizza crust. Anyway they are open pretty late and parkings was fine to find around 9pm on a Sunday. It's pizza and you can't really mess it up but I just wish things were a tad different so right now 3.7 stars.
author: Jeromy G.

description: Hard to compare... kind of surfer-divey, but totally a family friendly secret neighborhood gem. Good to chill at/around the bar during Giants games... win or whatever the other team does against us, good vibes on tap! GET IN AND OUT, so I got a seat!
author: Patrick W.

description:
Oh you know, that pizza place on Noriega...

Yup, this is the one. I'd have to say this has been by far, one of my favorite pizzas! Sure, everyone is saying it's a little greasy but what pizza isn't... I love their fresh toppings and their unique flavors.

And here, marks the exact place where I love my "Ranch on Pizza" virginity. They make HOMEMADE RANCH so it is nothing close to that thick processed tasting ranch. I don't even know if I'd call it ranch but its zesty and you can see the REAL pieces in it and every single slice I have must marry the two. Meant to be.

Easy parking and people are friendly. Service is usually really chill but really nice!

If you love your pizza meat, get the Meathead.
If your vegan ,get Timmy's Pie! Its reallyyy good!
I always fall for the ROTTEN ROBBY -has pesto and jalapenos... MM!
author: Tiffany N.

description: The BF and I stumbled upon this place while we were headed to The Devil's Teeth Baking Company across the street.  We checked Yelp and discovered that it actually had good reviews so we couldn't pass up the chance to try a slice of the Dimitry.  The thin crusted slice was surprisingly very flavorful.  I particularly liked the thicker slices of mushrooms and the tons of garlic.  Parking can be a bit challenging in this area, but you can cruise up and down the neighboring streets and find a space nearby.  I would definitely go back.
author: Christine D.

description:
Decent pizza.  I loved the vegetarian grinder though.  It was great to have that option!

Fairly busy in the evenings with great beers on tap.
author: Cara M.

description:
For the sunset, this pizza place has made it big. When you think of pizza, you probably think of some excellent chain or one small restuarant that has pizza downtown or in the mission. But in the sunset? YES. The pizza is actually really good and the pizza slices are bigger than others. They also have wonderful, fresh salads, other appetizers and of course some of their excellent main dishes of pizza. It's family friendly, open daily, and the workers are really nice. 

I go here all the time, and i like how no one i know, knows of this place yet.
author: Cody A.

description: These tatted up, edgy, surf freaks serve up some sophisticated, well thought, tasty food in a stripped down simple, honest environment.  Housemade meatball grinder.  You've got to be kidding me.  I drive across town for that thing.  Everything they do is the real deal.  Or they wont do it.  Including heckling the vagrants coming in to use the bathroom.
author: Keith T.

description:
I've eaten here twice.

1. Food is really good. There are lots of pizza choices but not so much were its overwhelming. They have local choices that are new and exciting yet common enough not to think its weird.

2. Service is also good. People greet you with a smile and seem to want you to come in and enjoy yourself.

3. Not dirt cheap but reasonable.

4. Atmosphere. Its young, friendly,  and great to go catch a game. 

Its a local spot and worth going too.
author: Raul V.

description:
Having read a few reviews, I knew they served slices.  Upon entering here is my experience:

1- Opened the front door expecting a take out counter but all I found was a bar and a whole bunch of tables.  

2- A couple wait staff pass me by without a "hello" or "can we help you?"

3- While looking at the menu on the wall, a wait staff guy acknowledges me.  I ask if I can see a menu.  He proceeds to grab a menu and remove the paper print outs from the plastic holders.  Once free of the plastic, he hands me the 2 sheets of paper (I still have no clue why he didn't just hand me the entire menu?)  

4- After he hands me the menu, he walks past me and bumps his shoulder against mine (I have no idea why since there was a lot of room to walk "around" me)

5- Confused by the treatment thus far, I sit down at the bar and I'm ready to order.  However, each of the wait staff guys in front of me seems to see right through me as they busy themselves with other duties.  One guy was leaning on the wall and when I looked in his direction he walked off.  wtf?

6- The guy who disassembled the menu / bumped into me walks past me.  I ask him if i can order?  He says, "yea, alright."  I order one slice of mushroom pizza and then he proceeds to pat me on the back - his way of apologizing for bumping into me earlier??

7- Ten minutes later (!) my slice of pizza is delivered to the guy sitting next to me.  The guy asks if that was my order?  I say yes and he hands the slice to me.  Note: by this point, no one has given me silverware, a napkin, or asked if i wanted anything to drink.  Granted I don't need silverware to eat a slice but a napkin would have been nice.

8- I grab a napkin at the end of the bar, eat the pizza noticing that it's pretty greasy and enjoy the best part of the pizza (the crust).

9- I get the check, pay my bill and walk out.  As expected, no one says thank you, etc.

10- I hope your experience is better than mine
author: Russ N.

description:
Just opened (Monday, June 14, 2007), The Pizza Place on Noriega serves thin crust Neapolitan style pizza, harkening from it's owner's childhoods in Boston. Previously chefing at the Blue Plate and Fish in Sausalito, Kevin & Dave (owners) definitely know what they're thowing around. I'm definitely biased since they're friends, but I also tossed pie in Seattle for a year at Pagliacci's (nice pie chain); so definitely know wtf is up w/ a good slice.

Add the best ingredients available with a strong prediliction towards local organic ingredients, some very special beers (organic Weinhardts, Anchor Steam, Trumer Pilsner, PBR) on tap, a fierce local following, and you can't go wrong.
author: Jafon H.

description: This place is overrated by far. I've lived in the area do two years and I've yet to have a good experience at this place. Came in one night after picking up a buddy from the airport. Naturally he was starving so I gave the pizza place a shot. Pizza almost took an hr to get to our table. And we just asked to pack it up. The taste is good yea but the speediness of the service needs work
author: Mark C.

description: Pizza's good, and it reminds me of 2 Bros Pizza in NYC, however 2 Bros is better because they only charge $1 a slice. Pizza Place charges $3 which is kind of pricey.  Pizza Place definitely has the taste and feel of an east coast pizzeria: crust is thin and crunchy, good amount of sauce, and the cheese is stringy. I like how it's convenient for me, and when I have cravings now I know where to get a slice without going far. I wonder if they ship water from the east coast, because everyone knows that's why east coast pizza is so amazing.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Best pizza in the Sunset if not the Westside.  If you crave great thin crust pizza this is the place!  This is our go to pizza place in the area.
author: Phil T.

description:
First off, what are people talking about, no sign?  There's a big sign on the side of the building - strange.  Anyways... (okay, looking at the pics, I guess the sign is new - Yay!)

I feel like I've discovered a gem in my 'hood.  Unfortunately, it has been slow going for me in discovering quality eating establishments in the Sunset.  There are definitely some good ones (Koo, Park Chow, PPQ, etc...), but not many I would go to regularly (once a week or every other week) like there were when I lived in the Mission.  

I must say, I'm going to need to fight the urge to go to the Pizza Place on Noriega.  I mean, if I want to keep my somewhat girlish figure, that is.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars yet, is because I need to return at least once to see if it lives up to its mythical status I've given it after my first visit.  I have to be sure it wasn't just that I was *really* hung over and exactly what I needed was a Trumer and a couple of slices of the incredibly spicy Rotten Robby.  

I thought the service was fine, and mellow.  The clientele seemed way cool.  And the music (Rolling Stones) was what you'd expect for a surf hangout (took me back to my days on Huntington as a teenager).  I'm nostalgic, and the Pizza Place is just what I needed.
author: Cami B.

description:
I stopped at The Pizza Place on Noriega somewhat by accident. We were looking for a place to get a midday beer after getting sandblasted at the beach, and this place looked cute and kitschy. I totally did not expect them to have vegan options, so unfortunately I had eaten before I went - too bad! I wish I'd been able to try the food, but, you know, if Gabrielle P. likes it, I probably would have too.

I just loved it in there. Sunny and casual. It was pretty empty (we went in the middle of the day, after all) so we got to watch the staff (way more guys on than necessary) goof around. It just looked like the best place to work. A bunch of metal dudes making totally decent pizza and being completely goofy stoners. I felt very, very comfortable there. And a decent beer selection.
author: Malloreigh M.

description: Great pizza place that has a few really good beers on tap. Their pizza has a delicious thin crust with a little bit of crispiness to it. I ordered the Dmitri (sausage, pepperioni, garlic, and mushroom) and really enjoyed it. Some beers on tap that stood out to me were Magnolia's Baby Blue Bitter, Speakeasy Porter, and Boont Amber. You can't beat good pizza with good beer! The atmosphere is really relaxed, a good place to hang out with friends, and the staff is really friendly.
author: Jacob R.

description:
My boyfriend and I live near by, and we read the great reviews on yelp. We've been to the restaurant two times. The first time was good. The waitress was friendly and the pizza was good therefore we wanted to make this place our go to place for pizza cravings.

 Before our second trip we saw online that they have a back patio which we thought was great because we have a new puppy and we wanted to bring the dog along. Every restaurant and bar in the city that has a patio or outdoors is dog friendly therefore we did not think there would be an issue. When we arrived at the restaurant the lady behind the bar asked us if the dog was a service dog. We said no because our dog is a puppy and obviously not a service dog.  The woman was rude and then proceeded to scold us and tell us how dogs are not allowed in the patio or restaurant. We were surprised as to how abrupt and rude she was but we understood her concern so we exited the door. What bothered me the most was that she proceed to complain and talk smack about us as we left. She told another customer that we could have lied and said it was a service dog. My boy friend was very upset and told her we did not want to lie when it was obvious that the dog was not a service dog. I am giving the restaurant a poor review because the brunette woman with glasses was rude and should be reprimanded for how she treats her customers. I will never go to this restaurant again.
author: Michelle L.

description: Terrific little spot in the outer Sunset.  I just love that you can get a slice of pizza with your favorite toppings, a nice glass of soda/beer, and salad in a friendly neighborhood pizza restaurant for under $10. They have some great vegetarian/vegan choices. I am really happy that they have housemade gluten-free pizza crust, gluten-free and nonalcoholic beer on the menu as well. Great place for friends and family to hang out, enjoy good food, and watch a game on the big screen.
author: Colleen B.

description: Food here is yummms! Probs one of my fave pizza places in SF. Started off with the Sweet Potato Steak Fries, served with housemade buffalo sauce and ranch dressing. We also ordered a large pizza -- half Dimitri and half Rotton Robby. Three of us shared the large, and we had 2 slices left over... the slices were HUGE!! Everything was great, service was friendly, and there is plenty of parking. Gotta love easy parking in the city.
author: Elaine N.

description: It's not just about the pizza, it's the experience.  As a polite patient customer, I receive polite patient service and the pizza is worth the wait.
author: Matthew J.

description: I think we found our pizza parlor! I love the fact that the wings are not frozen that is already cook and heat up. They fried it just the way we like it! My husband, kids & I love it!
author: Pineapple P.

description:
The pizza here is SO GOOD. That's the only reason I will make the trek out to 46th Ave. 

My favorite is the Dimitri, and I get the large regardless of hunger because the leftovers are JUST AS GOOD. Mmmmmmmmmm.

Service is what I like to call "functional." If you want a beer, you will eventually get a beer. It won't be quick, and it won't be delivered with a gigantic smile, but a beer it will be. The plus side of this is that if you like to be left alone, you will!

Its low-key, it's satisfying, and I wouldn't change a thing.
author: Alyssa G.

description: i've got to say... the dimitri is the BEST! i'm so glad there's a sit in pizza place right by my house which is actually really delish! the pizza is always on point whether you eat there or bring it home. love their consistancy.
author: Ann T.

description:
The pizza is mediocre and the service isn't any better. 

They recently lost their beer and wine license, but they encourage you to buy a 6 pack at the market across the street and bring it over to eat with your pie. So grab some beverages and pop on over.
author: jared c.

description:
Great pizza (its also huge!) and wings, the spaghetti is definitely tasty too. Its good food, a good setting, and pretty average prices. Also a good place to watch the game. 
No complaints about the service. They don't really stand out as having a super awesome waitstaff but I've never had any issues or anything.
If only they would deliver...
author: Christina M.

description: This is a great pizza spot if you're craving for non-chain pizza spots. Their pizza slices are big with a generous amount of toppings. Most of their pizza flavors are good. I like how their pizzas are thin so it doesn't feel like you're just eating bread. The prices are reasonable, but they are more expensive than your dominoes, pizza hut, round table, etc. places. It's worth a try !
author: Lucy C.

description:
More group related outings.

The pizzas are pretty tasty and the wings are great too.

Bumping this up a star, as I've reset my expectations.

I think that large parties kinda overwhelm the staff, but now that I know that, I'm perfectly happy ordering 2 pitchers at a time, instead of trying not to look like an alcoholic
author: Michael M.

description:
I bought a large pizza here recently. Didn't like it at all. The puddles of grease and very thin slices. 

I am not a lover of thin slices of pizza, why pay almost $30 for cardboard with a couple of toppings on it? My pizza had sausage, and for some reason tasted EXTREMELY salty. It didn't sit well in my stomach at all.

Never coming back.
author: Sophia G.

description: Decent pizza, good salads, delicious pork chili verde, but pretty unfriendly towards kids despite a clientele that's usually 50% young families. Weird that way. Also, they actually don't take reservations.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
3 stars for their pizza and 1 star for their service!   
Their pizzas are delicious and their service is excellent! I love coming here. Every time i get visitors from out of state i bring them here so when they return home they can brag about it!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
What I liked: The weird beach-bum gentleman my friend and I met before meeting another friend here for lunch.

What I didn't care for: Most everything about The Pizza Place.

The pizza was meh, and that's why we came in the first place. I live downtown, so if I'm going all the way out to the beach for pizza, it better be good pizza. Give me Escape from New York anyday.
author: Bethy H.

description: We chose this place due to its high rating and ordered for pick up, so don't know what the ambience is dining in.  The pizza itself was just okay - in particular the crust was not good at all.  I'm the type who likes to nibble on the end crust after eating the slice, and this crust tasted a bit like cardboard.  The pizzas are thin crust pizzas, the large size is quite large, and the pie is not cheap.  However, the spinach salad was pretty good.  Overall for the price, I was disappointed.  Note:  they do NOT deliver.
author: P C.

description: Best east coast pizza in SF. Also the buffalo wings are solid with the homemade blue cheese dressing.
author: Jared S.

description: The best pizza in Sunset! The service took a while, but the "Dimitri" was amazing. This and crispy doh, just like Italians do! Recommended!
author: Adam B.

description:
What can be said about this place that hasn't been said? I came here about a year ago to grab a beer while waiting for our reservation at Toyose across the street. I remembered the place had a cool neighborhood feeling and a great beer selection. I remember it being pretty packed and kept telling myself id go back. Fast forward a year, I finally went back. 

We got the vegan pizza and it was extremely good. Very thin, everything on it was perfect. Unfortunately, I ate 75% of it but that's ok. Also got a pitcher of organic ale to wash it down. There are SO many things on their menu im eager to try and I cant wait.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Greasiest pizza ever. They put a topping on that i asked (twice) not to be, adding to the already disgusting mess of grease. Too expensive for what you get, and the sauce is funky tasteing(typical SF).

The crust was actually pretty decent though, I will come back and try just a plain cheese and see how it goes.
author: Nelson S.

description:
My friend Jill was right! It is all about the buffalo wing sauce! Had to restrain myself from wanting to lick the plate clean.
Also enjoyed the Rotten Robby pizza with jalapenos! It was so spicy and yet so good! It gets spicier with every slice that you're hesitant to have another and yet you want to feel the burn, it's so delicious!
author: Tashina G.

description:
I feel like a place like this needs to be cloned and spread more throughout the outer Sunset. 
Decent pizza and beer selections. Even better salads. The grinders during lunch are tasty. Nice staff. 
The real treat to this place is the ambiance. Lots of space, good vibe. If they had more TVs in the dining area, I would be tempted to hang out here for every single broadcasted sports event.
author: Laurie R.

description:
This is my favorite pizza place in Sunset! Great pizza, fantastic wings and amazing salads!

Draft beer and friendly staff makes you want to hang out, but ordering a pizza for pick up may be better if you have kids.
author: Dave W.

description:
The most unexpected place to find a great pizza was for me the outer Sunset but there it was, walked in just by chance and was surprised first of all by the great attitude of all the staff, so attentive, surfer Dudd's type of guys but totally on the ball, what a combination!
I'll go back before long, 
alex d
author: Alex D.

description: My favorite pizza place in SF, and possibly the west coast. The Sunset Aloha is amaaaaaazingly tasty! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and fresh unique pies...what's not to love?
author: Joe S.

description: Pizza is good but the service BLOWS!!!!  Called in for pizza and they said 30min... I get here after 30min and they just put the pizza in the oven!! Terrible! !!
author: nabil s.

description: Get their Italian sandwich!! Only avail during lunch hours and its a Must have!! So taaasty. A lot of meat. Right amount of lettuce & onions & cherry tomatoes. Mmmm. Im still salivating after eating it. And for the pizza, the only two I like is the Dimitri & Greek. Service was good. More people sitting at the bar than at the table. Two small tv for sports. I like this place also because they're a fan of Boston Celtics!! Yeaah!
author: Amy H.

description: I love this place! It's a great place to watch a game, chill out with friends or family, or take a date to. I really like their wings and the Rotten Robbie pizza is delicious.
author: Grace C.

description:
Dude.  Hang loose.  Enjoy.

Waiters all look like surfer dudes and dudettes.  Very laid back but service is crisp.  Nice combo. Friendly.

Pizza is good but can be greasy. Spicy means spicy.  So ask if you are concerned.  Full flavored.

Items are fresh and tasty.  Salads are good.  really.

Pizza slices are really big.  Ask for it to be double-cut if you have kids or want normal slices.

Beers on tap are good.

TV's to watch.
author: Clifford S.

description:
Came here tonight for dinner. We sat at the bar and just ordered a few slices of pizza. Scott: one mushroom and one cheese, me: pesto with potatoes and garlic. Scott's was good. Mine was FABULOUS. The pesto was PERFECT. Fresh, green, and just the right combination of basil and whatever else they put in it to make it so delicious.

Not only was our meal great, the bartender who took our order/served us was genuinely happy. He seemed like he really loved his job, WANTED to be there, and he made us feel as comfortable as someone who goes in twice a day.

NOTE: I got a side of balsamic vinaigrette and Scott got a side of ranch. Both sauces were amazing and we were told after they make all their sauces fresh every morning! The icing on the cake!
author: Carrie W.

description: Good thin crust pizza Great Cesar salad! I prefer black olives on my pizza not green or any other type ; )
author: LJ E.

description: My wife and I stumbled onto this place after taking the kids to the San Francisco Zoo.  Great pizza and even better sandwiches.  Ordered the Hungry Angry sandwich, Meatball sandwich, and a slice of cheese pizza.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  Best food for the money the entire time we were in San Francisco!
author: Vince R.

description: This is a great goto place in the outer sunset; great pizza and a good selection of beers as well.
author: Billy C.

description: Worst. Service. Ever. When the sign says, "please wait to be seated" and you do, no one greets you, and they let parties who came in *after* you arrived seat themselves, how would you feel? COMPLETELY F'ING UNWELCOME, RIGHT? Never going back and to anyone who ever asks, I will tell them to stay away. If you like the place, great. If you looking to try a new place, like we were, go anywhere else.
author: Aaron M.

description: I tried this place with a friend cause it's so close to my apartment and a few of our sf native friends have said it's good. We ordered the Dimitri. While it wasn't the best pizza I've had it wasn't terrible. I don't know if I would return because there are so many other pizza places in the city that make really good pizza.
author: Eric M.

description:
Wing sauce. The end. 

No, really. 

My budding flirtation with the Sunset would probably start with The Pizza Place. And the sauce. Something about it makes me want to lick my fingers clean every time! And then, yeah the pizza is kind of amazingly delicious. The staff is nice and always seem to be in good spirits. It's probably a good thing I don't live closer.
author: Jill T.

description: Have updated to 4 stars since I found the potato chip pizza.   I mean...  WOW.   A new parallel dimension to pizza exists and it can be accessed via a portal called 'The Pizza Place on Noriega Potato Chip Pizza'.   Even if it is middle of the road 'Za.   Worth a try.
author: Johnny C.

description:
I love this place.  I wish I was still living in San Francisco to enjoy it. I'd walk to three blocks to have a slice and a few beers close to once a week when I did.

Anywho, the pizza is delicious. Though I only ever ordered the Spicoli, pepperoni or margherita, it was always wolfed down. Though it tended to be too oily, it always come out piping hot. The only problem I ever saw, but never had, was that other items on the pizza menu came with TOO MUCH of the toppings requested - which is better than too little. 

When it gets busy the service can be a little suspect, but that just reflects the relaxed nature of the staff and the environment of the place in general, which I love. The people that run the place are surfers; the restaurant is subsequently run at the general pace of the stereotypical surfer's. The ingredients for the salads and sandwiches seemed to be top notch to me as well; they seemed like they would be the expensive ones I would always avoid at a Whole Foods. Man, I miss those thin crusts!
author: Kevin W.

description:
Wow! I really Love The Pizza Place On Noriega! The Dimitri is amazing. It has roughly the same ingredients as Gaspare's Bruce's Special and is a very close second. Mushrooms, salami, pepperoni, sausage and garlic with a red sauce. (They do not mince the salami, no surprise, and they don't "drain the pizza." -Which is curious because the gluten in the crust is perfectly developed and they have wonderful toppings. The result resembles a New York thin crust that is a tiny bit soggy in the middle and begs for a knife and fork to be necessary if you are not a pie-folder. The pie is really particularly delicious and really a four and a half -would be a five if they drained it Pizza-Pie. Last night we got some fries while we waited and when I asked for a side of ranch they gave me a really impressive house-buttermilk dressing that tasted like it had mild peppers and parsley added to it, was very fresh and inspired. After ordering Fries we ordered a Spiccoli (Double cheese and sausage.) The Sausage was okay but really didn't stand up to the extra cheese and we wished that we had ordered the Dimitri a second time. It was still a four star Pizza, but nowhere close to five. Last time we came in we had a couple of meatballs while we waited. Why did I have to order this off menu? They were delicious and inexpensive. They are killing me with the Italian Grinders. I want one. Plan to try one soon. I don't know if they serve them for dinner but they look like traditional East Coast Italian and great! Four and a half stars for excellent service, good to great food and ample parking most nights in adjacent street parking.
I would like to see spumoni, zabaglione, cannoli and rum cake or tiramisu added to the menu? But this Pizza is already more authentic than most neighborhood pizza restaurants.
author: Kimberley M.

description:
Wings: Good
Sweet Potato Fries: Really Good
Bleu Cheese Sauce: Meh
Meatballs: At $2 each for a 2inch diameter meatball, incredibly over priced, though decent tasting
Pizza: Awful. Stale, and cardboard tasting

And the service was not very good.

Def not going back again.
author: Saikat P.

description: The service was horrible. The pizza was soggy and greasy in the middle and falling apart.
author: Dan L.

description:
Good to know that this homey pizza joint is walking distance from me.  Nothing fancy about the place, but it gives that laid back, no pressure kinda environment.  

We came later on a Saturday night and the front bar area was packed with enthusiast guys who looked like regulars.  What I like about this place is that it seems so versatile- there were a few tables with families as well. We were able to order pizza by the slice and still able to grab a seat.  Variety of options to choose from or you can create your own pizza.  The slices were a good portion and came in a thin crust. 

Will definitely be back.
author: Lisa C.

description:
2.5 stars. 

Sure, the pizza was pretty good for San Francisco (and it's one of the few big restaurants in the area) but the service was ridiculous.

We had a short wait on line by the bar, so we had a drink - no big deal. Then we were seated and our order promptly taken...and then we waited. For an HOUR.

AN HOUR.

When we inquired about the status of our pizza we were told it would be out in a minute or two. Our waiter attempted to placate us by bringing out plates. And then it was still an AGE before the pizza came. 

Ugh.
author: Jessica A.

description: Fantastic pizza!!! Nice chill spot by the beach to grab a cold beer and a slice...or a grinder, or a salad, or some kick ass wings., or...
author: Jeramiah W.

description:
I had a good pie from this place. I think I expected it to be a decent neighborhood pizza joint, and I wasn't disappointed.

I'm curious to try their other items in the future.
author: Mark H.

description: I'm torn between giving this place 3 or 4 stars. The flavors and toppings are amazing! But I'm not the biggest fan of such thin crust. I like having a nice piece of soft, bready crust at the end of my delicious slice. The crust here is crunchy and sometimes too hard for me to eat. Also, the pizza can be too greasy for me. I do enjoy the unique toppings. My favorite pizzas here are the Rotten Robby (love the jalapeños!!!) and Besto. The sweet potato fries are great as well. I like the openness of the restaurant and the location is convenient for me. Parking is not too bad either.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Ah pizza....so many great pizza spots, so little time. 
Well make time for this pie shop, cause you won't be disappointed. 

Great prices on the food & bar drinks, great spot to bring the little ones, and tasty treats! 

As we were waiting for the Spicolli named pizza pie we ordered, drinking a cold beverage... a kid in a wetsuit with board in hand came walking up the sidewalk and around the corner he went. No big deal.....minutes later the wet haired dude brought us our pizza! Classic. 

Yay! I'm a fan!
author: Kris K.

description: Love pizza by the slice here. One slice is so huge and filling. Great service with a friendly staff. Great place to watch a game. Prefer pizza by the slice to whole pies, somehow the crust seems a bit thinner on the whole pies. Root beer floats are excellent too.
author: Ce Ce M.

description:
Seems much of the negative reviewing is due to "attitude" problems with the wait staff. Well this fat old man never found that to be an issue. Sure, at times, the service is not super prompt, but then when was the last time you were at flour + water?

The pizza itself is as good as it gets. Everyone has different ideas of what a good pizza is. Okay, I was born and raised in Rhode Island, grew up with pizza from Federal Hill, my favorite was Iavazzo's where they fired baked the pizza and there were murals of the Bay on Naples.

Now, Pizza on Noriega ain't that, but it is great pizza anyway. Why? Because the crust is thin and tasty. The sauce is just right and when there is garlic is not overdone. The toppings are generous without being overwhelming.  I have been there maybe 15-20 times and picked up maybe about 5-10. Never had a bad pizza.

Each time I bring someone new there, they fall in love with the pizza.

Needless to say, when I read the bad reviews--crust overcooked, toppings falling off, etc, etc, I wonder if we are talking about the same place. I have to assume that the negative writiers don't have a vested interest in another pizza joint. But I have read some of those reviewers' reviews of other places and I can see why we disagree. We just don't like the same style of pizza.

I was not raised on a chain pizza pizza nor did my mom ever have frozen pizza at home. I expect pizza to be freshly made and with a bit of character, not some consistent production line thing. I never heard my parents complain about the waiters being unfriendly, because I don't think that they ever expected them to be friendly. Let's face it, this is a pizza joint. Sorry folks, one goes there for the pizza.

Oh yeah, I have been places where being ignored is frustrating. Gosh, how many times have I stood forlornly at a bar or counter while the world made several revolutions and no one noticed me. Well, sometimes that is the way it is.  But I also realize that ya gotta speak up for yourself also. See back home, either you are related to someone or you got a big mouth. The meek little mousies just get ignored. Hard for the laid back westerners (or even midwesterners)  to understand at times. 

But, like I said, it's all about the pizza.
author: julian l.

description:
The Pizza Place on Noriega is my local pizza place. When we don't feel like cooking or want to walk out for a bite this is where we head. The staff is friendly the food is fresh and takeout super easy.

Two things you should know. the pizza's are big and each one is made fresh so they take about 30 minutes to bake. 

The pizza has a nice balance of cheese and sauce. The center of the pie  can be a bit soggy and the outer crust gets a little crisp. Snaps like a cracker instead of tears like bread. I'm not sure if it's because of the amount of water in the dough, but it is a dry crust. My roommates and I always split a pie and they like triple toppings. The pizzas always come with a generous amount.

The atmosphere is very laid back. A mix of surfers, families and neighborhood families. 

I do love this pizza the next day. i reheat it it in a warm covered skillet for 5 minutes and it really taste great. 

It is not my all time favorite slice of pizza, but it's the best in the Sunset district.
author: joe f.

description:
I live two blocks away from The Pizza Place and finally tried it today! The place was not too crowded because it was early (5pm), so we didn't experience the slow service that others talked about in their reviews. Keep in mind that their pizza does take at least 25-30 mins to bake so you will have to wait a little bit for your food. 

My friend and I shared a Margherita pizza and it was delicious! The crust was perfectly crispy and the slices were perfectly sliced. I will definitely be back to try their other pizzas!
author: Jessica S.

description: Excellent salad with fresh spinach greens and warmed dressing. We had the Dmitri, which was very good, and we're from back East so we know good thin crust pizza. Very busy on a Friday night with lots of families (a good sign), but the signup sheet at the front and friendly, if a little stretched, staff was prompt and courteous. Recommend the Racer 5 IPAD if you're a beer drinker,
author: Paul M.

description:
Thank you Dave & Kevin!

The Outer Sunset (esp. Noriega) needed your place; badly! 
The pies are the best in the city, the vibe is killer & the hood would not be the same without you.
The food:
Literally; the best, hands-down, east coast pie in the city. Fold the slice in half & let the grease drip down your forearm; that's what pizza is supposed to be like! The grinders also rock! Rolls are imported from Philly and the selection of fillings are endless; kudos for the fried veggie "chicken" pattie sub.
Many props to vegetarians can be found here. Vegan pizza, sweet potato fries in buffalo sauce, grilled caulflower salad plus many more. Each one better than the other. 
The vibe: Its 2 blocks from the beach, need I say more? Don't expect ass-kissin customer service cause you won't get it; but then again, you probably done deserve it anyway. This place is run by and meant for the Ocean Beach neighbors, not a fan of the neighborhood? Maybe North Beach Pizza is more your style. We love it & will continue to support it.

BTW, the back deck is now open (as 7X7 magazine calls it, Zeitgiest West) and the sun is shining! Rawk on guys (and Cindy too!)!
author: David W.

description: The pizzas here are huge!! So far I've only tried Spicoli, Rotten Robby, Meathead and Dimitri. I think Rotten Robby and Spicoli are pretty good but everything else is on the salty side, pretty oily too. The best item are the sweet potato fries!!!!!!!! They are slightly season and roasted I believe.. It comes w/ 2 interesting sauces and a few carrot & celery sticks.
author: Allyson L.

description:
Great neighborhood hangout. I live two blocks away from this place but since I'm at work most of the time I don't get to come here for dinner. 

Stopped by for dinner here a couple times and here are the results:

Pizza: a little on the oily side but thin crusted, filled with toppings and yummy all over

Salad: definitely get the wilted baby spinach with cranberries, cheese, and bacon bits! yum! very delicious!

Sodas: free refills and they have this sixth sense about when you're about to be out of soda and fill it before you're done!

The service was good when we got to sit down.  A bit crazy when we just walk in but give them a heads up that you want to be seated and be patient. Everyone is pretty chill here. You can also watch a baseball game with a huge big screen on the wall. Just plain awesomeness.

Short walk from the beach and nice place to pick up pizza from or dine in.
author: Wanster L.

description:
THIS PLACE NEEDS TO DELIVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

When they do I will add the 5th star, cause the Pizza is off the chain!  Best vegitarian pizza in town, bar none.  

PLEASE DELIVER!!!!
author: Sims K.

description:
I find it honorable that the pizza place on Noriega did not paint over the semi strange mural that once graced Dean's deli.  I do enjoy the mystical pizzas and flying beer mugs surrounding said mural to make it somewhat pizza-relevant.

Their pizza is delicious.  Let's start with appetizers: sweet potato steak fries = yum.  Nice and big with two yummy sauces, one spicy, one cheesy.  The roasted cauliflower was also tasty - way to make cauliflower not boring.  Said my friend "i never buy cauliflower because it seems boring but now I know what to do with it".  Also, olives were yummy and flavorful.  I had a cherry italian soda, which was refreshingly sweet and bubbly.  We ordered the besto pesto which was slightly greasy (in a good way) and oh so cheesy.  We also had the greek which was flavorful and packed a punch.  

If you like thin crust this is the place for you.  The place could use a little more art on their walls - plenty of room for some local artists or a mural.  But either way, I'll be back - their pizza is scrumptious and the service is good.
author: Ashley S.

description:
We renamed this place "The Eye Candy Store". 

Holy  shit, the boys in here are HOT. And the pizza is still great. And I think the service is wonderful. 

Also, I got to teach my friends' little kid a new word - objectify. "I'm sorry, sweetie, I didn't hear you. I was busy objectifying the boys in this place. Go ahead."
author: Suge K.

description: Almost a year later I came back for the same pizza combo, Large half Dimitri and half Besto.  Although the service was great and I still like the laid back feel that oozes from a place run by local surfers, I have to say the pizza was probably the greasiest its ever been.  Looking at the other reviewers I'm noticing this is a trend and I'm surprised they haven't tweaked the recipe a little to remedy this problem.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
3.5 stars
 
The beers on tap are great, the pizzas are huge and amazing with creative options.  And we can't get enough of the wilted spinach salad.

BUT
Service is inconsistent, but usually inattentive.  And also intolerably slow (from order placed to table-top, pizza can take 45min some nights).  The pace fits the Outer Sunset and we're getting used to it.  We can walk there and love the food.  So we'll keep coming back, planning for a laid-back dinner.  And secretly hoping they'll step it up a bit...
author: Laura K.

description: The best way to experience pizza is not by the slice but getting a whole pie. Its a new place with old school flavor. It reminds me of the grapes on the ceiling place from my youth called O'Sole Mio. They treat you like family with the same love and respect for their food. Its the best in the city.
author: John C.

description:
Love this place. One of my favorite places to grab some food. Pizzas, Buffalo Wings, Sandwiches, Beer...they do it right. 

Pizza: 3.5-4 STARS
Depending on what you order on your pizza, will determine if it is a 3 STAR pizza or 4 STAR pizza. Try to avoid putting a lot of meat on your pizza, because when it comes out it will be oily and cause the crust to be soggy. Keep it balanced. 

Buffalo Wings: 4 STARS
Only 2nd to Double Decker. These have a good vinegar and franks red hot sauce taste to them. They are hot and ready to dip in their blue cheese/ranch dressing. 

Sandwiches: 5 STARS for their Meatball sandwich. Just thinking about this sandwich makes me want to go down and grab one. The first time I ate one I left wanting more. From then on I ALWAYS ordered 2 of them...yes they are that good. The bread is chewy and soft, cheese all melty and gooey, and their meatballs blow your mind. 

Beer: Great beers to go with your pizza/buffalo wings/sandwiches. 

***Pizza review based on: Pizzeria, Pizzeria Delfina, Gaspares, Giorgio's, Victor's Pizza, Tomasso
author: Nick C.

description:
WILTED BABY SPINACH
mushrooms, red onion, dries cranberries, feta, bacon, roasted almonds, in a balsalmic vinaigrette
Oh my
i only read the description because i was curious about the use of the adjective "wilted" to sell food
EFFING amazing and pretty big (thats what she said)
totally unexpected (sometimes she says that too)
it's a warm delicious salad. i get it as my meal every time i go there
and they have pitchers of beer
yay!!
author: kiki b.

description:
On my way to take my dog to the beach, I stopped in to ask if they sell pizza by the slice.  

Very friendly man at the counter offered me a few by-the slice options.  I told him I was vegetarian, and he told me about a vegan pizza that does not come by the slice, but that I may want to try it in the future.  Nice that he took the time to mention it.  I *will* try it another day.

I ordered a plain cheese slice to go, it did not take long, (I went to wash my hands, and it was almost ready when I got back from the clean bathroom)

It was a nice sized slice, thin and New York style (my favorite!).  Another friendly man asked if I was going to eat it there, or take it to go.  He gave a nice big smile when I told him I was going to take it to the car to share with my dog.

It was inexpensive, and tasty, not many places make decent thin style pizza.  I was impressed.

cheap, friendly, fast, and good flavor.  I'll be back.
author: sophia I.

description:
Tasty thin crust pizza to go! And HUGE circumference!

Ordered a large "Dimitri" pizza (saussage, pepperonni, garlic, mushroom, tomatoes sauce, cheese) to go. The thing and box was HUGE, barely fit in the car. Had some delays getting home, so the pizza was getting a big soggy--the box almost caved and had to be held w/my hand supporting the middle of the box.   Stuck some slices in the oven at 350 for a few minutes and boom, delicious pizza.  Might have been a little on the salty side, but not overly so.
author: Caroline I.

description: Great neighborhood pizza place.  Amazing pizza from a brick oven and good draft beer list.  Good for kids, although not overridden with kids (just the right balance of kids to adult humans).  The Besto pizza was one of the best I've had (thinly sliced potato, mozzerella, feta, pesto).  Apps and salads are also excellent.  They have a casual outdoor patio area which we'll check out some nice weekend afternoon.
author: Neal N.

description:
friends and i have ordered the rotten robby, margherita, the dimitri, and veggie pizzas to-go on several occasions. love the enormous slices. the pizza has never yet disappointed us; they're consistently delicious, the crust is always solid, the toppings are plentiful without being too much, and the tastiness is very much present.

GET THE SWEET POTATO STEAK FRIES. good god, did i go out of my mind in food ecstasy. sharing was so hard. i had no qualms helping myself to the last, fat piece. got shame no gain, eh?

indeed, as it is emblazoned proudly on the outside of this establishment,

i \m/ the pizza place.
author: Eliza D.

description: Outer Sunset joint for thin crust pizza with the local vibe. We couldn't go home yet after the open house so grabbed a pizza here - great kid friendly place. The pizza here is just OK in my book, the crust is good right when it comes out of the oven, but after a few minutes, it isn't as crisp. The sauce doesn't have much flavor and it's a pretty greasy ordeal, if you like that kind of pizza :).
author: Cammy H.

description:
This joint is a Sunset hang ten HOTSPOT!  A real easygoing, casual laid-back beach vibe.  

We ordered a pizza called the "Rotten Robby." I know...don't let the name fool you. This pizza looked and tasted terrific. Not too spicy. Just yummy. The iceberg salad and hot wings were delicious too.

Yep, we'll be back.
author: S M.

description:
pizza place you are so dangerous. you sit right outside my window, and when i walk outside i get a heavenly whiff of cheese pizza. i couldn't take it anymore and went in last friday after work (or maybe i floated in). i just wanted a slice...a nice restraint on my part. slices are 2.50 for cheese and 50 cents for the first topping, with 25 cents after that. i ordered a slice with shredded basil and olives, and waited patiently at their bar.

it was pretty crowded around 6:30, but i got my slice to go in about five minutes. the pizza slice was freaking fantastic, and the size of my head. best suprise? REAL olives. i was expecting just regular black olives like other pizza places, but damn! real freaking olives, those used in antipasto platters at nice italian restaurants.

one grip? please get a better take out packaging for slices! the slice was just put on a paper plate, then in a brown bag so i had to carry it sideways. if i had to walk more than a couple feet i probably would've gotten a little annoyed.
author: Liz M.

description:
The Sunset Aloha is my fav. But ask for extra pineapple if you like pineapple.
Favorite thin crust pizza in town.
author: Christy F.

description: I had the MeatBall Grinder the other day and im still dreaming about it, thats how good it was. It rivals Herbs Deli back in the day when they made them on Thursdays.
author: Chris D.

description:
15 Jan 2010:
So after a couple of days, I received a call from Cindy at "The Pizza Place" and she apologized for the service problem, offering me a free medium pizza (what I ordered) next time I come in.  I'll give a better rating now. I do have to wonder, though--if I hadn't posted this experience, would I have received a call? Thanks for the coupon and am looking forward to our next pizza.

8 Jan 2010:
Don't get me wrong on the 2-star rating.  The pizzas are amazing and very original.  Unfortunately, the service has a lot to be desired.  Having dined in, you wait a long time to get someone to take your order.  

Tonight, though, I thought I'd just call in and pick up.  I called at 7:00 and was told it would be 45  minutes to an hour as they were swamped.  Fair enough--it's a Friday night. I go over there at 8:00 to give them the benefit of the doubt since she said they were swamped. When I ask for the pick up, I'm told it will be another 30-40 minutes.  Really?  Almost 2 hours to make a medium pizza?  The guy did at least offer to buy me a drink, but since I don't drink and didn't want to leave my husband at home waiting that long, I just canceled the order. They had my phone number. Interesting that they didn't try to call and apologize or offer a coupon or something for the hassle.
Too bad.  I really like their pizza...but probably won't go back again.
author: Corey H.

description:
The Pizza Place is good if you want thin crust pizza, however that night I was craving a deep dish, cheesy, greasy pizza, so it didn't satisfy the craving, but don't get me wrong it's still good.  

This is definitely a neighborhood joint.  They serve beer and wine and boast creative pizzas on their menu with a vegan pizza too.  

Oh man their margarita pizza is good though!  For some odd reason though it doesn't come with tomatoes so we added them on and it was perfect!
author: Elaine K.

description:
The sweet potato steak fries were delicious, not sure if they're worth the $8 price tag though. Not a fan of their buffalo sauce, but their ranch sauce was amazing, I never thought ranch could taste "fresh". 

I ordered half a Greek and half a Rotten Robby's. Its presentation was very pretty. The Greek was too salty, the olives overpowered the rest of the ingredients. And all I remember of the Rotten Robby's was that it was spicy due to the jalapenos, but at least not as briny. 

I love thin crusts but the bread ended up too moist from the sauce/toppings. I've made better pizzas. 

Good service, our curly haired waitress was very attentive. Good for groups too, I saw many couples and families and groups of friends here. Nice variety of beers.
author: Selina C.

description:
Great laid-back atmosphere which make the dining experience a joy.  A bit of surfer meets punk thing...

Pizza is utterly delicious and I like the crunchy crust.  I've only gotten their veggie, and slices with my own toppings but the boy always gets meat and likes it too.  Also, salads are perfect while you wait for the pizza, and they make sandwiches until 4:30pm -- try the Save a Chicken (I can't get over it!).

Eat at the bar, drinks your beers, chill out to tunes, watch the crowd, and chat with servers.  They're friendly and entertaining!
author: Vicky B.

description: This by far is my favorite pizza ever and I LOVE pizza! Every pie I have tried here has been awesome. Service is decent and atmosphere is very relaxed. It is a must try, just a suggestion. My sister came up with this speciality: pepperoni, pineapple, and jalapenos. Delicious!
author: Lia M.

description: Outer Sunset?  Great Pizza?  I never would have thought that I would find Pizza this good in this sleepy part of the city.  Convinced my friend who lives nearby to babysit me while I waited for my car to be repaired.  We shared an order of the Sweet Potato fries that turned out to be healthy for chrissake!!!  The sweet potato is sliced into large pieces and baked?  No oil on them...served with skin with 2 dipping sauces.  That did me in and we could barely finish the small Greek pizza.  Nice thin crust on the pizza.  Fun place to hang out.  It was early afternoon and the music was cranked up so loud we had to ask to have it turned down, otherwise we would not have been able to have a conversation...no problem, they turned it down immediately....oh hell I'm so freakin' old!!!  Maybe I just need to wear those dang earplugs...
author: Arlene C.

description:
Thank goodness!!!  Either I've lived in SF for too long now, or I've finally found a place that serves decent pizza!  Based on the good reviews The Pizza Place received, I decided to make the trek out to the Outer Sunset (I shouldn't complain, I live in the Inner Sunset) to pick up a pie for myself and my roommates.  They got thin crust right!  And right before I took a bite, the aroma almost reminded me of pizza back home in NY/NJ.  It was a little soggy/greasy, but if you don't want grease, don't eat pizza.  I got the Spicoli (extra cheese and sausage), and it was quite tasty; they didn't overload the pizza with toppings like every other place in SF does.

I wish they delivered, but then again, if they did I would probably end up eating way too much pizza.

Thank you Pizza Place, I think we're going to have a beautiful friendship.
author: Danielle B.

description:
I live a few blocks from this place and have been going there off and on since they first opened. I used to go there about twice a month during their first year in business.

I guess like any other restaurant, the food quality changes over time. While its still the go-to pizza place in the Outer Sunset...it is definitely not as good as it used to be. I usually get the Spicolli. While just as tasty as ever; the last 4-5 times I have been ordered it; it has been soggy in the middle. I used to be able to pick up a slice with little sag and fold it and devour. Try that now, and it flops down with most of the toppings running off.

Pizza Place: please make them like you used to!!
author: Michael W.

description:
Pizza was rather average. The crust was ok. But everything else was rather soggy and really.. average tasting. Sorry, I really wanted to like this place too since I live close by, but I would not give it anything more than 3 stars.

Also, if you don't like loud music bouncing off walls while you eat, don't go here. That was definitely uncomfortable.
author: buddie l.

description:
I love this place. Right by the beach, so you can eat your pizza, drink your beer, and take a walk along the sand. The pizza is fantastic, and their staff is really friendly and laid-back. This is my go-to pizza and beer place. If I ever left SF, I would miss it a lot!

Things to note: A Large pizza is GIGANTIC. I am a small girl and I could barely carry it. The guy told me a large feeds two people, but I'm pretty sure it could feed a whole family. I bought pizza for a small party and had way too much. At least I had leftovers. The veggie pizza is especially good when it's cold. :)
author: Rachel A.

description:
San Francisco's Pizza is about appealing to me as a bag of hair.
But This place gets it. Good pizza and the space you want to eat it in.
It's kind of like something out of Fast Times at Ridgemont High.
Jalepeno/pineapple is rullling.
author: Plague Eater X.

description: Came here as I was craving good pizza on a visit to SF. Chose this place cuz it was close and because of the good reviews. Arrived and stood around for about 7 minutes, no one even said "Hello, I'll be right with you" or "welcome" or anything. Was seated eventually and ordered a large cheese I believe. When it arrived I was slightly disappointed - for the money you can get a lot more elsewhere in terms of quality and quantity. It wasn't bad, certainly, but I will be taking my money and appetite elsewhere in the future.
author: Robert C.

description: Good neighborhood laid-back pizza joint that has a bar.  It was packed on a Sunday night -very mixed crowd, reflective of the neighborhood.  It'd be a lot better if the service were friendlier, we sat at the bar and our bartender/server was downright surly.  Pizza was just ok, not great but it's nice to have a location like this in the neighborhood that we can walk to.
author: Rose T.

description: The owners are like Pizza Nazis. Don't ask for them for anything that interferes with their poor choice of music. Black Sabbath for example. The food is average. Take you business elsewhere.
author: ernest b.

description:
Let's face it: the Sunset is hardly a magnet for cutting-edge restaurants. While there are definitely some great places, the area, in general, is pretty thin for excellent non-Asian eating options (and I say this as a longtime Asian resident of the Sunset).  

Having said that, The Pizza Place on Noriega is a bright spot in the Sunset dining scene, particularly the Outer Sunset, where pickings are particularly slim.  The pizza is delicious.  It's not fair to compare it to a place like Pizzeria Delfina, that's not the point of The Pizza Place on Noriega, but it's definitely worth seeking out on its own.  For what it's worth, I think Pizza Place on Noriega's pizza is way better than Farina in the Mission.

The crust is on the thin side: not cracker thin, but nor is it thick and pillow-y. The toppings and flavors are fresh, uncomplicated, and appealing. I love the Sliced Meatball, the Rotten Robbie, and my husband is all about the Veggie and the Timmy's Pie.  My daughters like the Cheese and the Sliced Meatball.

My only complaint is that the pastas are a bit weak.  I've only had the Spaghetti w/Meatballs & Red Sauce.  The pasta was cooked past "al dente" and I could tell the noodles hadn't drained sufficiently because the marinara sauce (which was on the bland side), was water-y.  The meatballs were excellent, though, and they're the same meatballs that they use in their "Sliced Meatball" pizza.

Overall, I'm very happy to have the Pizza Place on Noriega in my neighborhood. Now if only they delivered....
author: Sun L.

description:
Who would have known there's a pizza place in Outer Sunset?! Going here is sorta like going to the Moon for pizza BUT I live in the Sunset so its really not that far. Really its not. 

I've been to the Moon, I mean the Pizza Place, now twice. The first time I was sick but still enjoyed the pizza (we had the Margarita) and sweet potato fries. 

The 2nd time I brought the bro and his family. The kiddies really loved the music here and was jamming out to the punk rock. We noshed on the sweet potato fries and chicken wing starters. Be warned though those fries are filling!!! We ordered the Dimitri this time and boy was it AWESOME. YUMMM.... loved it. The sausage was especially tasty. I think that will be my fav pizza from now on. But you can also do order  by the slice and make your pizza anyway you like it. 

Service here is cool, down to earth in a laid back way. Servers were friendly and they change your plates after your apps and give you a fresh one for your pie slice. That makes me happy. I hate mixing flavors!
author: Julie F.

description: I forgot that it was gluten free pizza halfway through.even the salad was slappin.  Definitely going back for another. Joe was awesome, despite being a ravens fan. great place.
author: James C.

description: Yummy thin crust pizza.  I've only ordered from here a few times.  But I will keep them logged into my brain if I want a good thin crust pizza.
author: Sheenie L.

description:
Thank you fellow Yelpers for recommending this place.  Was in the neighborhood and toddler was demanding pizza!  Ordered a meathead for the older kids and a cheese pizza for the little one.  They all loved it!  Definitely a great place for a thin crust pizza anytime, anyday.

Will be heading back soon to try the specials they have...
author: Sharon S.

description: The place to go for pizza in the Sunset. The salads are huge and delicious. Love the buffalo wings as well. Service is laid back and slow- but that never really bothers me. Great place to hang out, grab a beer, enjoy a slice , and watch the game on TV.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Waiters are kind of rude.
Service is kind of slow.
Pizza takes for-freaking-ever to cook.

that being said -

Pizza is yummy
Pesto sauce is fan-freaking-tastic
Salads are delicious
good beers on tap

visiting the place knowing that you're not gonna get the best service, but knowing you are going to walk out of there happy and full of pie makes it all worth it.
author: Andrea L.

description: Been here several times now. The food is great, the service is okay. In my book that gives 4 stars. They offer gluten free pizza which is hard to find. They offer pizza by the slice, but they don't offer gluten free pizza by the slice. The food has a very unique flavor in all the best ways. When I am nearby I like to stop by.
author: Benjamin G.

description:
So I am not picky when it comes to pizza, I LOVE PIZZA I can eat pizza every day.

I've only heard how bomb this place is so I had to give it a shot.

the first time I had it I ordered some pesto, pepperoni, sausage and jalapeño pizza...

the pesto was bomb, the jalapeños where kinda weird...but the sausage was like ground beef and I'm not down with ground anything on pizza, thats what tacos are for.


and the 2nd time I wasted 20 bucks on this place was just a straight pepperoni pizza which was not great. ive honestly had better pizza from chuckee cheeses.


and there is a total hipster vibe going on in there and I am the opposite of a hipster so I may not be hip enough for this place...?
author: Anthony T.

description:
This review is just for the service here - 
I've never dined in house, but every single time I have ordered by phone, the experience has been lackluster.
It seems this place is owned by a bunch of hipsters who don't really know what is the right way to treat a customer.
I got put on hold for around 10 minutes, which I feel is really unacceptable, never do I get treated with smiles....and the people just don't feel very friendly at all.

Maybe this doesn't apply to dining in, but I just don't wanna deal with this every-time I phone in.

The Pizza's aren't bad though, they are doughy and feel more artisan than your run of the mill delivery pizza.  

If only they could clean up their take out act.
author: Edwin L.

description:
=( They don't serve garlic bread. Shouldn't all pizza places do that? But the 3 star rating isn't for what they don't have...

The pizzas that I've had here have been okay. I find them to be a little too greasy for my taste. Once we ordered (I forget which one) a pizza for pick-up and when we got home, it was the wrong order. Eh, that's okay because it looked really good. So we tried it... and yeah, it was greasy and the middle was soggy.

About a month ago, we were in the mood for pizza and decided to give this place a second chance. We got the Rotten Bobby which has jalepenos and pesto on it which is what enticed us to order it - sounded really good! But I found the pizza this time to be a little too salty for my taste (may have been the pesto), and again greasy... and even though we ate there, the middle was soggy too. The real kicker was the spicy jalepenos! If you want something that will fire up your tastebuds, this is the pizza for you!

So... 0 for 2. Maybe I got the wrong kinds of pizzas? Or came on the wrong nights. But it will be a while before I try their pizzas again.
author: Christine C.

description:
Thin crust, meaty, yummy pizza called the Dimitri???

Delectable!

Iceberg lettuce wedge salad, tossed w/ radishes, walnuts & blue cheese?

Scrumptious!

I swear this unassuming corner spot on Noriega looked like a shady dive bar, but it's actually the Pizza Place and I'm so glad we found it...

We were in the mood for pizza and got on yelp to see what good places were in our neck of the woods...this place got 4 stars??? Let's try it!

We only did pick up, but the place looks cool and laid back inside so we're definitely gonna try and come back and eat here!
author: Jade B.

description: must get MEAT HEAD pizza. AMAZZZZZing.
author: Abigail W.

description: Great atmosphere. Awesome pizza. Good peps. And possibly the best salads in San Francisco. I'm so glad I live only blocks away from this gem.
author: Michelle K.

description: Being from New York, I have a pretty good idea for good, if not great, pizza. However, even great New York-style pizza still cannot compare to true Italian pizza di Napoli. [think...http://pizzeriadelfina.com/  Oh, now, that's good stuff there!] As for the Pizza Place?
author: David S.

description: Every one was friendly but the food was not great. The pizza was over cooked and there was nothing special about it. I dont recommend this place.
author: Monica M.

description:
I don't even want to do take-out anymore. My son and I went in for pizza pickup and the evil dark-and-curly-haired woman greeted us (or didn't). I mentioned we were there for pickup and got a cold reply. We waited and weren't sure if someone was going to help us or not. 

Eventually we were seen to:

Me: "Pickup for J.S."
Them: "Okay." (walks away for a few minutes)
(comes back and leaves box in front of us without a word; walks away again)
(comes back a few minutes later, leaves bill without a word)
Me: "Thanks."
Them: (silence; walks away again)
(I sign the bill and leave it on the counter)

Meanwhile, the evil dark-and-curly-haired woman stared daggers alternately at my son by the gumball machine and at me in line being waited upon (or not). Does she hate us, specifically? Or just kids & families? Or maybe just customers?

Forgot to mention that ages ago my husband and his pal came in after a visit to Trouble coffee. They purchased two beers and some appetizers and were sipping their coffee while they waited (a while) for their beers. Then the evil dark-and-curly-haired woman came over and told them with disdain "you can't drink those in here." C'mon. Is this harsh attitude part of her job description?

Read the other Yelpers' reviews on service. No matter how good the potato fries are, I may just have to stay away from this place based on crappy vibe alone. It's a bummer, because it's one of few eateries on this end of Noriega and the only space that *seems* perfect for kids and bigger groups.
author: J S.

description:
Too noisy
Good and bad art
Great kitchen in the middle of the room
Chill Beach people servers
Fast service
author: Brett K.

description:
A friend of mine introduced me to the Pizza Place on Noriega. I was pleasantly surprised on how good the pizza was. If your like me and enjoy a pizza that's loaded with fresh toppings and has a thin pizza crust. This is the place..... I'll be back again. 

The service can be slow but the whole atmosphere is really laid back... Perfect for watching the Giants and throwing back a few beers.
author: Richard U.

description: I live 2 blocks away from this place and how lucky am I?!?!?  Its the best friggin pizza around.  We go regularly and love it, the food is awesome, the people are great!  Love Victoria, she is awesome!!!  Go for the best pizza in the city!!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Add me to the list who wishes there was a .5 star rating, because 3.5 is more fitting for this place.  The pizza is pretty good, but not even the best in Sunset.  I know they haven't been open for too long, so I was very surprised at how run down the inside seemed.  A little embarrassed that I took family here...felt like I was in a small town, run down pizza shop.  Guess it's best for take-out/delivery.  

Pizza is very thin crust, almost too thin...and I prefer thin.  But really, a large came with 8 slices and 2 slices didn't fill anyone up.  

I would never try anything other than pizza here.  In fact, I'll never go back to eat there unless it's a slice at the bar.
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Pretty good pizza, the large is huuuuge and can feed 5 adults easily. It's thin crust, but I didn't like that it was greesy.
author: Ines C.

description:
I love this place. The food is good, the atmosphere is friendly and laid back, which is what one should expect being 2 blocks from the beach. The Pizza Place has also expanded their menu options -- great sandwiches for lunch, and dinner specials other than pizza. My favorite is the pork and beans.

This place does get busy, but the staff is very friendly. Just walk up to the bar and ask for help, let them know you're there and want something, and they are happy to oblige. 

The beer is cold. Friendly wait staff. Good vibe, good food. What else can you ask for?
author: Jon K.

description: The Rotten Robby was really good. Had half rotten Robby and half Dimitri and we left with 2 pieces of Dimitri to take home. Super friendly staff and kid friendly. Worth checking out.
author: Chanda E.

description: A friend of mine told me about this place ! The pizza is excellent  great service and its nice to find a great place to get pizza. They also have a Pork carnitas  bowl that's very tasty. The wings though not so much. But for great pizza they got my vote and i will be coming back !!!
author: james m.

description:
I realize that pizza is very sacred to some folks and that everyone has their opinion. I've read a bunch of reviews about this place and see that you simply CANNOT please everyone in this category; it's impossible. 

l feel that it's more important to look at the bigger picture. the pizza place is a place that makes people happy! It reminds me of places back home on the board walk back in the 70's but with much better choices! and no tony bag of donuts hanging out at the bar. ha! 

 it's got a great staff, fun environment and spectacular food! Last week a group of us went in and had 4 apps, a pitcher of cold beer and two pies. All the food was well seasoned and prepared perfectly. The pizzas have a dynamite crust and good choice of toppings. No, the cheese way not greasy, if anything some of it might have separated in that 700 degree oven, but it was more like butter than oil. that's it, cheese butter! hey you put some veggies and nice meat on top and call it a french delicacy. oui!
it is what it is (not a stuffy pizza joint). a fun community place to eat and hang out. I love this place!
author: Stephen G.

description:
We got the sweet potato fries and a medium half Margherita and half Veggie.
