The pizza here is so good it deserves criticism, which is far more than I can say of most places in SF.  Let's start with the crust, the heart of any pizza:  Your first tip-off is the warning in the menu that pizzas take 30 minutes to arrive.  A properly-baked pizza should simply NEVER be baked for that long, period.  As a result, the outer crust was far too dry and far too hard -- most likely caused by inadequate dough moisture combined with too low a baking temperature.  While I'm sure the bottom crust was great when it came out of the oven, within moments after slicing it, the excess moisture from the toppings (we had mushrooms, always problematic) had combined with orange-colored cheese oil, and had run between the slices and completely soaked the bottom of the pie.  The bottom crust on the first slice was so-so, and after that, the crust on the rest of the slices was pretty much ruined.  Many other pizzerias easily solve this problem by serving the pie on a round mesh screen, and by squeezing some of the moisture out of the mushrooms before baking the pizza - it's so easy to do and costs almost nothing.  I found the cheese a bit rubbery, but that's minor compared to problems with the crust.  Not including the crust, the flavor of our pizza was really very good.

I liked the atmosphere:  You got your blue 80s-era full-size Oldsmobile side clip mounted on the back wall, with the obligatory motorized pepperoni pizzas for wheels (no longer spinning, unfortunately).  You got $3 pints of pretty okay cold draft beer.  You got the sports bar in one room and the dining area in another.  The jaunty blond surfer-type waiter was seriously nice to us.  And the prices, while not the lowest (nor should they be), were very fair.

So look, owners of the Pizza Place, go make yourself a nice mushroom pizza, sit down, and PAY ATTENTION while you eat it.  Honestly now, what's your opinion?  Mine?  You would do well to experiment with higher dough moisture, higher baking temperatures, shorter baking times, and drier toppings (when necessary).  Buy a dozen mesh serving screens.  Then watch your business and your reputation grow even more.  You deserve it.
author: Richard A.

description:
I ordered takeout since they are around the corner from my house and I had a friend coming over who is allergic to cheese.  I was not relishing the thought of a cheeseless, tomato-less pizza.    The vegan pizza, Timmy's Pie, was awesome!  I am not much of a vegetarian, but it was a perfect combo of pesto, potatoes, caramelized onions, mushrooms and some other vegetables.  Tasty!

We also ordered the sweet potato steak fries, which came with a tasty cream dipping sauce full of flavors like citrus, dill and chives, and a mixed green salad with balsamic vinaigrette, which was equally tasty.  If you are looking for authentic Italian pizza, this may not be the place for you.  I am very happy to have a welcome addition to the limited food choices here in the Outer Sunset!
author: Marce J.

description:
This is the best pizza in the Sunset - unless you like the doughy cheap fare others serve. Good vibe there, too, even if the paintings are hung way high.

I really wish they would deliver.
author: Kent C.

description:
There are a few restaurants near my residence in the Outer Sunset.  I'll try my best to update on all those other places, but let's start with good 'ol pizza joint.  First off, their pizza is good.  Flat crust, crunchy (I like teh crunchy), and it just takes too dang long.  Wait here...I come back, it's still not here.  Tick Tock.  Well, duhhh, it's pizza.  Pizza takes time and patience to cook a great tasting pizza.  Although, it doesn't taste too different from some other pizza I've tasted.  

Holding up rifle, ready, aim...shoot...BANG.  There goes the star fall down.  oops.  I hit the 4th one.  That looks odd.  I might as well shoot the 5th star because they took away Dean's Deli.  For those of you that don't know, Dean's Deli was like the sandwich shop you grow up with.  The kids from the neighborhood would work there.  The nice lady who made sandwiches would smile...blah blah blah.  It's GONE!  BANG BANG!.  Dang, missed the third one, out of bullets.  Oh well.  3 for you guys!
author: Joey H.

description:
Who says the Sunset is not the hippest place in town? This little neighborhood, surf pie place makes unique combos of pizza on a great crust. 

Stop in for a slice or a pie.
author: K S.

description:
Here's an update from recent visits:  For those not interested in pizza, the meatball sandwiches here are very good.  The meatballs are fluffy and tender, the sandwich roll is soft and stuffed with lots of melted cheese.
Delicious.

There seems to be a lot of customers who bring in their young children on a regular basis and let them run wild throughout the restaurant. It happens almost every time we go.  If the management reads these reviews - we'd suggest they talk to the parents of these kids and explain to them that they're not at home, but in a restaurant where others are trying to enjoy their meal.  It's gotten to the point we have been going elsewhere because there always seems to be wild banshees running everywhere.
author: Cody L.

description:
dear pizza place,

i love your pizza so much, i think it's the best pizza in the city.

love,
sprout

p.s. i knock 1 star because the service can be notoriously slow at times
author: Sprout S.

description: This place is awesome. Their pizza is truly the best in San Francisco. I love their salads too. Anything you have here is super delish!!
author: dee d.

description: I've usually order to-go from here, so when I had some friends over, I decided sit down and enjoy some pizza.  To my great disappointment, this place had TERRIBLE service.  About a 30 minute to get a table on a busy night.  After being seated, it took a while to get the attention of a server.  We asked for waters and our server just pointed to a water station behind us.  However, we see the tables next to us had pitchers of ice water.  One of my friends orders a glass of wine and somehow it comes in a whisky glass (real classy).  Our server then disappears for twenty minutes while we're ready to order.  We decided to order a pizza.  Our server then disappears again.  After 30 minutes, we track our waitress down to check on the food.  She says that the pizza oven is being so tonight and there is nothing she can do.  Never doesn't ask us if there's anything else she can get us or we needed our drinks refilled.  Our pizza finally arrives after 45 minutes.  Decent pizza, so I'll give it 2 stars.  But I'll NEVER return here again.
author: R L.

description: I love the pizza and the sweet potato fries (with blue cheese and wing sauce) - they even have a vegan pizza.  If only they had a gluten-free pizza too?!?!  I just wish they would rotate their menu more often - the small selection of side dighes and salads, albeit very good, hardly ever change.  It gets boring... maybe my expectations are too high for a pizza place?  Anyways, I definitely recommend you eat there.  On a sunny day, their patio is nice (not much character, concrete walls), but a pizza and beer on a sunny patio can't be beat.
author: Marie Y.

description:
What happened to the fabled Dean's Deli? Diane would make the most awesomest sandwiches. She even had a sandwich named after Bernie Ward. Dean's deli was much more cluttered and had a lot more stuff. They also tasted really good as well. Then there was the quasi deans deli that had a sort of night club feel about it with like performances that sort of folded though they had diane working for them which was a big plus. They still had the sandwiches and whatnot but what made deans deli deans deli was gone. 

Oh well where was i going with his? Oh the pizza place right. 

I had their vegetarian pizza last night along with a side of olives and it was frankly not that bad. I prefer vegetarian pizzas to meat pizzas anyway and. The olives on the pizza was a tad bit salty and had too much of it and could have used more artichoke hearts. The olives were flavorful but i did not expect that there would be pits. Hey it wasted time while i waited for my pizza to be done. 

Though I say Jolly good addition to the sunset and the corner of 46th and Noriega. A nice quiet area that i call home. It is also a good neighborhood bar type of place as well. A place where you can go to get a pizza and a pint of guiness or there of. They are able to have a bar but also create a family atmosphere with the cheevy's wheels spinning with the pizza pans.
author: Christopher C.

description:
If you've been on an endless, relentless search for classic New York style chicken wings ever since you left the East Coast, search no more, The Pizza Place has great wings and they taste just like those wings flew all the way from the big apple......yummy... 
And like many other yelpers, I agree that the pizza is pretty darn good.  A little greasy and it takes awhile but you can't beat the thin crust...

So why three stars?  --No TV!  That's why!  How could a bar/pizza joint not have a TV to watch the Olympics?  Or even worse, depriving innocent patrons of the World Series!
author: Stacie D.

description: I'm a vegan, and their Timmy's Pie is outstanding! Their salad is really good and filling too. Their beers are incredible.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Continuing on the friday pizza date series, this week's target was the pizza place on noriega (TPPON).  Looks like a stock tickler.  
Walking in, the place looked different than I expected but I had heard great reviews so I wasn't afraid.  The place was packed, at least two large parties were there, a birthday group and surfrider group, i think.  Anyway, I didn't wait for a host/ess but immediately approached a server.  super friendly service in getting us seated, to getting my pint glass filled, to bringing our check.  I have to say the service was low key, attentive, and flawless.  we ordered timmy's pie, a vegan option with an iceberg salad.  both were very good.  The vegan pie was delicious and creative.  If a vegan pie with very little fat is that good, I can't wait to try the rest of the menu with more fat -- cheese.  

Pros -- food, service, and parking.
Con - noise level inside is pretty loud
author: Mina C.

description: Love the food, the people are great, a little slow but well worth the wait.
author: pablo v.

description:
reasons i am sad about no longer living at Ocean Beach: 
1. no more surfing at my doorstep
2. no more twice daily walks on the beach
3. not as much Pizza from The Pizza Place! 

(in no specific order)

get here for some pizza +  you'll be happy - add a beer, some olives + a tasty salad + your set!
author: alisa m.

description: Had the Besto.  It really is the besto - lol.  So good.  I love this pesto sauce they have - not so acidic like at some other places.  I also really like the feel of this place - it's open and airy and they are always really friendly.  They're ready-made slices take less time than their pies but their pies are so good and really big.  Great value for the money.  Their salads are also really good.  I like their ceasar and the kale one and the mixed greens is nice too.  haven't tried their sliders yet but I'm looking forward to doing that one of these days.
author: Helga B.

description: Extra point for knowing the owner. The za is very good but a little on the greasy side. I do like the atmosphere which is very plain and simple. Great beers to drink and creative menu. Low brow and worth the visit.
author: Chris G.

description: Great veggie pizza and just crunchy enough thin crust.  Reasonably priced. Parking ok if you're patient.
author: Ann B.

description: Great pizza. Ordered the "Spicoli", which consisted of sausage and extra cheese. It was delicious! I was amazed by the size of their large pizza.... There was only two of us and we barely put a dent in it. They also have homemade ranch which was a pleasant surprise. Our waiter was slightly iffy but overall I would recommend The Pizza Place.
author: Katie S.

description:
I LOVE PIZZA! This is probably the best pizza place in San Francisco's history, only rivaled by Orgasmica. And please, don't say Amici's! Amici's is, was, and will always be, overpriced crap. Amici's became popular because of the Chestnut Street location that was frequented by rich people who don't know the first thing about value. They just feel important and entitled to opinion because they are, well, rich people. 
But back to The Pizza Place. I love this place. The pizzas are enormous and soooooooo tasty! Sure it's greasy, it's pizza! If you are so concerned about a greasy piece of food, stay home and make something yourself. The chicken wings are amazing, and the grinders are the best thing to fill that hole in your stomach on a Saturday afternoon. I've been taking my family to this place since day one. 

HOWEVER, I have to say the scruffy surfer dude that waited on us a few weeks ago was a complete and total d-bag! Homeboy got all pissed off when we asked to sit at a table and have beers while we ordered food to go. He literally dropped the menus from about 5 feet off the table and they came down and made a loud THWAP! noise that startled both my wife and kids. When we ordered (2 slices, a salad and 12 wings to go) he repeated our order out loud and said "That's all you want?" Is there a quota Spicoli? And finally when my 5 year old daughter went to hand this guy our bill and credit card he nearly knocked her on the ground and never even noticed, and or completely ignored her because he was having a frat boy moment with his buddies who were getting all of his attention the whole time we were there. DUDE, customers should be treated equally. It's not a hangout it's your job, and the customer is always right even if they only want a table to have pint while they order food to go. 
By the way, there were at least 7 empty tables in the place that night so it's not like we were impeding on anyone or anything. 
Other than that, I love this place!!!!! My only regret would be that I didn't file a formal complaint with management as I am familiar with alot of the folks that have run this place since opening day.
author: Danny O.

description: Good pizza, good service, and good atmosphere. Thin crust good house combos. A little cold in there though. Recomended.
author: Frankie V.

description:
I love this place!!  Best Pizza in San Francisco by far!  The crust is great, the sauce is outstanding and you can tell they are using a high quality cheese.  I ate half of a medium pizza and did not FEEL like I ate half of a pizza, which means, that the grease content is quite low.  We also had the spinach salad, which was fantastic.  The combination of flavors on the salad was perfect and then it was topped off with an amazing dressing which finished off a superb plate of greens. 

The service was fast and friendly and the atmosphere has a grass-roots, home-grown feeling to it.  Oh and my favorite part of the entire menu, sparking water on tap!  What a nice touch.  Thanks Pizza Place!
author: Beth O.

description: I feel like Norm from Cheers (Dating myself, I know) whenever I go into The Pizza Place on Noriega.  I've lived in the neighborhood for too long I think, but long enough to know how lucky we are to have such a great restaurant out here.  Yes, it's worth traveling to if you do not live in the Sunset.  I bring clients here from all over the city and they return again and again because they recognize a great pie.  I have been told more once by my clientele that they appreciate that I have turned them onto The Pizza Place.  Obviously, the pizza is great, but the salads rule as do their sandwiches; and did I mention the beers?  Yup, they got at least 7 beers on tap.  I have been enjoying meals with my family since they opened and am incredibly stoked to have such a fun, family friendly restaurant in the Sunset.  My only wish is we had more commercial opportunities in the Outer Ave's to continue this fabulous trend of fine eateries and cafes' springing up in all over the neighborhood.  Establishments like this have brought our community together in shined light on what is sometimes a very foggy place.
author: Todd W.

description: formerly our neighborhood pizzeria until we moved. miss this place. excellent pizza, fun ambience. great for kids.
author: Kent P.

description: Very tasty thin crust East Coast style pizza. Our server was good, the pizza is baked fresh, so be prepared to wait about 25-30 minutes. Priced affordably, and the large pie is really large (20"). You can't go wrong with the Margherita, and if you crave more excitement, get anchovies and go home happy, like my dear friend Anthony.
author: Milk and Cheese ..

description: funnily enough, i came here for mother's day because my family is laid back like that. my grandma, who is ultra chinese, likes pizza but never gets the chance to eat it because she can't order it due to language barriers. we ordered one of their specials equivalent to a combo. then i ordered a build your own pizza with goat cheese, arugula, bacon and grilled onions (i think..? sounds about right). both were pretty good, though they were a tad bit too oily for my liking. my grandma pretended to like the one i chose but said she was too full to finish it. then she proceeded to eat two slices of the meat pizza....super subtle style. i like pizza place, but i wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: Regina C.

description: Working on Noriega, we seem to be put in this position a lot come lunch time; slightly pricier but delicious pizza  from The Pizza Place, or cheap sub par pizza from Domino's? I loooove thin crust pizza, so my vote is always for The Pizza Place. Our unanimous pizza of choice is the Demitri, a nice twist to my personal favorite: pepperoni mushroom. The pizzas are always made FRESH which is why sometimes it' may take a while. But that's a sacrifice I'm willing to make for piping hot pizza fresh from the oven. I just wish it wasn't so greasy! But aren't the best pizzas always are?
author: Jen L.

description: I had high hopes for this place. Unfortunately, it took those hopes and crushed them under the crust of inferior pizza.  I've been in twice (hoping the first was just an off night) the second time during the lunch hour and the lady running the place was so rude I turned around and walked out. I wont be going back...
author: R A.

description: I am not a sweet sauce fan and the crust was crunchy, not crisp, so this will not be My Pizza Place on Noriega.   This place also has the requisite outcast nostalgia soundtrack: Misfits, Siouxsie.  Over it.  Fortunately the people are nice, the service is good, and I liked walking outside and looking down the street to the Ocean.  Sweet Potato fries were starchy and sweet and caramelized/burned on the outside, and I liked those a lot- came with the saddest three little dry baby carrots and browning celery sticks.  Some people I love (including everyone else at the table) love this place, so I'll be back anyway.
author: Shona M.

description:
I've had a lot of pizza in my life and after hearing about this joint almost all my life I had to come check it out for once. Now my friends and I came here for a b-day dinner celebration and we were promptly seated immediately which was nice. After we ordered some appetizers, and beer we finally got down to eating some of their NY style pizza. Even though I am not from the East Coast, I had some high expectations due to the fact that I had real authentic NY style pizza in the Big Apple twice in the past half year. For the most part the night went smooth and our sweet potato fries was quite interesting to say the least. They were somewhat soggy when I fully expected them to be more crisp, but their unique buffalo and ranch sauces subdued that fact for the moment. The place itself is decently sized being on the corner of a major street but the one thing I couldn't shake was the price. We ordered one XL pizza and one Large pizza along with the before mention items and our total came out to be just under a hundred dollars. I don't know about most people but this is kinda pricey considering everyone only had a couple slices overall.

Which brings me to the pizza itself. The all meat pizza and the vegetable pizza I would have to say is only acceptable at best. It's tough cutting through and eating soggy dough along with toppings that seem to just fall apart no matter what you do with it. I didn't find using a knife and fork enjoyable due to the fact that when I tried to pick the pizza up with my hands, everything would fall apart quickly. Now since we were here on someone else' accord I decided not to say anything but rather give an honest opinion of my experience. There are many other great pizza places in the Sunset that you can go to that would be more worth while. If I could give 2 1/2 stars instead I would but I feel that 2 stars is too low. I would want to try this place again to see if my experience has improved but only time will tell if that happens or not...
author: Jason Y.

description:
The Best Pizza in California!!
Beers on tap... fresh organic ingeridents..super friendly staff....
#1 in S.F for sure.
author: Marilyn H.

description: I finally tried their meatball sandwich today.  Best I've ever had.  The meatballs were tasty and not too dense; the sauce was hot and tasty with little chunks of tomato.  Perfect sandwich.
author: Cindi L.

description: Nice thin crust pizza reasonably priced in a bar setting. I'd come back if I was in the neighborhood but will still be looking for the five star pizza in SF.
author: Brad B.

description: I have lived near this place for a while now and I never visited until tonight because some people did not have good things to say about it. Well, they were right. The joint is massively overpriced. When we went in the guy serving us behaved unwelcoming and basically like a prima dona., We were lucky to be served by him I guess. With his red hair and attitude, he succeeded in confirming what my friends have warned me about this place. Overpriced and not friendly. Greasy pizza. Get new staff and respect for locals if you want to continue to stay in business. I will definitely not go back or recommend the place.
author: Eileen M.

description: Best NY style pizza in the Sunset
author: Seiken N.

description: The pizza is a little oily.  There was a decent portion of toppings.  None the less it's a great neighborhood place.  The service and atmosphere is a lot of fun and family oriented.
author: Ginny M.

description:
This is, bar none, the BEST pizza place on the West Coast. I am pregnant, so I've lost all dignity in my search for the greatest East Coast pizza...but WHO CARES!? 

The crust is perfectly thin, the pizza flops around so you have to fold it over, the delicious sauce is a special recipe from the owners, the toppings are very generous...and the pizza is great the next day. I got a medium "Dmitri" w/out the pepperoni (tons of garlic, spicy sausage, mushroom) & am still in paradise. I think the prices are slightly high, which is why I am giving this place 4 stars, but I will definitely be back to order an entire medium pie & NOT SHARE wih anyone.  Maybe a little of the toppings with my husband.  

I couldn't quite eat cold pizza the next day for breakfast, you know - preggers & all, the child decides what I eat & when - but I am eating it heated up, as I author this review. 

This venue also serves wine & beer, and I hear that the salads are actually like concoctions you'd get from health food stores like Other Avenues Food Coop -- Real Vegetables That Taste and Look Good. 

The decor is something to be desired, but - again - WHO CARES!? This pizza ROCKS.
author: kathryn s.

description:
Amazing vegan pizza (Timmy's Pie)!!! 

It's yummy if you eat it straight away but if you actually put it into the oven and reheat at 425 for approximately 5 minutes, the potatoes get crisp and the crust is super crunchy and holy christ, it's amazing. 

Be careful if you order a large pie here, the size of the box is insane.
author: Noelle P.

description:
Best pizza in San Francisco. Period.
If you can find it, go. Try the pizza and see what I'm saying.
author: Nick S.

description: Went to TPP once again - we were all in the mood for pizza, and we all agree - this is the place to go!  Tried the sausage pie, and it was a bit greasy, as others have noted.  The meatless options are not a problem, but their crust just can't handle the greasy meat bits.  It was a mighty tasty pizza, nonetheless!  The crust can handle mushrooms and TPP's mushroom pie is something to dream about!  They still get 5 STARS for great service, atmosphere, and near east coast authenticity, when it comes to great pizza!
author: Loretta G.

description:
I think the food here is FANTASTIC, amazing and yummy.  Most of the servers are so nice and hospitable.  
BUT there is one server woman who treats her guests like crap and should NOT be in the customer service industry.  Maybe she is a manager?  She is rude and ungrateful to her patrons.  Avoid the server with the long brown hair.  Once she waits on you, you will understand.   She acts like she is doing you a favor by taking your order.  If you want any slight modifications she glares at you as if you just spit on her.  Like I said, she needs to get out of the restaurant industry and stop working with the public.  Her attitude has made me STOP attending this amazing  pizza place, which is a bummer because I used to go there all the time.
author: katie b.

description: Delicious as hell. Great pizza and a friendly atmosphere. Sure sometimes it takes a little bit to get your pizza but hey, your patience will be rewarded. Great beers on tap, good specials, great za. I recommend the Besto or really anything with meat. Come check it out!
author: Jason S.

description: The Pizza Place rules. Not just because it's the only hip/fun/lively restaurant in the Outer Sunset, but because the food is delicious! The people who work here are always friendly. The music is always rocking. The pizza is always good. They have a lot of different types of pizza on the menu, including a vegan option, but you can pretty much get any topping you could ever dream of putting on your pizza. The chicken wings have the most amazing sauce on them. The salads are fresh, and a small salad is definitely big enough for two people. I highly recommend their home-made blue cheese dressing. During the day they have a special lunch menu and the Save a Chicken sammich is my favorite--its a fake chicken patty, but you would never know the difference. AND they pour a good pbr. Thank you for being in my neighborhood, Pizza Place.
author: Jamie J.

description: So I think it's time for a follow-up since I pretty much said the place sucked. After my first visit, I didn't return for quite awhile. However I was convinced to try it again, and to my surprise, I ended up actually liking it and I've been back many times. My BAD. I don't remember which pizza I had the first time around, and it may not have mattered.....perhaps it was a new cook or he was having a bad day or maybe I was having a bad day. Anyway, I owe this place an apology. Their Greek pizza is truly delish, they have $9 pitchers of PBR which greatly helps kill time during the long wait for pizza, and the staff is usually pretty friendly.  If they would just spring for some new utensils I might add another star! Okay, so I guess not too many people are gonna thank me later, huh?
author: Laurie A.

description: WOW! I was truly amazed by this place. Yes it's crowded and noisy and you may have to wait a while for a table - but they're crowded for a reason. And that reason is...they're great! I had a slice of their Sunset Aloha (their version of Hawaiian pizza) with coppacola, pineapple and feta. Possibly some of the best pizza I've ever had - and I'm very particular about my pie. Definitely not the cheapest place in town, but worth every penny.
author: Julia D.

description: Good pizza, pitchers of beer and cool employees.  Yum.
author: Drew D.

description: Forget the pizza, there's another great reason to check out this place-the dudes. Where else can you find a bunch of hot straight guys that live in the hood? Seeing as it serves beer as well as pizza, it also doubles as a great alternative local hang. Yum. Yum. Yum. Wait, dont tell everyone ;-)
author: tigipop ..

description:
this place gets 5 stars just for the fact that the pizza is super duper crispy thin crust and when it's fresh outta the oven it can be held in one hand like any normal piece of NYC pizza without falling limp. the vegan pies are delish - roasted tomatoes, potatoes, pesto...aw yeah!

the location rocks...totally off the beaten path and in a nice quiet 'hood - only a few blocks from the beach? Hopefully it'll stay DL in that it won't be another Little Star and packed to the gills @ all hours, but I don't think that'll happen. I think people are just too lazy to go all the way out to the ocean for pizza.

one last thing - the roasted cauliflower's not _that_ great. funny it's on the menu...I've recently switched to a veg-friendly diet and homemade roasted cauliflower's been a very regular staple of it -- and for some reason I'm finding more places around town have been serving it. my version just has olive oil, salt, and a dash of chili powder, while the PPoN's version has some citrus (orange?) diced up in theirs which kinda ruins the taste if you ask me. IMO less is more, ya know?
author: Justin H.

description: I love this place because of location.   Walking down the street for a plate of spaghetti and meatballs or a big pizza pie is wonderful. 3 blocks from the beach the only thing missing is a few old school coin ops like Dig Dug or Rip Off. Very casual service. Friendly atmosphere. Food is probably a solid 3 star but atmosphere, location, and menu selection make it 4 stars. Creative menu selection includes "Grinder" Meatball sandwhiches, vege buffaloe wings(sweet potatoes in buffaloe sauce), excellent spinach salad, and sides of white beans with pesto....and Beer Garden in the back for sunny days.  Oh and Pizza is solid!
author: mark g.

description: Perfect neighborhood place for people with tattoos and babies. The pizza is pretty good--the best in the neighborhood-- but it's the sweet potato fries, buffalo wings and pork shoulder on white beans that sets it apart. I like the Eel River IPA as well.
author: Kevin K.

description:
These guys must have a great publicist.

Here you have authentic East Coast style pizza, which is all relative, because 99.9% of the pizza on the East Coast is actually made of cardboard and oil based "cheese" blends.  So in that regard, sure it's really authentic.  Taste wise it reminds me of Stromboli's in NY (they have locations on University, and also 2nd Ave.)  The sauce is sweet, with onions in it.... a small step up from the crap Ray's sells, but not much.

So don't expect artisan pizza with fresh mozzeralla.  In fact, when I asked if the Margarita for 50 cents extra was the Buffalina stuff, I was told it was just the same old slice but with basil tossed on it.

So basically, here you have a place you can get a greasy slice in San Francisco, that's not Blondie's (yuck) or Golden Boy (mmm sicilian!) or those places on Haight Street (which are a little more processed then Noriega's pizza, but not much).   Unfortunately, a slice with toppings will run you anywhere from $3.00-$4.50.   Oh, and if you're me, the first bite will burn the roof of your mouth and hurt for days.

If you live in the Sunset, then it's about as good an option for pizza as any out there....but it's not  a destination place.  Noriega has a little stretch with some creepy surfer types hanging around. It's basically resedential slums that will one day make for a nice neighborhood again...but right now there's nothing there.  I had high hopes this place would help to start bringing other businesses out there, but it's just one more funky place opening without any overhead.  The chairs look like they came from auctioned old dive bar stock...the kitchen itself, which they added is pretty nice (the location used to be a weird deli/liquor store) but there's no ambience here unless you count the Doze Green painting (or is it a knockoff?) on the wall that looks out of place.   

So in short, I have no idea why this is blurbs in SF publications. There's nothing special about it, and the truth is, San Francisco has much better mediocre pizza for much cheaper.
author: BJS ..

description: This is a hidden gem in the Outer Sunset. Great place to get a slice and a beer and watch a game. I think that they try to source as much as they can locally. Delicious food. Don't be fooled by the look of the outside.
author: Shellie P.

description:
i like the #10 cans used as napkin holders as much as the next person and think mismatched silverware and plates is functional just as much as the next (surfer) guy, but i think you cross the line b/w "laid back vibe" and just plain ugly with some elements of the build out (like the pictures).

nonetheless, this place is about a hip (when compared with the places surrounding it), not nice, vibe and i'd come here again if i lived nearby.  i don't, however, think it merits any kind of cross town trip.  pizza is a big OK - tomato sauce is too y mild and sweet and very unmemorable dough, loaded down with a ton of ok toppings (making it a good value perhaps but also a really really dense and soggy pie).  

kudos to the owners for really knowing the clientele and picking an unusual and great location for what they wanted to do.  it is not, though,  "the best pizza in san francsico/california/west coast/the world".

they told us our pizza would take 45 min (it took less but i appreciate the heads up, even if it is just a veiled attempt to get you to order an app) so we got the antipasti "platter", which was only something like $8 but stopped shy of a platter.  like the pizza, it was ok but i have a hard time being more effusive than that.  each element kinda tasted like something i would get at the safeway deli counter.  if you are hungry and watching pizzas get delivered all around you, it would probably taste like "the best antipasti platter in all of the pacific" but no, it's really not.
author: Laurie A.

description: I love this place...feels like you could just stroll in right off the beach, kinda like Pizza My Heart in Capitola, but in the Sunset. Really good pizza, yummy salads and you have to try the cauliflower. Happy times all around, The Pizza Place is a cool little spot.
author: Kylie S.

description: pizza is pricey. staff was sorta snotty. have had better pizza everywhere in the city. not a must have, but if you're feeling adventurous then stop by.
author: Daniel C.

description: Great menu, including toppings, drinks, desserts, salads. The pizza crust is among the best in the city. One time I left my backpack at the bar and the waitress found it. I was very thankful for that! Besides that instance, the front of the house staff generally seem stuffy. Perhaps if I were a regular they'd treat me better, but then again, if they'd treat me better, I might be a regular. The aesthetics are well done. It's cozy and open to larger groups. They never mess up my order. Family friendly. Good drinks.
author: Andrew H.

description:
YAY!! Yummy pizza in SF...in the frickin Sunset!!  No delivery, but thats OK.  5 mins from my house. Sauce that tastes like tomatoes and stuff, cheese that has flavor, thin, crispy crust that also has flavor!  Up there with Gaspares in quality, and Marcello's in cuteness,  Loved it!
WARNING:  The "large" is HUGE!!!!!!!!!
author: nicole p.

description:
pizza here is ok. for a real thin crust experience you have to get the large size. small is too doughy and slices are way soggy and sub par, hate that! 

one thing i can say...regardless of how the pizza might be you'll have your mind blown with the sweet potato fries and wing sauce!
author: casey c.

description: Don't buy the hype.  Interesting combination of toppings for pizza but super greasy.  The buffalo wings were swimming in sauce.  That's a first for me.  Yuck.  Long wait too.  Meh.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
We miss you!  This was our local pizza place and we would come here every Friday night to get a large Broccoli Tomato pizza and a pitcher of PBR. The staff is SUPER nice. The pizza is delish! Thin crust, good sauce, tons of garlic. Love it. Great music. Great atmosphere. Local hangout. 

Also, the sweet potato fries are AMAZING! We would get them sometimes when we were really hungry.
author: Marisa M.

description: I heard good things about this place for awhile and decided to check it out with the family, 5 of us. Stopped in and thought it was a pretty cool looking place, surf , alternative vibe, not too fancy but clean. Just the kind of place I want to like!  We sat right under a speaker and the music was cranking out pretty loud and we had to kind of yell to hear each other. So, we moved one table away, which was better. They have an outside patio which looked nice but it was a windy, early spring day, so too cold for that. We were not ready to order when the waiter first stopped by. Then it took forever for him to come back to the table. We craned our necks and I got up a couple times and walked over by the bar so they could see that we needed help, but no help came. Probably 15 minutes went by and I walked up to the bar and told them we were ready to order and had been waiting awhile. So, someone from behind the bar came out and  took our order. Later, our waiter apologized that he had a bunch of root beer floats to make and that is what delayed him.  Then we got the Pizza. The menu notes, something to the effect that, because it is cooked in a brick oven and hand tossed, it takes a minimum of 20-25 minutes to cook, so yeah it did take awhile, no problem for good food right? The Pizza arrived and was pretty big, enough for a not super hungry family of 5, w/ 3 kids, ages 7-13.  But, the Pizza was your standard greasy, gooey doughy type of thing. Nothing special at all, in fact, much lower quality than most of the many pizza restaraunts around S.F. we've been too lately. All 5 of us were in agreement, nothing special at all. I was bummed because it seemed such a cool place, brick oven pizza and all that.  I'll probably try it again, just because I like this type of place, some time, just to be sure, but upon first visit, we were very disappointed.
author: Paul R.

description: Hey guy this pizza fucking RULES. Growing up in Boston I was skeptical about this at first but it tastes just like papa ginos! ya rememba that place sully? Yeah this is authentic all right. Sure the price isn't as cheap as Boston but I didn't expect that, not that it's expensive but I don't see 2 large pizzas for 8.88 on the menu pal. You definitely have to get the pizza in the authentic ways though. No fancy topping heah, cheese or pepparoni only..what ah ya queah foah orderin vegetables guy?
author: Dave R.

description: The buffalo chicken wings are fantastic, but their blue cheese dressing is watery and tasteless.  We've ordered them three times now, and this last time we got almost all drumsticks instead of wings-  I really prefer wings due to their tenderness, and the first two times they gave us about half and half.  We've tried their pizza twice.  The first time was a basic pepperoni.  Be warned, the large is LARGE.  It was very greasy and salty, and just ok.  We decided to give it a second try, and this time we got the margherita pizza.  Usually this type of pizza has sliced tomatoes and fresh basil on it.  This was a greasy cheese pizza with some shredded not-so-good-looking basil on it.  Not tasty at all, and certainly not worth 16 bucks for a medium!!!!!  I recommend maybe trying the  wings, and then cooking up a yummy $4 Trader Joe's frozen pizza-  much more delicious and economical!
author: jennifer g.

description: Saw this place reviewed in the paper today, so decided to try their grinder (sub) for lunch.  It was good - not great.  Staff was great - not good.  A but hard to find as there is no sign out front.  Gotta try their pizza - need a good pizza place out in the Sunset!
author: Ranger A.

description: I'm giving this place five stars!  I tried PPON out with a friend and loved it.  The pizza, salad and appetizers were great.  The wine was good and the desserts too.  This is a great place where you can go with a group of people and hang out, be comfortable and relaxed and eat good pizza.  Owned by a couple of nice locals.  I like to support this type of business.
author: Shannon B.

description: Really good pie and some of the chillest people if you dine in.  They have PBR on tap (always good) but the pizza is a bit pricey.  Not my regular pizza spot but I like keeping them in the rotation.
author: Tony V.

description: I must say these guys make a mean pie, I tried a medium spicoli, it was very good, I would have given this place five stars but it is a bit on the pricey side
author: Mark O.

description: The ROASTED CAULIFLOWER appetizer and the Spinach Salad are fantastic.  The pizza is also very good - really enjoyed the Dimitri Pizza - will try others on our subsequent visits.  Great, casual restaurant.   If your alone or a couple sitting at the bar to eat can be fun and you can watch the action in the kitchen.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  We had a great time - and if you go try the ROASTED CAULIFLOWER - REALLY.
author: Kathy H.

description: authentic, east coast pizza. It was crispy, the cheese was quality, the sauce was zesty. i'll be back for a meatball grinder soon boys.
author: Dana R.

description: I really want to give this place an extra star because their service was great, very cool decor and spacious. I also loved the iceberg salad with the best blue cheese dressing I've ever had. Love the crispy thin crust and the toppings choices were plentiful. So, why the 3 star review? Well, their pizza was the greasiest I've ever had. Before eating, I had to use at least 2 napkins to suck out most of the grease on the pizza. And, there was still more grease on it. Perhaps our topping choices made the greasy combo (pepperoni and sausage), but I've had that combo at other places and it did not come out dripping with grease. Perhaps I will add another star when we try this place again in a few months.
author: Annie L.

description: Doesn't get better then reading Thrasher and sipping on the sweet nectar of the gods while waitin for a slice of the rotten robbie ( sausage, pep, mushrooms , garlic, jalepenos). Super chill atmosphere and staff. Defenitly a neighborhood, bring your dog, have a beer and hang feel. They even have a pizza for you vegans and vege's. Check it out if your in the hood.....
author: spencer k.

description:
BEST.PIZZA.EVER.

And quite dishy men running the place too! I highly recommend the trek out there. Great service, fun atmosphere, charming staff, and most important the pizza rocks! Cooked perfectly, thin and crispy, perfect amount of sauce and cheese.  I have to say this is my new fave pizza spot in SF.
author: Rebecca L.

description: The pizza is delicious and Andy (our waiter) was top notch.  By far the best pizza in the hood.  Home made ranch and blue cheese dressings - there is a lot of heart behind this place.  Fyi - the large is gynormous!
author: EVELYNE E.

description: Good honest food.  I didn't have the pizza, But the warm spinach salad was good and comfroting as the rain poured outside.  A mellow and comfortable setting and a bustling crowd....I would def go back...
author: Yasmine D.

description:
Pro: 
one of the best Pizza joints in the outer sunset. we live a few blocks away and go down there from time to time. Pizza is like no other. do yourself a favor and try it, you wont regret it.

Con: 
Pizza is a little on the pricey side (still worth it)
author: Mike Y.

description: Their pizza and salad are delicious. However, you must eat the pizza within 15 minutes of it coming out of the oven or it becomes a greasy, soggy mess. Minus one star for that because I actually love eating cold pizza but can't eat this one cold.
author: Al T.

description: So I have to start by saying that I'm not a fan of thin crust pizza.....or at least I wasn't until now.  I work in the area and my office decided to order out for lunch one day.  There were four of us so we figured a large would be good.  Boy, was that pizza LARGE when we got it!  I'm not kidding,  I didn't know they even made pizza boxes that size.  Well, to my surprise the pizza was really, really good.  I've since then ordered from them at least twice and am sure I will continue ordering from them if they keep serving up the good grub!
author: Linda K.

description:
I wanted to try a bunch of pizza places near me and this was first on the list.  It's a cool place and the people working there were nice and friendly at the lunch hour.

I got the extreme meaty pizza (whatever it was called) which I really liked.  It had like 5 different types of meat and a lot of them piled high. The thing is, when I got to the crust it tasted like standard crust and I realized that they pile on toppings and whatnot and cover up the taste of the crust.

This was confirmed when my girlfriend ate there. She got cheese and broccoli and disliked it because the cheese and crust were bland. I tried it and I have to agree.

When I want pizza, I want pizza and I'm not as concerned with atmosphere, location, or toppings sometimes.  I'd go back and get the meat pizza because it was great and generous for the price, but if I want a plain pizza or something with basic toppings, I'll go somewhere else.
author: Greg B.

description: I've been here many times, love the place. They serve good pizzas, the salads are really nice too, and they refill your drinks as soon as you take a sip from it. Friendly staff and decent prices. Highly recommended!
author: R S.

description: OMG!! a pizza place near home!! this has ok pizza. but the buffalo wings, HOT HOT HOT (i mean temperature wise)!! it also takes a 30 minutes for them to make the pizza. and they got my order wrong. i asked for pepperoni pizza with extra sauce, but they gave me pepperoni pizza with extra pepperoni not extra sauce. and i am not a big fan of thin crust pizza either. but if u r havin a beach party and you want pizza go here. its only 8 blocks away.
author: neil r.

description:
I was recommended to The Pizza Place by my co-worker and self-proclaimed 'pizza lover', so when she said this place is REALLY good and makes pizza the 'right' way (by using deck ovens, more on this to come) I had to accept her invite to share a pie.

I had to drive by two times before finding TPP, as there is no visible sign (it's on the corner of 46th and Noriega). We walk in and stand in the doorway for about 5 minutes before being greeted (waitress walks past us twice), which we don't mind as we were waiting for the rest of our party. We are finally acknowledged by gentleman behind the counter and he hands us menus and lets us choose our table. We sit down and peruse the menu, the delicious smell of yeasty-dough perfumes the air.

The menu offers a nice selection of 'specialty' pizzas, all sounding delicious with a nice array of toppings. We decide on the Iceburg Salad (Iceburg, Radish, Onion and Blue Cheese Dressing), Baker's Dozen of Buffalo Wings, Sunset Aloha (their version of a Hawaiian pizza with Capicola instead of Canadian Bacon and addition of feta) and the Dimitri (Sausage, Pepperoni and Garlic). 

Salad arrives quickly and is quite good. I'm not a fan of Iceburg, but found the salad crisp and the dressing VERY good. Buffalo wings are equally delicious-- good sauce ratio, not over-saturated, keeping the wings still crispy. 

Pizzas arrive and are served on risers, putting the pies just about eye-level (I'm 5'4", so if you are taller, you do the math), which is great because the pizzas look deeeeeeeelicious! I try the Sunset Aloha first and am really enjoying the Capicola, which has turned a little crispy from the wood-burning oven. The sauce is really delicious, not too thick, not too thin, just enough sweetness and acidity, good balance. The cheese is a high-quality cheese and was just hot enough. The crust is really delicious too, well-seasoned and not soggy or too crisp. From what I am told, they use a deck oven which slowly cooks the pizza from the bottom of the oven and as it gets higher and higher, gets hotter and hotter, creating a well-baked, perfectly golden brown and never burnt pizza. I am impressed!

The Dimitri is tasty as well, and for someone that doesn't care for sausage on pizza, I am really enjoying it. They crumble the sausage, which I believe is a high-quality Italian variety, which is rich in flavor and doesn't compete with the pepperoni. My only qualms with the pizza is that it is a LITTLE on the greasy side.

As a lover of classic NY pizza, I give this place 4 stars. It's not quite as good as pizza I've had in NYC, but it's delicious nonetheless. I would definitely recommend!
author: Status K.

description: Best most flavorful pizza i ever tasted! Also anyone wants to kick it up a notch, ask for the homemade ranch dressing. Gangster pizza spot!
author: Maurice T.

description: Two more visits and I'm liking it a whole lot better. No more complaints about the pizza. Everything was fine. The place can still be a bit noisy if it's full but it's a winner of a place in the neighborhood.
author: Sleepy T.

description: I'm so glad that two different friends recommended this place! We went for dinner with toddler in tow. And this pizza joint is fantastic for the casual, neighborhood pizza place that it is. The atmosphere is not fancy. But the wait staff was friendly, and the pizza was amazing. Very child friendly, although there were older couples and others as well. Good beers on tap at very reasonable prices. Also a small bar for singletons or couples. We will definitely be back!
author: Elizabeth J.

description: The staff is SO attentive and friendly!!! Its amazing. The pizza takes about 25 - 30 minutes to bake but it was delicious. We definitely don't have pizza like that in the peninsula. We had the spicoli (a little greasy) and the dimitri pizzas. The slices are huge and seriously as soon as I finished my drink I was asked if I wanted a refill. Also, I really appreciated their superclean bathroom. I just feel gross eating in a restaurant after using an unkempt gross bathroom and that was not the case here. I can't wait to go back :)!!
author: Jen Z.

description: Been once with friends.  We enjoyed everything.  I plan to go back.  The pizza was a little greasy and the sweet potato fries were a little over cooked, but all in all it was a very nice experience.
author: carleigh r.

description: I love their pizza, really juicyyyyy. Although I have tried their Iceberg salad and nearly threw up, straight up -- disgusting. Ive also tried their turkey sandwich, which is only served during a period of time and it was alright. To me, it was like Subway but with a stronger blend of tastes.
author: Vivian L.

description: Great "old school" pizza. We came here on a gorgeous day, sat out side, shared a pie/salad/olives and were very satisfied. If I want gourmet pizza and great service I'll go to Delfina. I was not here for either. All we wanted was a good ole no frills pizza to share and the outdoor seating was a big bonus.
author: lenka l.

description: I recently moved from the Mission to the outer outer Sunset.  I was depressed about my lack of food options by the Zoo.  Especially since Ha's closed, I can no longer stomach Mozerella di Bufalo (did they get new owners or something?), and riding my BMX to Arinelles on a Wednesday night after work is now out of the question.  Low and behold I discovered the Pizza Place.  My life is now more bearable.
author: Sofia M.

description: Really good pizza, great amber beer on tap, good sides/salads- love it when I go to a place and they take me seriously when I ask for the food to come up as quick as possible- toddler. My waiter last night- young dark haired fellow did it with a smile. Saturday night, busy- thanks pizza place.
author: andrea r.

description:
Hands down the nicest pizza i have ever had in San Francisco.

Atmosphere was fantastic, Everyone around was genuinely enjoying their food. We got the Sunset Aloha , ate a salad and sipped on beer while we waited. 

Disappointed they dont deliver but phone in orders are welcomed which is a plus. 

Prices are reasonable, cold beer on tap and pizza's are really TASTY!!!!
author: Cat G.

description: If you happen to find yourself hungry in the Sunset, this is a great place to go.  Or if you really want a great piece of pizza and are willing to go to the Sunset.  If you eat at the bar you can even swap stories with the locals.
author: Taylor S.

description: Sorry keiki's, I just didn't taste the magic. I was sorely disappointed after reading reviews in the paper. I would have given it 1 star but 2 because everyone deserves a second chance (except for OJ). I will return Pizza Place, I will return.
author: Alia D.

description: I really enjoyed this place each of the 5 times I've been there.  Good friendly chilled out place to go get a nice big hot slice of pizza.  Nice backyard if the sun is out.  Quality place to go relax for a bit.
author: jd h.

description: The  pizza here isn't half bad... although it was a bit too hot when served. The place seems really mellow and they got some good music playing. The wings were a bit crunchy which i don't like but it seemed fresh and spicy. I added another star for the cheap beer on tap.
author: kArlos A.

description: Nothing flashy, nothing great.  Just a solid pizza place near the beach.  The buffalo wings, cauliflower, salads, etc. etc. are also nothing to write home about - that's why this review is not being sent to my Mom.  But, the service was very good, and the environment is pleasant enough.
author: Tim G.

description: Why did it take me so long to finally come to The Pizza Place when its right in my old neighborhood!  gosh I've missed out on many pizza nights.  I absolutely love their crust! nice and crisp.  compared to other pizza joints their pizza is slightly more oily.  It did take awhile for the pizza to cook, but it was worth the wait.  the painted mural outside is pretty awesome.  I like the name too... it sorta confuses people. =D
author: Alice C.

description: Ironically i have not had their pizza yet. But their meatball sub is really delicious. I split it with my friend but it was too small to split and expensive. Still, if your looking for a nice pizza/subs and don't mind playing the extra price go for it.
author: Vespa Fox C.

description: nice low key place to hang out and have a meal
author: mister f.

description: This place totally rules! i loved the sweet potato fries, and i ate a whole dozen of chicken wings that put me into a coma for about 2 hours.  It was all worth it!  My server Danielle made my experience that much better.
author: janiece G.

description: Not only do I LOVE the entire staff @ The Pizza Place, the food is pretty darn good.  I don't get to venture out there as much as I would like to, but at times I find myself thinking about the sweet potato fries served with hot wing sauce and your choice of ranch or bleu cheese.  Of course their pizza is great, but to be honest I wouldn't mind just eating those sweet pot fries!  I highly recommend them.
author: Samantha R.

description: Good slightly-too-greasy pizza, and they serve beer. Crust is nice and thin. Staff is super friendly, as are the regulars at the bar. Very good when you're tired of Chinese food in the Sunset.
author: Rob T.

description: Great place to come after a surf session at OB, or with visiting friends/family.  Chill neighborhood atmosphere, cold beer on tap, delicious wings, decent salads.  Pizza is good, but greasy and after it sits a while it can get pretty soggy.
author: colin b.

description: Delicious pizza and an even better salad.  I loved the iceberg lettuce/blue cheese/bacon salad.  It's nice when a place puts so much effort into a side dish that other places just add because they feel like they have to offer a salad.
author: T T.

description: I really like their wings and sweet potato fries. Crispy, tender, with a nice dash of sauce for both.  I also like their thin crust, and for dessert, the rich decadent tiramisu. I'd love it more if the place weren't so damn noisy (the acoustics are just awful, with sound bouncing off the walls), and manage to avoid the parent meets that seem to be going on every time we manage to get there. Don't get me wrong, the kids are very well behaved.  It's the loud moms on their 2nd and 3rd pitchers of beer that are making all the ruckus, annoying the hell out of me. We got wise, started ordering for pick-up.
author: Ms. Q.

description: Nice spot for a pitchers and a pizza pie! I had the Eel River Organic beer and the Dimitri (pepperoni, sausage, mushroom, and I think olives and maybe something else). The beer was really good and the pizza was delicious. We also shared some of the buffalo wings which were really tasty. Definitely hit this place to warm up after your ob surf. Fun times.
author: Brian B.

description:
AMAZING pizza--though, the simple stuff is better than the stuff that's really loaded.  very nice staff, good beer selection, hardly ever a wait.  slices are expensive (as are all slices in sf), but the pies are reasonable.

i love this place.  frequent it!
author: annabel l.

description: It's about time the outer sunset got a GOOD pizza place. Too bad they don't order. Try their Greek pizza... feta, greek olives... delicious! A bit on the greasy side... but c'mon, it's pizza!
author: Martina B.

description: typical looking pizza joint...with bar and spacious seating. ordered the timmy's pie, some sweet potato steak fries, and buffalo wings. steak fries were so-so, a tad bit on the thick side. buffalo wings were meh, nothing to rave about. when the pizza came and i took a bite out of it i immediately had to wonder...how did this place make it onto chronicle's top 5 pizzas in the bay area list?! they commited the number one(imo) faux pas of pizzaism, SOGGY CRUST! Ewww! needless to say i was beyond disappointed. but hey, maybe you dig soggy crusts. if that's the case you would dig this joint.
author: Melissa Y.

description: So I live a few blocks from the pizza place, my 4th time here. I'm not in love with the place like everyone seems to be but I do like it. The very 1st time the pizza was REALLY greasy! The 2nd time it was good and I ordered the Sweet potato wedges and Buffalo wings also this time. The wings and homemade ranch is good. The Sweet Potato Wedges, uhh not the biggest fan, I wish they made skinny sweet potato fries instead or also! HINT HINT, Make them please! The 3rd time I got a slice of boring topping pizza to go, mushroom sausage, it was ok. Today I went for lunch because my friend was wanting to go for her 1st time. I ordered a slice of potato, bacon, and caramalized onion. I got red bell pepper,onion and bacon, they messed up my order. I was actually happy they screwed up, the red peppers were a nice touch! I have to say this was the BEST slice I've had there, crust was cooked real nice and Bacon does make everything taste better!
author: Karen T.

description:
When the waiter came to our table to check on us and asked how things were I said "This is the best fucking pizza I've ever had". 
I wasn't trying to be crass, and I wasn't drunk.. I'd only had half a beer... It was like the pizza was possessed and somehow the demon got into me... 
Maybe they should call it "no Pizza, only Zool". 
I was embarassed at first, but the waiter lit up like a child and said "WOW! That's the BEST compliment I've ever heard in this place!". 
He was stoked because he's proud of his job and has a good soul. Any pizzeria that can make their employees that proud to be a part of the action, gets my vote. And back to the pizza... I was possessed. Enough said. Five fucking stars.
author: J N.

description: Do you like grease? Lots of it. Better yet, overpriced grease! That's what you get there. I actually really enjoyed the mood of the joint and folks working there seemed to be cool and friendly. But the food? Meh. 50 bucks for two of their medium (the smaller of the two sizes) pizzas and a box of sweet potatoes is way too much. Ordered extra cheese - the thing tasted like it had 1/2 of the normal amount of cheese. Margherita? They probably have their own definition of the Margherita (tomato sauce + 1 kind of cheese). Oh, and did I mention the grease? Both pizzas were literally soaked in grease, from topping to crust, dripping oil if you were to lift the slice up. So, the place gets 1 star for the atmosphere, 1 star for cool staff and that's it, unfortunately.
author: Kirill U.

description: Yummy pizza--had a slice with spinach, mushrooms and roasted garlic and shared the sweet potato fries which were really good dipped in the hot sauce that they use for the buffalo wings. Also the beer I had was really tasty too--forget the exact name-- Eel something organic...
author: Mimi W.

description:
We happened upon this place after spending a day at the beach. My friend and I walked past looking for a place to use the bathroom. It looked pretty cool. Nice bar and the menu looked good. Said we would be back.

Well, we ended up going back early that afternoon with the hubby's and some friends after leaving the beach hungry. 

Have to say, the pizza was great. Thin crust, huge and mighty tasty. They also serve beer and wine and it just has a good comfortable neighborhood feel. 

We've been looking for a good pizza joint and finally nice to have one close! We'll be back. Saw someone eating those sweet potato fries and they looked damn good.
author: Mary D.

description: Pizza by the slice is suh a bonus... Pies are so damn expensive in this town and there is no way you can put oone of theirs down by yourself or even two.. enjoy a slice or two with a cold one and leave home happy!
author: phill h.

description: Thanks to these guys for giving real New York pizza to San Francisco. Thin crispy crust, right cheese to sauce ratio and pies cooked until they are actually done. The Sunset just keeps getting better and better!
author: Stacey L.

description: I have been here for the "Timmy's Pie," which is their vegan option.  It is pretty good, topped with tasty potato slices.  Yum. Baked to order, so it may take a while.   If you want faster service, you can call in advance (this doesn't apply to their regular cheese pizza, which can be bought quickly by the slice.)
author: jonny s.

description:
Living only a few blocks away, i find myself at this place at least once a week. It's a good atmosphere with great food. The pizza's amazing. When you order a large, it does get thin and a bit flimsy when hot...but the taste of the pizza is delicious. If you like your crust more crispy, order the medium...it can feed about 3 people. 
Personally, i find myself craving the spinach salad...SO good, and it's big enough to split with another person before the pizza comes! Onions, mushrooms, almond slices, dried cranberries, bacon bits....and my favorite part...the crumbled feta! (there may be more inside...) mmm, actually i think i'm going by my lonesome for dinner tonight, sit at the bar, drink a nice beer on tap, and enjoy the best spinach salad i've tasted.  
The service is very laid back...but it works out for the environment. Hands down, best pizza in the city.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Okay, I've been to this place at least a half dozen times in the brief time it's been open and have had nothing but great food and fantastic service. (It's right around the corner from me and I can assure you that every time I've been there I've not been under the influence of mind-altering chemicals--contrary to what some reviewers might suggest.) I also love pizza and have had it all over San Francisco: Pizza Place rates among my favorites.

I just went again last night and had the Besto pizza. Wow. Nice lemony hint. The pesto, the roasted peppers, potatoes and the feta were full of flavor and very nicely balanced. I had the Greek the time before and it was equally tasty. 

And for you vegetarians, the buffalo sweet potatoes are not to be missed. The spiciness of the sauce paired with the slight sweetness of the potatoes is a wonderful combination. 

Pizza Place is definitely worth your time and money.
author: Tom F.

description:
This place was okay - okay in the sense that the food was decent but service needs work and location is less from desirable. I've heard rave reviews from friends and recently in the local paper. I'm sympathetic to the fact that they've only been operating for the past 3 months. But there still are a few things that need to be worked out before I would consider visiting again.

Food - it filled my belly but not my soul. The pizza sauce was quite salty. It was good but it wasn't great. It's was missing something ... but I have to say - their large pizza is HUGE! 

Service - I've work in the food industry myself. But the inconstancy of being seated, getting utensils, flagging down your waiter to put in an order, in addition to a hour wait for the food. It can test most patron's patience. It was also noticeable that the to-go pizza orders were pushed out a lot quicker than the in house ones. Understandably it was a busy night, but staff was lost when issues arose for our table and the surrounding tables. Our waiter even mentioned to us how they've been overwhelmed and are still trying to find their groove.

Location - it's a trek out to the sunset but if you're in the neighborhood it's probably one of the very few restaurants that are decent. So I understand why my friends who live in the sunset are raving about it. 

All in all - if you're down near the outskirts of the sunset and willing to wait for a bit then it's a okay place to eat.
author: ava b.

description:
My buddy and I are real east coast snobs when it comes to eating pizza.
But we both agreed that Pizza Place makes damn good pizza.
We shared a cheese slice, the Spiccoli, and meatball grinder and a green salad. Pizza was SOOO GOOD!!!. What made it for me was the pizza sauce-wow what flavor and the pizza was well done which I like. The meatball grinder was good but not great, I think the meatballs were baked not fried so the meatballs were a little mushy but the meat tasted good, I just prefer the east coast style. I am coming back for the pizza!!!
Thanks Pizza Place and keep up the good work!!!
author: Angie H.

description: My first experience here was horrible.  Bad service and worse pizza.  I decided to give them a second chance, thinking I may have been unlucky.  My second visit was likewise terrible, the pizza was even worse than before, because I had ordered a veggie pizza the last time, this time only pepperoni, so there was nothing to soak-up the huge puddles of grease.  Still, I went back a third time, because I don't want to leave such a bad review on Yelp.  I stood around for nearly five minutes waiting for service, and the pizza was still greasier than a pig on an oil rig.
author: Guy I.

description: I am spoiled now, no other pizza satisfies me! I even went to Grimaldi's in Brooklyn recently, and honestly I like TPP better. My favorites are the margerite and just plain mushroom. Absolutely delicious.
author: L J.

description: The Pizza Place rules. Not just because it's the only hip/fun/lively restaurant in the Outer Sunset, but because the food is delicious! The people who work here are always friendly. The music is always rocking. The pizza is always good. They have a lot of different types of pizza on the menu, including a vegan option, but you can pretty much get any topping you could ever dream of putting on your pizza. The chicken wings have the most amazing sauce on them- almost addictive..sometimes, when i'm alone, i'll think about the sauce and....ANYWAY. The salads are fresh, and a small salad is definitely big enough for two people. I highly recommend their home-made blue cheese dressing. During the day they have a special lunch menu and the Save a Chicken sando is my favorite--its a fake chicken patty, but you would never know the difference. AND they pour a good pbr..if thats what your into.. thanks Pizza Place! Oh yea, love the Caprice Classic on the wall with the spinning PIZZA wheels.. nice touch and nice car choice.
author: Lindonesia S.

description: Food is marginal.  Service is ok if you can get them to acknowledge you at the bar.  Overall attitude is poor, unless you have a chain wallet and a skate board, or surf with the owners.  Pretty much a hipster only joint.  You can get a meatball sub, but you cant get a side order of meatballs......WTF?
author: K. S.

description:
oh man, jay, you beat me to being the first on this one.  
i've been living in the deep outer sunset for 13 years now and have seen alot of changes.  good changes i guess, unless you're trying to afford a house to buy out here.  i remember renting a top floor flat right on great highway for under $500/ month and seeing the waves without getting out of bed.  granted, there wasn't a taqueria within skateboarding distance.. but i digress...
i had a slice of the sunset aloha last night and found it met my east coast pizza snob expectations.  it's not surprising to read that one of the owners is originally from boston, a town where i spent a large part of my ramen noodle /pizza slice budget life.  east coast pizza just has that je ne sais quois.  this place also has chicken wings and has good beers on draft.  always a prerequisite for putting the joint in pizza joint.  it also can accomodate larger parties, it seems.  and i can imagine this place packed on one of our infrequent sunny saturday afternoons where weather and waves join forces and merge to produce a fine beach day.

yeah dude, thumbs up on this spot.  i shaka pizza.
author: Ed S.

description: I don't have a menu in front of me, but I've enjoyed the various pizzas that are served here.  The salad is pretty good too.  If you're waiting for your pie, I highly recommend ordering buffalo wings, inhaling those, then saving the plate it was served on and finish off the remainder of the sauce with your pizza crust.  Sure it may look uncivilized but its buffalo wing sauce - who doesn't like buffalo wing sauce?
author: Ryan K.

description: The pizza is GREAT but the service can be VERY SLOW and depending on the waitress it may come with an ATTITUDE. They will count you as a party of six and charge you an 18% grattuity even if the service is TERRIBLE and one memeber of the party is an 8 month old infant who isn't even eating off the menu.
author: Erika C.

description: This place is so close to perfect! I come and get pizza and beer and sit at their bar staring at the blank white wall.. this is thing #1 they could change. MURALS. They need murals on the inside as well as the outside. That'd be hot. Thing #2... stay open late... LATE. Pizza tastes best when consumed around midnight while shoveling scoops of delicious beer into myself. Don't get me wrong. This place rocks. The people are nice, the Besto pizza is Soooooo good. Especially when it's cooked a lot so the thin potato slices get crispy. That's a little bit of heaven in my mouth. But it'd be better if it were happening at midnight. I just moved here but the ocean neighborhoods seem to be lacking a chill go to place that's open late and has good food and drinks. This place could totally fill that niche. Delicious, down to earth food, good beer (could have a couple more options tho), and a badass location.
author: Alan N.

description: If you're an Outer Sunset resident you know there aren't a lot of options to be had for good food.  Thank God for this amazing local joint.  Gotta love the adorable owners, friendly staff and local surfers that flock here. The food is great. The pizza is AMAZING.  I tend to like simple food, so I'm a big fan of the always fresh mixed green salad, and the perfectly prepared cheese pizza.  It's nice to have the option to wash it all down with beers on tap or some good Italian wine.   My personal favorite is the car on the wall with spinning rims. Too bad they're closed Tuesdays, sometimes I can barely wait until Wednesday to satisfy my craving.  I kinda wish they'd deliver but the fact that they don't is also kinda what makes it so special!
author: Danae D.

description: Surfer pizza extraordinaire! I've been here several times, and haven't written a review until now because I just can't believe such a good pizza joint exists in my 'hood. Every time we've been there, whatever combo we have tried was excellent. They really know how to make pizza here and the specials are totally original. If you're a Californian surfer, or if you are just a California style pizza lover, check this place out. You can't go wrong. The crust is not too thick, nor thin, and just crispy enough. The combo specials are original and tasty. And they cook the pizzas to perfection every time. The only dig I'd give this place, and its a minor one, is that they should consider expanding their beer selection. Nothing like pizza and beer, and the choice is somewhat scarce.  I noticed the local surfers like to hang out at the bar. Maybe they should think about giving those dudes more brews to choose from to go with their "Spicoli"!
author: Rich M.

description: read about this place in theExaminer, and we went there tonight, it was fantastic.  We had the Rotten Roby, and a beer.  Was simply heaven.  The dough was hand rolled and seemed like all the ingredients were fresh.  Definately way out of the way but well worth the trip.  check this place out.
author: matt j.

description:
just finished a meal there and am really glad that i finally made it.  for a while, it seemed that the pizza place and i would never click.  on our first attempt at a date, i showed up at the right time but was a week early for a fundraiser that i was supposed to end.  our second attempt also ended in frustration...i showed up on the one day that they are closed.

well...she played hard to get but the wait was worth it!  i grew up in ny so while i lived in fl, pizza did not exist.  the bay area was refreshing but i quickly got jaded again and found most pizza places lacking again and longed for my roots.

not that i can call this true ny pizza.  it is somewhere in between that and pizza from somewhere like delfina.  the crust is thin but hardy and the toppings were well chosen for their quality and ripeness / freshness.

to me, this is not comparable to delfina or little star, but equally as good in it's own way...oh...and the fact that i give it 5 stars...it's about six blocks from my house, there was no line / wait involved and they serve by the slice.  the only downside for me was the beer selection..do you really need to have bud AND bud light in bottles?  and is really worth it to have canned guinness?  there are tons of great beers that would do far better in a quality place like this (cheap and not so cheap).  that said...wine is decent and reasonably priced.
author: RahBurt B.

description:
Bad Pizza, bad service, good wings. My sister said she'd seen this place and wanted to try it, so we went on a Wednesday night. We walked in, asked the waitress if we were to seat ourselves, then sat down after she confirmed. Despite knowing we were there, it took over 10 minutes for her to even get us a menu. After we got the menu, she was prompt in asking if we were ready to order. We wanted a little more time, she came back a few minutes later. Perfect timing. I ordered a slice with potato toppings, a coke, and an order of hot wings. The wait time for the food was reasonable, but the quality was not. The pizza had no sauce whatsoever. It was just crust, cheese, and sliced potatoes on top. It was worse than a Cosco pizza. The wings on the other hand, were delicious. Hot and crispy with hot sauce. They weren't smothered in sauce but there was plenty of sauce on the plate, so you could add more if you prefer. The waitress never came by while we were eating. I realized I was going to finish my coke before my food, so I drank the last 4th of the cup slowly. The waitress didn't even walk near our table, so we couldn't call her and ask for a refill. She eventually came by when we had finished eating. We asked for the bill and it was brought out promptly. I can say with confidence that I won't be going back there again.

The one plus side seemed to be the atmosphere. The place was lively on a Wednesday night, especially by the bar. I supposed if you are just going to drink, it would be a nice place. I think you'll probably get quicker service at the bar. If you plan to sit down and eat, I can't recommend this place. There are too many other pizza places in San Francisco for me to return anytime in the foreseeable future.
author: N B.

description: it's definitely a family place. Their pizzas crusts are thin, pretty good, their sweet potato steak fries are good, and I like to order the jalapeno  and anchovy pizza slice, it's good. their service is uneven, some of their staff are nice, some are cold.
author: Jie K.

description: i'm originally from outside new york, so i have unusually high standards for a perfect pizza. the slices were nice and big, the dimitri is pretty tasty- albeit a little spicy, and it was nice and greasy, but the crust was a little too crispy to fold which is a huge problem for me. it's a cute place, for sure. it's a little pricey though, so i don't know how often i'll get a pie from there.
author: Kristin L.

description: One of the best, if not the best pizza places in the city.  Only been there are few times, but we just moved around the corner, so we will certainly be regulars from now on.  The "Greek" pie was delicious, as was the Dmitiri.....we'll be sampling others in the coming weeks.
author: Leo S.

description: Ok, I have to say that I NEVER yelp anyone, but I really felt that I needed to say something about this place... My husband and I have been quite a few times and we really do like the food, BUT the attitudes of all of the waitstaff is awful! The server we had this time was good though.....However, The last time I went (a few days ago) was my last time! I took my 16 month old son in to grab a quick dinner and once the bill had arrived, my son was ready to go. After frantically looking for my wallet, I ran out to the car and i couldn't find it there either. I was freaking out at this point.. My husband was at work, my son was ready for bed, and I could not find my wallet. I ended up calling my brother for his credit card number because I didn't know what else to do. I gave it to the server, completely embarrassed by the fact that I had lost my wallet. A few moments later the owner had come over and told he that, "they don't do business like that". I was shocked and even more embarrassed. After I told her my story, I told her that I just needed to run around the corner to my house and check for my wallet and that I would be right back. She looked at me as if I was scamming her and said, what are you going to give me for collateral?" I told her that all I had was a diaper bag with Diapers and wipes. Then she asked me if I had an ID. HELLO!!! I'M FREAKING OUT BECAUSE I CANT FIND MY WALLET, WHICH HAS MY ID IN IT!!!
