I JOKINGLY said unless you want to hang out with my son. she rolled her eyes and said, ya right and I told her that I was just kidding. when she hesitantly took my cell phone as collateral I hurried home and found my wallet (thank goodness) on the garage floor. I must have dropped it while loading up the car. I went back and paid, and she still wasn't very friendly. I was super apologetic and clearly humiliated and she still gave me nothing, not even a smile. Needless to say, I will not be going back, which is a bummer because a neighborhood place like that cant afford to loose the locals. especially during these economically tough times.
author: desiree k.

description: the past couple of weekends i've been in for a late lunch the place has been real busy, which is fine if they had more than one guy running the show.  he's good but, there's just too much.  they should celebrate their popularity and get him help.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: ooooh yum. Definitely my faaaavorite pizza joint. The Rotten Robbie is so good. The meathead is good as well. Their pizzas are thin and super tasty. The atmosphere is low-key and fun and the staff is easy going.
author: E C.

description: This was the worst pizza dining experience I have had in my 8 years living in San Francisco. I give it 1 star for the power being on for the duration of our stay. Service was horrible, we waited over 45 minutes just to be seated and then ended up seating ourselves. After ordering a simple cheese pizza, we waited another hour to get the pizza. We kept telling ourselves the wait must be worth it since the restaurant was packed but were sorely disappointed when we received the pizza. It was greasy and bland, and the crust tasted like cardboard. Poor food combined with poor service 2 Thumbs Down. I only wish I could give this place a big fat 0 Stars.
author: Bob D.

description: Finally a decent pizza place in the Sunset.  We got there Large Margherita and man it is huge!!  Great thin crust.  No delivery and parking is pretty unavailable, but once inside, a decent place to grab a slice and a brew.  I'm stoked....now if only we had an awesome burrito shop!
author: W P.

description: Amazing service, Anchor Steam on Tap, abundant amount of cheese and a rad atmosphere. This is a local favorite and just a short walk from, the beach. I cant wait to return.
author: robyn k.

description: pizza was good. we had the timmy's pie, which was a vegan pizza. the slices were huge! soooo yummy. the sweet potato fries were pretty delish as well. friendly staff and really chill atmosphere...everything that your neighborhood pizza place should be.
author: Linda N.

description: great place to get pizza pies . love that Rotten Robbie. would say it's a bit far out there. but they were expanding with the store next door. would bike back there soon.
author: Henley N.

description:
i like to call it " i chaka pizza," thanks to the painted awning...
don't come here if you have someplace to be... it takes a super long time for anything to happen. but that's okay by me, just keep those pitchers coming! 
The pizzas are frickin HUGE! it's kind of amazing. we ordered one with our own toppings and were stoked to find capers on the menu... capers and feta... mmmmm! we were dying when we ordered it, though cuz the waiter looked at us like we were mad- 
"capers?" he said. 
i pointed them out , "yeah, they're right here on the menu..." 
"whoah!" he said incredulously, "i've worked here for two years on no one's ever ordered capers before!"
priceless!
pie was amazing (love the thin, crispy crust!) and i was mesmerized by the pizza wheel car on the wall.
not a big fan of the sweet potato fries, though... they're steak cut and it's weird. they're way too big... it was like eating a quarter of a s.p. with each fry. dipping sauce was super good.
definitely will be going back. 
chaka.
author: saraH c.

description: first things first ... the family behind the pizza are warm and friendly and hey PBR on tap, i digging this place ... pizza okay, salad okay, dependable, huge space, alot to room to grow, thank you from a long time resident for returning the space which housed a hardware store and a deli to a time where service and depenable food is the norm and not the add on ...
author: tim y.

description: i really like pizza.  in fact, i consider it to be the most perfect food ever created.  i could eat pizza everyday, except for my fear of getting chubby, which is a whole different story.  nevertheless, the pizza here was alright.  it was kinda salty, and coming from me, that's saying something, because i ain't scared of salt or anything.  so, pizza place on noriega...work on your sauce, and maybe i'll come back.
author: Miss P.

description:
I've just tried The Pizza Place for the second time, as my first experience wasn't that great.  The staff is very nice, but extremely overworked.  We sat ourselves and waited about 10 minutes to be acknowledged.  Luckily, we didn't have anywhere to go afterwards, so we weren't in a hurry.  We ordered the Aloha pizza. The outside crust was thin and crispy, exactly the way my husband loves it, but the rest of it was quite floppy and a bit greasy.  We also had the warm spinach salad which was surprisingly delicious.  Unfortunately, they don't serve milk for children and they have self serve water.  I watched one of the servers replace the water jug and no ice was added to cool it, ending up in lukewarm water for my daughter and me.  Overall, it took about 50 minutes to get the pizza on the table.  I'd say the staff is very nice, but should really learn to greet people as they walk in the door and try to be more attentive (hard to do when the house was full and the waitress is running around trying to make everyone happy).  

I just can't see what the draw of this place is.  It's true that it looks like a surfer hangout, a place for beach dwellers to kick back and hang out at the bar.  When we went all the tables were taken, so I guess that tells you something.  In reading all the other reviews on the place, I'd say it is highly overrated!  The pizza is just good, the service is just good and the atmosphere is an acquired taste.
author: Luana L.

description: check the health departments website for information on Noriega pizza, if you do...I guarantee you will never eat here again.
author: matt c.

description: I love this place. It's unpretencious and a fun place to go with friends for some yummy pizza. I always get a Timmy's Pie with ham and cheese...sorry for the twist vegans!
author: Lina L.

description: this place is great, besides the pizza being fucking amazing! the people are cool as shit, every time. and i won't forget to mention the gorgeous men making the pizza. very nice work. thank you for simply being.
author: cajeta c.

description: i only ordered a pepperoni to go. no good. maybe they have better stuff on the menu. i am going to give them a second chance...its just i think if you name yourself after a dish, it should be your specialty.
author: Delta d.

description: After seeing the reviews in here I thought I would give it a try. I really like thin crust pizza. Let me rephrase, I really like good italian-style thin crust pizza. I got the veggie pizza. I waited the thirty minutes, which I thought was an awfully long time to wait for a pizza considering there was nobody in the restaurant. But what the heck, I will always give a place a chance. To my extreme disappointment however, the pizza was NOT good! It wasn't inedible, but considering that it wasn't cheap and that I was not hard to please at the moment because I was STARVING, I expected much better. I can't put my finger on exactly what it was but the pizza tasted off. The one thing that I do know attributed to the gross taste was the crust. It was crispy, which I can appreciate, but this was a stale, hard-to-eat crispy, not good, been-in-an-oven-for-a-while crispy! I will not return here or recommend!
author: Rod B.

description: We had a great time tonight at the bar at this little out of the way place.  We couldn't decide on a pizza, so the bartender hand picked a pizza and a bottle of wine for us!  We had a yummy crunchy pie with ricotta cheese, red bell peppers and bacon and a bottle of this new Italian wine she just got in.  (i think she's the wine buyer or owner or something? ) Oh my god, soooo good.  Super unpretensious place.  Pretty loud, although it was really crowded when we were in there.  We really felt like we got taken care of and got to taste the delicious pies these people make.  The pizza took a while, but it was busy and it's a Friday night, so who cares, right?  We will go back for sure, just wish it wasn't so far from our house.
author: Babs B.

description: tasty pizza...comfortable setting...waiter with a smile...life is good
author: saroj y.

description: Perhaps one of the best pizza places in San Francisco! I'm a huge fan of NY style pizzas. I've been here twice and absolutely love their "Dimitri" and "Rotten Robby" pizzas. The "Rotten Robby" has just the right amount of "kick."
author: My N.

description: My family has eaten here about 10 times since this place opened last year.  Before our last visit, I would have given it 10 stars but now I will give them 4 and I will tell you why.  We usually order sweet potato fries, salad and margherita pizza.  The margherita pizza is THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD ANYWHERE.  The service is usually fantastic.  We have brought many friends and family here and everyone leaves happy.  The last visit was about two weeks ago.  We met a friend and one of her sons.  While we were waiting for them to arrive we decided to place the order as the place was getting very busy.  It was a Monday night around 6 p.m.  We ordered 2 orders of sweet potato fries, 1 large margherita pizza and 1 med. veggie pizza.  The music was loud, actually it was way too loud.  The customers where yelling at each other to be heard.  I asked the server if it was possible to turn down the music (our friends kid is sometimes sensitive to loud noise).  Her response was "the volume fluctuates sometimes" - huh??  Our friends arrived, it was still excruciatingly loud - the fries arrived - yum.  We were all happily munching our fries.  The pizza then arrived.  The margherita was delicious as usual.  But the veggie was disgusting.  It was so overloaded with stuff it was wet and soggy.  Between the 6 us we barely ate two slices.  I told the server it was bad but she just asked it we wanted to take it to go.  We ate the entire margherita pizza and all the fries so none of us left hungry.  I just sort of felt like I had wasted an extra 17 bucks on a pizza we just threw into the trash.  Don't get me wrong, I will go back because the margherita pizza is just to good.  As a matter of fact we are going back in a couple of weeks with some friends we introduced the place to last summer.  We will just have to order a little more wisely.
author: Stephanie G.

description: crust is perfectly crunchy, staff is really nice (not in a 'welcome to applebee's' sort of forced way), and the price is fair.
author: N C.

description: Since I have moved to SF i have been disappointed with pizza in this city but I really enjoyed The Pizza Place!  The first thing I noticed was the sauce.  Nice strong rich flavor.  I am a fan of crispy crust and they did not disappoint.  I will definitely be back for seconds!
author: Bryna K.

description: We had half Dimitri and half pesto. The pizza is really good but a little overpriced. It is great to have a pizza place that is reliable with good atmosphere in the outer sunset.
author: Wendy D.

description: When this first opened, my friends and family loved it. However, it has gotten too popular for its own good.  Now the noise level is insane and eardrum damaging, the crust is sometimes burnt, and when the manager (at least we think she's the manager or one of the owners) is the waitress, she's really rude, brusque and not nice. Friends uniformly agree. Kind of a bummer when you're paying good money.  The other servers are really nice though.  Proceed with caution
author: priya k.

description: After reading the reviews on Yelp and the Chronicle, I was expect more and maybe that's the reason for the let down. The restaurant was busy for a Wednesday night (good sign), but I knew when we were in trouble when after signing in for the wait list when the staff didn't even check for the next 15 minutes. I then tried to order slices to go and had difficulty even getting someone's attention--at least the kitchen staff was friendly and agreed to get my slices started in the oven. Pizza slices were tasty, similar to a NY slice, but lacked the flavor punch a bit and the crust was somewhat disappointing. I'll try it again if I'm ever in the neighborhood but wouldn't seek it out.
author: Jolene Y.

description: I read about this place place recently and couldn't wait to try it out as my husband and I were both born and raised in New England. We've been out here collectively 30 years and have never found a pizza place that quite did it for us, Amici's probably being the closest. One bite into the pizza and we both felt right at home. Wicked good pizza, low maintenance environment. Everyone is super nice. The one downside was the wait for a pizza was an hour plus at 6:15 pm...the reason for 4 stars, not 5.
author: deb h.

description:
great pizza.  freshest ingredients in town for pizza...and they get my vote especially because they use fresh jalapenos instead of pickled!

great salads, cold beer on tap, great atmosphere, always good tunes playing on the stereo, down near the ocean.  what more can one ask for?

it's become my favorite neighborhood pizza joint in town.
author: Rob S.

description: good pizza, not great pizza.  pricey for what you get.  excellent crust.  low quality toppings.  OK place to go IF you had to eat out by the beach.
author: dan s.
